story:
Short Summary

  • I am a electronic developer and have my own day job, But, also I have a big hobby :-) I am a hobby programmer at my free time.
  • Currently I stuck with all materials and need money to continue development. This money will go to artists and team of programmers which can finish the game with a good quality. 
  • If you would help me, I would help you to use all materials you have and keep you updated. 

Communicate with us about global business problems @

Global crisis unspecified

What We Need & What You Get


A bit story behind the game.

Sound version... 

...  Welcome to "The Trojan Gambit Inc." (On screen a crowd of workers marching with hammers at the ready.) Our company is creating the future with the introduction of advanced technologies. No one possesses such technologies, even the evil neighbor syndicates. Do not go to work for them, they trick you and take away your money!

If you work with us – the only one losing money will be us, and for you only! Anyone can find his happy place with us. You will be provided excellent working conditions. We have wise engineers, experiences supervisors and skilled workers to perform all the necessary dirty work for you (on the screen engineers, managers and workers are performing a polka dance).

Our company is like one big happy family. You will be taught to effectively use a machine tool, to get an ego-boost on account of negligent robotic cleaners and to prove your superiors that you were right. Our guards will protect you from neighbor company’s attacks or from meteorite fall (see asterisk one). The employment costs you 9.99 cyber-credits (see asterisk two). Dress pretty and charge your cyber implants, or, better even, bring a spare one – in case you’ll want to work a bit more and your old ones fail.

* Protection from falling meteorite is due to the total extinction of all dinosaurs on the planet, regardless of their existence.

** The Corporation does not guarantee social allowances, promotion, respect, wages and employment.




A bit of art and desc

Engineer


The facility's staff engineer is a woman which wears exoskeleton. She knows how to reprogram cyborg bodies,  fix them and enable external power supply systems. Exoskeleton needs to be connected to the actual facility's power supply system. Internal power does not last for long. The engineer is constantly pissed-off and tired. She is working non-stop for the last five days with short sleeping cycles, because her manager thinks that on the western wall “conductors are not placed in a straight line” and “electrical power of electrical balance can get shorted by electromagnetic radiation”. All engineers are tenderly called “Cinderella”, which also is carefully stated on exoskeletons manipulators.



Mom (Mother)

Some time ago Virts mom went to battle with neighbour syndicate to acquire living space. She is an extra-class specialist in infiltration and take over operations. During one of operations she lost her eye and replaced it with laser sight. She is able to use a knife either for killing or chopping cabbage with equal elegance and effect. After many years of hard work she retired and came back home in order to raise her family (raise children or to be (to spend time) with her family). She does not love her son, Virt, for he is a slacker who spends all his time in playing computer games. She loves her kitchen, rumors and TV with culinary channel.



Chargeable security unit with electro collector (CSUWEC)


“Gambit” security department is heavily understaffed. As a solution for the problem one of the engineers came up with electro collector with microchips which alters behavior. Theoretically, this device should have made its bearer much stronger due to electrical power collection and its usage for increasing power of cybernetic bodies. The unsolvable problem arose, when one of the programmers got fired and the behavior model got out of order. Trying to solve this problem and save money, the program was sent to syndicate with cheap workforce. There it was altered and integrated with elk behavior model. This electro collector was put on volunteer worker, which was randomly selected by a manager, in order to perform tests. There is only one such specimen and it is a prototype.


There are few videos which can help you understand what is the current status of development.

AGK PRJECT SAMPLES STEALTH

LEADWERKS ENGINE SAMPLES

A bit of screenshots

FIGHT

Second part of this game is fighting. You can use your camouflage to get close to the enemy and start to fight against him.





  • Whole game currently run on AGK, but tested visually on Unity and Leadwerks. I will keep you updated.
  • If I don't reach my goal, I will continue to develop the game as good as I can but you will have all rewards anyway, because I also make this as a hobby :-) Money I need only to improve quality.


Tutorials

Here is tutorials that can explain how to run game on different kind of devices (android, mac, ouya, etc), created in AGK (App Game Kit). Process is very simple.

You will be provided excellent working conditions. We have wise engineers, experiences supervisors and skilled workers to perform all the necessary dirty work for you (on the screen engineers, managers and workers are performing a polka dance).Our company is like one big happy family. You will be taught to effectively use a machine tool, to get an ego-boost on account of negligent robotic cleaners and to prove your superiors that you were right. Our guards will protect you from neighbor company’s attacks or from meteorite fall (see asterisk one). The employment costs you 9.99 cyber-credits (see asterisk two). Dress pretty and charge your cyber implants, or, better even, bring a spare one – in case you’ll want to work a bit more and your old ones fail.* Protection from falling meteorite is due to the total extinction of all dinosaurs on the planet, regardless of their existence.** The Corporation does not guarantee social allowances, promotion, respect, wages and employment.A bit of art and descEngineerThe facility's staff engineer is a woman which wears exoskeleton. She knows how to reprogram cyborg bodies,  fix them and enable external power supply systems. Exoskeleton needs to be connected to the actual facility's power supply system. Internal power does not last for long. The engineer is constantly pissed-off and tired. She is working non-stop for the last five days with short sleeping cycles, because her manager thinks that on the western wall “conductors are not placed in a straight line” and “electrical power of electrical balance can get shorted by electromagnetic radiation”. All engineers are tenderly called “Cinderella”, which also is carefully stated on exoskeletons manipulators.Mom (Mother)Some time ago Virts mom went to battle with neighbour syndicate to acquire living space. She is an extra-class specialist in infiltration and take over operations. During one of operations she lost her eye and replaced it with laser sight. She is able to use a knife either for killing or chopping cabbage with equal elegance and effect. After many years of hard work she retired and came back home in order to raise her family (raise children or to be (to spend time) with her family). She does not love her son, Virt, for he is a slacker who spends all his time in playing computer games. She loves her kitchen, rumors and TV with culinary channel.Chargeable security unit with electro collector (CSUWEC)“Gambit” security department is heavily understaffed. As a solution for the problem one of the engineers came up with electro collector with microchips which alters behavior. Theoretically, this device should have made its bearer much stronger due to electrical power collection and its usage for increasing power of cybernetic bodies. The unsolvable problem arose, when one of the programmers got fired and the behavior model got out of order. Trying to solve this problem and save money, the program was sent to syndicate with cheap workforce. There it was altered and integrated with elk behavior model. This electro collector was put on volunteer worker, which was randomly selected by a manager, in order to perform tests. There is only one such specimen and it is a prototype.There are few videos which can help you understand what is the current status of development.AGK PRJECT SAMPLES STEALTHLEADWERKS ENGINE SAMPLESA bit of screenshotsFIGHTSecond part of this game is fighting. You can use your camouflage to get close to the enemy and start to fight against him.







Whole game currently run on AGK, but tested visually on Unity and Leadwerks. I will keep you updated.
If I don't reach my goal, I will continue to develop the game as good as I can but you will have all rewards anyway, because I also make this as a hobby :-) Money I need only to improve quality.





Tutorials
Here is tutorials that can explain how to run game on different kind of devices (android, mac, ouya, etc), created in AGK (App Game Kit). Process is very simple.

story:
"Its world is nothing short of eye candy"
"The game's character designs are where it truly shines"
-Gamezebo.com

"I’m in love with this game’s visuals!"
-Beefjack.com

"Every now and then an awesome looking game comes around, such as King Voxel."
-Babysoftmurderhands.com

"One of the coolest features I found is the world generator."
-Examiner.com

"You got me with the laser glasses!"
-Darkstation.com

"King Voxel is hot, hot, HOT! Dare I say better than Zelda and Minecraft combined!"

-Leckerklecker.com

I'm Phillip Meyer the creator of the upcoming PC game King Voxel.  I am creating an action adventure game that captures the magic of some of my favourite classic games "Adventure" on the Atari 2600 and "The Legend of Zelda".  King Voxel features a unique cel shaded voxel graphics engine, a world generator, and dynamic camera controls.

I'm giving you the opportunity to immortalize yourself or anything interesting or important to you with a photo that goes into the Voxelot Royal Art Museum located in the king's castle at the start of the game.  This picture will be a part of the game forever!

 

A king who fights like a warrior poet!

A TON of treasures!

TONS of monsters!

TONS of adventures!

 

 

The music is composed by industry veteran Mike Keogh!  Check it out!

 http://www.mike-ok.com/2013/03/king-voxel-music-previews.html

 

Developing a complex video game is extremely time consuming and therefore an expensive venture.  I need community support to spread the word of this project and fund the last stretch of the development and testing.

If you buy the museum photo perk you will help fund the project and you can leave your mark in a great video game!  I'm hoping King Voxel will become a classic game that people fondly look back on in the years to come.  Your photo will be seen and admired (or puzzled over) by gamers all over the world for years to come!

*I plan to distribute the game through Desura and/or Steam.

 

If I raise $40k with this campaign then after King Voxel is done and released I will make a King Voxel documentary youtube video for everyone to enjoy!  I built King Voxel, the tools, the rendering engine all pretty much from scratch!  It's been an incredible journey and if I can afford to spend the time on it I'd love to share the story of King Voxel with a heavy emphasis on the technical aspects of the game.  Aspiring game programmers will learn a lot!  I'll try to keep it visual and entertaining so people dont get bored, but there will be math and even some code!

 

I love classic and retro video games!  If King Voxel is a success it will allow me to continue to develop more retro styled games!  My head is full of ideas for future games!  If you like the work I'm doing please support it with a contribution or by spreading the word.

 

You can still support this project without spending a dime!

  • Please tell your friends about this campaign!

  • Please upvote this game on Steam Greenlight: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=115309930

  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Le projet en français ici

Who am I ?

I am a freelance graphic designer and illustrator. I started my own company in 2010, drawing comics and design products before I turned towards eSport. After realizing a few Starcraft fanarts like the Propaganda serie, my style catched the professional eSport world's attention. I now create posters, logos, T-shirts... for official tournaments, progaming teams and websites, with prestigious partners like the GSL, Fnatic, Startale, FXOpen,Millenium, The Meltdown and Team Liquid. Now eSport is both my passion and my job. 

What's my project ?

I still draw for my own pleasure and from my personal inspiration: portraying my favourite players, designing posters for fun... I often receive messages on forums or facebook, asking me if it's possible to buy these somewhere.

Why not sharing my creations with all the eSports fans ? I decided to open a gear online shop to produce boys and girls shirts, players jerseys, clothing, mouse-pads, bags, phone cases... anything a goog geek need ! You'd like a Grubby shirt ? A zergy hat ? A Colossus under your pants ? Take a look at the pictures I made for test. 

 

The products will be related to Starcraft 2, league of legends and other games and also casual gamers themed and cool graphics creations.

Worried about doing things officially, the point of this project is also to get approvals from teams, players and also Blizzard for the products. A lot of work has been already done for this purpose and I'm starting to get good results.

 

Another part of this project is to create personalised commissioned products for the regular customers, for the teams or the leagues. 

How the funds will be used ?

That's where I need you. I would like to control any step of the fashioning, so I'm going to produce and send every object by myself.  My goal is clear: cool designs on high quality products. I want to make astonishing articles, with beautiful colours, precise lines and style.  

 
I've already hired someone to help me for production and found suppliers. These days I'm getting in touch with professional gamers to negotiate private image agreements. I launch this project to buy the printing equipment I will use. After a long thinking, comparison and tests, talking with industrialists, I choose "thermal sublimation" technology to realize my products, a process that allow printing of  every plane supports, no matter what material I'll use, and guaranty a very good quality for printing (colours are melted to the material for the textiles) .
We already have the local and the skills to do this. But I still need a A3 special printer, a thermal press, specific paper and ink and the basic clothing to start. 

Controlling myself the production will have several advantages :
- Configure colours, for them to be as close as possible to the design
- printing on a much larger area (A3) than random shirts 
- Create original ways to print on shirts, like printing logos on the sleeves, on the sides...
 

Why helping (and how to).

Electronic Sports is not only a hobby or a business, but also a lifestyle. We admire pro-gamers, spend our nights on the ladder, and never miss a GSL match. Why should not we do that with the perfect outfit ? After all, geek is the new chic. If you want to get involved, you can help me raising the funds and get a reward. But you can also talk about the "Good Geek Gear" Project with your friends and family, share it everywhere on the web, write a poem about it, tattoo the logo on your forehead (or maybe not), and everything else you can imagine ! 
 
 

 Updates: 

03/11: New design to celebrate Heart of the Swarm Launch ! 

03/19/2013: New contest for all our contributors (past and future) !

Find me: 

    

My Team Liquid Thread

My eSport Book

My drawings and comics

story:
The history

 

 

Citizen 404 emerges from the idea of showing how hard is hacking, of being a "Hero", propose new ways to play with the environment, show the player the process and time that can take him. During the creative process, we made a lot of changes before we could get to the solid idea that we got now, and all the team has been involved on this, we added a lot of details, and we discussed the design of all characters, their personalities, names and physical look. After all that, we have a clear idea of what we want fo Citizen 404, what we want to represent and the public we want to reach.
 

What's the game about?

 

 

 

The game will be a third person shooter, using mechanics of hacking in order to move easy on the enviroment and incapacitate enemies, the main idea of the game, is showing the hacking via a variety of minigames, that are hard and entertaining.

 

 

The history is about Clint Blackmount, better know as Citizen 404, who after losing his family, joins a team of "Heroes" and get training, that way, he can fight any type of danger on his way. On the history, you will see how he and his team lose the control of the situation, and he's forced to take decisions and make missions against his will, and avoid things go worse.

 

 

We need to make this game awesome, and here is when you enter. Your help is extremely important, we don't have the resources to make a project like this.

 

 

You define if this game see the light, is your collaboration what give us the needed resources to make the game.

 

 

Also, we have planned that if we find extra money, we will use it to add more content to it, so who knows what content we will add on the future, after all, the sky is the limit!

 

Rewards

We've planning the rewards for a long time, we think on what could be good for the collectors, gamers, and others, we made a lot of rewards for those who want to see how is the game going, people who wants personalized characters, and all type of stuff, some of them are limited because is hard to make it, so go for them before they get claimed!
 

The inversion

We know that you care about where's your money going, so we made this diagram for you

As you can see, there is a lot of money that is going to the payment, this payment is for the professionals that are working with us, the software is for the licenses of the software that we are going to use, after, there is "Emergency Money" this money will be used to replace any damaged computer or other that can appear, and the equipment is furniture and hardware that we need

Funding tiers

The work we have made for the game

We are working on a demo and making a lot of things for the game, here you have what we have made so far:
 

 weapons for the character (2.500 polys each one)

Concept art for one the scenes

Early Concept art for one of the enemies

 

In-Progress concept art

https://youtu.be/_5fhnl7qnIM

https://youtu.be/YF8cbPHh_RA
OST for the game

In-progress scene.

Cinematic for a mission

Finished scene for one of the missions

Other ways to help

You can always share with your friends this indiegogo link, share the name of Citizen 404, Midnight Studios or others, any help will be great!
 

A concept demo will be available soon.

story:
Elliot Quest. Which feature some of the loveliest pixel animation I’ve seen in a while. Deceptively simple looking, it’s not just yet another pixel platformer – this is an open-world game, to be completed as you wish, along with spells, inventory, puzzles and the like. And there’s a demo too. And it’s tops.

- John Walker, Rock, Paper Shotgun

 

 

VIDEO PITCH

 

Game progress and updates at ansimuz.com

An 8-bits epic adventure like the Good Old Days

Elliot Quest is an adventure / exploration Zelda style game. Defeat all 4 Elements Guardians and acquire their powers. Explore Urule Island in search for treasures and artifacts, earn money and experience by defeating enemies.

The game is a metroidvania or zeldania heavily inspired in Zelda 2 (i like this one in the series). In brief you have to defeat 4 guardian (bosses) get their power and fight final evil or Good, depends on you.

I've been working on the game since Jan 2013 Full time and want to continue doing so, but for that i need your funding. Follow my devblog and find out what the progress of the development.

The game is made using ImpactJS engine so i can deliver the game in a webrowser platform along others platforms such Windows, Mac, Linux and OUYA.

FEATURES

  • Well balanced gameplay, easy to pick up, challenging to master
  • Open world to explore. Go and finish the game directly or explore to complete the 100%
  • Defeat 4 guardians, 5 bosses, 4 Notorious monsters and one final boss
  • Different magic attacks for different enemies, Not all enemies have the same weakness or resistances
  • Make bonus drop rate chains by defeating enemies wisely on time
  • Level Up System, build your character according to your play preferences
  • Karma System. You get a different final depending on your actions
  • Special areas only accesible by acquiring hidden crystals
  • Shops and townsfolk around the world will help you
  • Minimap system for all areas (as in metroid), never get lost again
  • Fight Notorious monsters and get special rewards
  • Puzzles, hidden paths and easter eggs
  • 9 Original Music Tracks from Michael Chait listen to them https://soundcloud.com/michael-chait-music/sets...

Recent Videos

Image Gallery

 

Explore a vast world and find hidden treasures

Tons of different enemies just showing some of them

There's a lot of tools, items and easter eggs to collect in order to get a 100% of the game.

Get the perk that includes the official instruction booklet with hand drawn (wacom) illustrations made by me

 

I am doing all the game by myself except from the music, that was made by Michael Chait a young composer from New York.

Listen to the music at Soundcloud.com

My Name is Luis Zuno i've been a web designer & Developer since 1999 and have a passion videogames specially zelda and rpgs such final fantasy and Dragon Quest (So... expect a game mix from those titles).

I have made minor games in the past using flixel (flash Game Framework) But Elliot Quest is my most ambitous project. and its made on Impactjs. 

YOUR HELP

The game is 40% done and i need money to finish it. Your funds will help me pay the expenses. Making a game is so much work (even for 2d games). 

Some of the things tha i will use the money for:

1. Food for me and my family (including baby Elliot)

2. Bills for the rent, internet and such.

3. Music composing and software licenses

PERKS

With great money comes great responsibility. Having more money i have the freedom to work more on the project.

6,000

Release of the game for MAC, WIN AND LINUX

11,000

Release of the game for OUYA

14,000

Better Sound Fx, Music, and will retouch graphics improve animation, Better PDF Booklet

The character is based on my little boy named Elliot. Meet him:

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't invest money on my game but you want to help please spread the word! Don't underestimate the power of your voice to help make this game a reality.

Additionally you can vote up at steam greenlight it cost no money and you will help me greatly:

story:
QANDA

 

HOW MANY OF US GET TO REALIZE OUR DREAMS?

According to a recent study of lifelong ambitions, most of us will only ever fulfil five of our dreams. What’s on your bucket list? Which 5 will become real for you?  Would you like to help others while staying out of the limelight?  Can you imagine the impact on someone’s life by allowing them a little more happiness; a little more money; a little more freedom; a little more enjoyment?

 

My dream is to help other people to achieve more of their dreams.  A phrase attributed to a motivational speaker struck a chord with me; he said, ‘You Can Get Everything You Want In Life If You Will Just Help Enough Other People Get What They Want’.  Believe it to be true, and our goal is within reach.

 

Another beacon, is a short poem attributed to an anonymous author; it reads, ‘We Have Each Been Given A Bag Of Tools, A Formless Rock And A Book Of Rules, And Each Must Make, ‘Ere Life Has Flown, A Stumbling Block Or A Stepping Stone’. 

 

We all have a passion for something; people, places, ideals and things in life:  In small but meaningful ways, we benefit by enriching the lives of others through anonymous giving; often nothing more than doing a selfless act of kindness for a deserving fellow human being without any recognition or glory.

 

We can’t fix all of the world’s problems but what if we  believe that helping as many people as possible will cause a ripple effect, and what if those who we are able to help will pay it forward and help someone else, then maybe, in time, we will all live in a better place.  To do this, not for the recognition, but to make the world a better place by leaving a legacy of a stepping stone instead of a stumbling block. 

 

This is a request for a “helping hand”; to improve lives, by making a contribution to build an enterprise that will become self-sustaining, and capable of benefitting countless others.  Structured properly it will self-perpetuate and continue to do good.  It is a fundamental concept used by every government in the world; collect a small amount of money from the many and apportion it based on a redistribution plan. 

 

The social conscience component of this enterprise is critical to its DNA, since it is a concept built on humanity and capitalism.  We have already acted as the catalyst with a contribution of £30,000 to acquire the hardware and software; we are seeking £25,000 from the followers of Indiegogo, which will be supported with another £30,000 of bank debt financing and a final £30,000 of equity investment from a third party.  This completes the budget of £115,000 to launch the venture on solid footing.  Now that you have grasped the philosophical soul of the enterprise; let me share the mechanics and nuances of the business model with you.

USE OF THE FUNDS

The budget calls for £115,000 to be allocated as follows in the table below:

 

HARDWARE, SOFTWARE AND WEBSITE

£30,000

PAID

MARKETING SPLASH

£25,000

REQUIRED

3 MONTHS OF OPEX

£30,000

REQUIRED

5 MONTHS OF NEGATIVE CASH FLOW

£30,000

REQUIRED

TOTAL

£115,000

£80,000 REQUIRED

NEW BANK DEBT AND EQUITY FUNDS

£60,000

£30,000 BANK

£30,000 NEW EQUITY

INDIEGOGO PORTION

£25,000 (MARKETING)

£25,000 REQUIRED

 

Foundation for pro forma uses basic assumption of averaging one completed game per day with £200 prize; this equates to game turnover of £1,000 per day or £30,000 per month (30days) less £6,000 per month in prize payouts leaves £24,000+ of gross revenue.  The forecast budget is shown as:

 

S&M, CALL CENTRE

£9,000

30%

PAYPAL FEES

£1,500

5%

STAFF & NI

£6,900

23%

G&A (GENERAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE)

£3,000

10%

SUB-TOTAL

£20,400

68%

PRIZES

£6,000

20%

PROFIT

£3,600

12%

TOTAL

£30,000

100%

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate, but still want to help out? There are plently of ways that you can support QANDA through your social media connections; just start spreading the word.

TO MULTIPLY YOU HAVE TO DIVIDE

Some might say that heading doesn’t make sense, but taken in context it’s a sound statement.  The Internet gives us a platform to reach much further than was possible a generation ago; allowing us to connect with far more people in an entertaining and positive manner.  Our product is a knowledge based game using a question format with multiple choice answers and a cash prize as the incentive.  QANDA  is a simple acronym for Question and Answers and is the essence of the idea behind www.qanda4cash.com[1] , a fun, educational and  entertaining online version of the popular game featured on TV, radio and printed media.  QANDA has some subtle differences; it has a charitable component; it offers small, meaningful cash prizes; it uses a low multiple to achieve its target goal.

 

Basically a player registers and pays a small fee (£1) to submit an answer chosen from the five multiple choice answers provided to the question (only one entry per player).  Example: Where is the Eiffel Tower located?  [a] London [b] Dublin [c] Paris [d] Rome [e] Cairo  A winning entry is randomly chosen from the correct entries and the prize is paid out; prize values vary from £20 to £1,000.

 

You’re familiar with this concept because it is widely used by conventional media such as TV, radio and newsprint; their approach being that people phone or text their answer in response to seeing the question in one of the aforementioned mediums.  The cost associated with them answering the question is usually £1 plus carrier charges and can run into a few pounds subject to the amount of time and levels of complexity.  The theory is that a large number of people will contribute a small fee (nominally £1-£2), which in turn funds the cost of the enterprise and the prize incentive (usually hundreds sometimes thousands of pounds).  The drawback to using Telecom providers is that they collect 60% of the fee, requiring the company to attract much greater numbers of callers to realize the goal and that goal can expand to accommodate infinite response, earning huge profits without reflecting an increase in the prize.  They make no reference as to how many people may be participating.  We introduce a new transparent paradigm by using the Internet.

 

Nowadays, general knowledge is only a click away; however even the notion of looking up the correct answer still involves the person with acquiring new information, so the game has a subtle educational aspect to it.  It is a very basic game; a level playing field equally available to one and all.  It is a simple, intuitive and informative game that poses one question and offers a choice of answers; oftentimes the answer is obvious through general common knowledge.  Prizes are not life-changing values but rather life-enhancing values.  Prizes range from £20 to £1,000; this mirrors the amounts that most people find they are short on a daily, weekly or monthly basis and unlike gambling alternatives, they only spend £1 per game (entries are limited to one per entrant).  Because the draw is made from a finite pool of real entrants, there is always a guaranteed winner and the mathematical algorithm provides for a target figure to close the game i.e. 5 times the value of the prize, for example, £100 prize would attract £500 in turnover to cover the cost of the prize and the operational costs with the remainder being allocated to charity and profit for long term sustainability. 

 

www.qanda4cash.com (functionally complete but not currently live) will host two question formats side by side and will replace them each time they are won.  Question #1 might be: Where is the Eiffel Tower located?  [a] London [b] Dublin [c] Paris [d] Rome [e] Cairo and question #2 (with a graphic component) might be: Which flag represents Canada? [a] picture of flag of Chile [b] picture of flag of India [c] picture of flag of Germany [d] picture of flag of Canada [e] picture of flag of Australia   A player simply chooses and submits their answer with credits previously purchased and valued at £1.  Using the 5x multiplier, it is easy to calculate the likelihood of a win for any one entrant i.e. £20 prize will generate £100 turnover, which equates to 100 entrants.  Because of the small number of participants required to complete a game, very quick turnaround times allow for numerous winners everyday. 

 

Using Andrew Carnegie’s approach to charity; rather than passively giving money to a worthy charity, we listen to their priorities and needs and purchase the thing they need and present it to them, reducing the chance of cash funds being slowly eroded through day to day expenses.  For example, a hospice may need ten new mattresses valued at £3,500; we advocate offering to buy the mattresses on their behalf using their specifications and from their preferred supplier, as opposed to donating £3,500 and assuming that they act quickly and acquire ten mattresses rather than delay a month or two, and only be able to buy seven mattresses.  Subject to public response to our games, we choose a new charity on a weekly, fortnightly or monthly basis.

Because of the relatively small number of participants required to complete any of these games, there is a minimal loss for non-winners and a guaranteed winner in a short time frame.  This means more games can be won by more people on a daily basis; we see this as an entertaining distraction with an educational benefit for people, win or lose and for those who win it has a positive impact while some of the surplus funds benefit unknown persons through various charities.  Even our share of the proceeds (<10%) will be used in anonymous philanthropic gestures attributed to the company since it is the collective and not the individual who has made this possible. 

 

Already you can see the ripple effect: firstly we contribute to the betterment of the game winner without it being to the detriment of the non-winners (remember, they only spent £1), the second beneficiary is the charitable benefit to the community in a tangible form, and the third beneficiary is the deserving soul who is helped anonymously without condition other than encouragement to help another when the opportunity presents itself. An added benefit is the new gainful employment of some unemployed people. Our motivation is to create something awesome and give back on various levels and this business does that.

 

By ensuring the sustainability of anonymous giving, perhaps we create a movement that will be joined by other businesses in establishing a more giving and compassionate world.  Prove the viability of this concept and we will have built a legacy that may outlast us all as it continues to be self-perpetuating and offers the chance of support to anyone who needs a little help along the way.

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

We are three individuals and an advisor with a common interest in business and philanthropy and a desire to incorporate the two into a viable and sustainable enterprise.  We three have used our own disposable resources and contributed £30,000 to buy the hardware and software necessary to run this venture.  Now we need to raise funds for the marketing budget of £25,000; subject to achieving this goal, our bank will provide us with a debt loan of £30,000 and a private third party will make up the last £30,000 to cover our operating costs for the first quarter and complete the £115,000 budget.

 

Our experienced business leader will take a full time role while the rest of the team will dedicate time and effort in a support role using their proven expertise.  We will employ new hires; contribute to the infrastructure of the community by renting office space and using utilities and amenities; pay taxes; fund small bona fide charities with direct tangible benefits and make important contributions to new entrants on a daily basis.  In order for this to be a reality, we need your support and in return for your support you will receive self-satisfaction plus a range of really interesting perks. 

 

As a philosopher by nature and a businessman by vocation, I believe we can deliver everything we’ve shared with you. Your contribution is going to help us build a better tomorrow, but the benefit to you of your pledge is priceless; change lives for the better.  Thank you for your support and contribution; together we will multiply our reach by dividing the cost amongst us so that many, contributing little, can allow the few to help many more.

The QANDA Team:

RAE – MEDIA & PR
Rae is a highly regarded media specialist with international credits. Highlights include creating the world’s first network cross-platform television-internet series for Canada’s public broadcaster, CBC, where she also served as Senior Director of TV Network Programming. For the Vancouver 2010 Olympic Winter Games, she created a series of unprecedented digital projects known as CODE, the Cultural Olympiad’s Digital Edition. Rae has also worked internationally in television and digital media, and has been associated with many award winning projects, including a nomination for an Emmy and an Oscar.  Rae will be focused on ensuring our media budget is strategically utilised and delivers a consistent message supported by our social media and guerrilla communication campaigns.

BARBARA – CORPORATE GOVERNANCE

Barbara is an administrator working with a top licensed Corporate Service Provider (CSP); she has fifteen years experience in this field spanning the off-shore jurisdictions of the Channel Islands and the Isle of Man as well as international experience in New Zealand and national experience in the UK. 

 

ROUZBEH – TECHNICAL PROGRAMMER AND IT SUPPORT

Rouzbeh holds a BSc. in Computer Science (Hons) from the University of Leeds.  He worked as a Software Engineer Consultant for select clients including one of the big three online gaming companies in the UK for which he developed next generation Greenfield software.  He also served as Team Leader for development of a Global Reinsurance Trading platform;  additionally, his role as Head of Technology for a Global Premium Mobile Advertising platform to service major telecommunications and broadcasting companies in the UK and Europe, resulted in achieving 50 million impressions per day on the ad server.  His accomplishments included working on a number of data warehousing projects as a consultant implementing large scale Vertica and Greenplum programs for a world renowned Fortune 500 company.  Rouz will take the lead in maintaining our technology platform and overseeing all relationships with providers of various interfaces.

 

GEORGE – BUSINESS LEADER

George has over 30 years experience managing a range of successful businesses from restaurants to retail stores, new housing to recycling.  A firm believer in the pursuit of excellence, he takes pride in delivering exceptional customer service and leading a happy and positive workforce.  Apart from his practical business experience, he also holds a Master’s degree in Business Administration.  A committed advocate of Open Book Management and employee profit sharing via a quarterly bonus incentive; his overarching directive is customer service and delivering more than is expected.   He will have responsibility for the day to day operations and overall corporate strategy.

 


[1] Fully functional but not live on the Internet yet

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I’m Ahmed (alias Turupawn) and I've been developing this bullet hell engine for Ouya licensed as GPL so everybody is free to use it, study it, share it and modify it.

I've loved video games since I was a child, especially competitive and action games. I used to play so much and I really liked some of it that I wanted to change the mechanics, modify the story, special effects and many other things. Altough sometimes technically possible, this is illegal due to proprietary licensing applied all over the game industry. Out of annoyance I decided to make GPL games so it doesn't have this sort of issues. So that's how I set sails on my quest to make it true, first step: Learn how to code, study computer sciences at the university. Somewhere in the middle John Mackay and I crossed paths and it was awesome because we decided to teamwork out this thing, so we submitted as graduation project a GPL fighter engine which is still under development by others students of the university that are making more characters and backgrounds so we can later polish it, add gameplay and release a full game (small demo video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BcbhrweTsBc sorry for the music we recorded at a KFC t.t). We successfully got our degree, and immediately grouped up Rosalila Studio (former student group name) coding to build games for Ouya, an open console.

So far at Rosalila Studio we've released  a demo of the bullet hell engine we've been developing. You can already download Maximum Overkill from the Ouya market and give it try. With your help we can improve this game in many aspects and nurture the GPL game development community. Hope you like it and have fun beating the 3 difficulty levels included.

Click to enlarge


Licence and distribution

This game and the engine are licensed under GPLv3. You are free to use, modify, study and distribute it. You can already download a demo from the Ouya platform and when the new content is available you may unlock it with $1 to access the updates trough the Ouya platform and you will be directly contributing to get further in Ouya's game development. If you don't feel like it because reasons, you can always sideload the.apk file or compile it from source.

Source code

  • https://github.com/Rosalila/STG-Android



What We Need & What You Get

Where are going the founds

Click to enlarge

Graphics

  • One playable character animations + bullets animations
  • One enemy animations + bullets animations
  • One stage background animations
  • Menu interface
  • Head's up display interface

Coding

1. Optimizations

  • OpenGL optimizations


  • Nvidia tegra 3 optimizations


2. New features

  • New game modes such as "Time attack" and "Story mode"


  • Ouya specific features such as a HDMI border error fixer.


  • More and better visual effects


  • Support new and better gameplay


  • Nice looking menu


3. Documentation and game maker

  • How to run and modify the game tutorial


  • XML documentation to make your own levels, characters, stages and menus


  • Small game maker tool to ease the process to create your own game

Gameplay

  • Character shooting patterns
  • Enemy shooting and movement patterns for easy, medium and hard difficulty

Music

  • Menu music
  • Stage music

Sound effects

  • Bullet sound effects
  • Menu sound effects

Storyboards

  • Stage storyboard and dialogs
  • Character background story

The Impact

If you contribute to this project you are:

  • Contributing to the GPL games community so everybody is free to  use, study, share and modify the games they play without any restriction.
  • Supporting the indie game development on the Ouya platform so we can make more and better games.
  • You can win some amazing perks!

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways to contribute besides the perks:

  • Tell your friends about this campaign.
  • Share this page http://igg.me/at/maximum-overkill/
  • Have fun playing the game, this will make us happy!

Playable Character Poll

By contributing to this project with any perk you can vote for your favorite character from this sketches. The most voted will be the the playable character in the game!

Click to enlarge

Enemy Poll

By contributing to this project with any perk you can also vote for your favorite enemy from this sketches. The most voted will be the enemy boss in the game!

Click to enlarge



Finished art samples

Click to enlarge

Finished music samples

https://soundcloud.com/morghan831/feminist-kill-bot
https://soundcloud.com/morghan831/japanese-boss-theme

How to vote

By contributing with any perk you can vote by posting the name of one playable character and one enemy boss on the "Comments" section of this page.

Software used to make this game

This are the awesome software and libraries that helps to create this game:

Software

Linux multimedia studio - Music creation

Audacity - Audio editing tool

Inkscape - Vector image manipulator

Gimp - Raster image manipulator

Code::Blocks - Engine development IDE

Eclipse


Libraries


SDL - C++ multimedia library

Tiny XML - C++ XML parser

Android SDK and JNI
story_txt:
Short Summary


Hi! I’m Ahmed (alias Turupawn) and I've been developing this bullet hell engine for Ouya licensed as GPL so everybody is free to use it, study it, share it and modify it.
I've loved video games since I was a child, especially competitive and action games. I used to play so much and I really liked some of it that I wanted to change the mechanics, modify the story, special effects and many other things. Altough sometimes technically possible, this is illegal due to proprietary licensing applied all over the game industry. Out of annoyance I decided to make GPL games so it doesn't have this sort of issues. So that's how I set sails on my quest to make it true, first step: Learn how to code, study computer sciences at the university. Somewhere in the middle John Mackay and I crossed paths and it was awesome because we decided to teamwork out this thing, so we submitted as graduation project a GPL fighter engine which is still under development by others students of the university that are making more characters and backgrounds so we can later polish it, add gameplay and release a full game (small demo video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BcbhrweTsBc sorry for the music we recorded at a KFC t.t). We successfully got our degree, and immediately grouped up Rosalila Studio (former student group name) coding to build games for Ouya, an open console.
So far at Rosalila Studio we've released  a demo of the bullet hell engine we've been developing. You can already download Maximum Overkill from the Ouya market and give it try. With your help we can improve this game in many aspects and nurture the GPL game development community. Hope you like it and have fun beating the 3 difficulty levels included.
Click to enlarge








Licence and distribution


This game and the engine are licensed under GPLv3. You are free to use, modify, study and distribute it. You can already download a demo from the Ouya platform and when the new content is available you may unlock it with $1 to access the updates trough the Ouya platform and you will be directly contributing to get further in Ouya's game development. If you don't feel like it because reasons, you can always sideload the.apk file or compile it from source.


Source code
https://github.com/Rosalila/STG-Android






What We Need & What You Get
Where are going the founds




Click to enlarge







Graphics

One playable character animations + bullets animations
One enemy animations + bullets animations
One stage background animations
Menu interface
Head's up display interface




Coding
1. Optimizations



OpenGL optimizations



Nvidia tegra 3 optimizations




2. New features



New game modes such as "Time attack" and "Story mode"



Ouya specific features such as a HDMI border error fixer.



More and better visual effects



Support new and better gameplay



Nice looking menu


3. Documentation and game maker



How to run and modify the game tutorial



XML documentation to make your own levels, characters, stages and menus


Small game maker tool to ease the process to create your own game

Gameplay



Character shooting patterns

Enemy shooting and movement patterns for easy, medium and hard difficulty


Music




Menu music
Stage music

Sound effects


Bullet sound effects
Menu sound effects

Storyboards




Stage storyboard and dialogs
Character background story










The Impact

If you contribute to this project you are:


Contributing to the GPL games community so everybody is free to  use, study, share and modify the games they play without any restriction.

Supporting the indie game development on the Ouya platform so we can make more and better games.

You can win some amazing perks!





Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways to contribute besides the perks:


Tell your friends about this campaign.

Share this page http://igg.me/at/maximum-overkill/

Have fun playing the game, this will make us happy!


Playable Character Poll

By contributing to this project with any perk you can vote for your favorite character from this sketches. The most voted will be the the playable character in the game!
Click to enlarge












Enemy Poll
By contributing to this project with any perk you can also vote for your favorite enemy from this sketches. The most voted will be the enemy boss in the game!
Click to enlarge

story:
Support The Gaming Gang as we look to provide genre convention coverage in 2013. Score some cool goodies, one of a kind rewards, or even hang with the Gang behind the scenes at your favorite con!

If you can't help fund the project please show support by liking us on Facebook and/or following TGG on Twitter.

Launched in August of 2010, The Gaming Gang (TGG) has become a destination site for the latest news regarding tabletop gaming, video games, comic books, movies and TV, and well as review and opinion. Our main focus is on tabletop games (Miniatures, Wargames, RPGs, Board Games, Family Gaming and more!) but over the past twelve months we've expanded our coverage by bringing in contributors who tackle many other areas of crossover appeal to our audience.

Currently TGG features over 3000 articles, 300+ reviews, 180+ podcasts and nearly 50 videos!

As with most people who dig the sorts of things we do, all of the Gang have daytime jobs and responsibilities which financially prevent us from hitting every show or convention we receive invites or media credentials to attend. Even if we held the most amazing and successful project of this kind there'd still be positively no way we could make it to every event we'd like. That said, TGG was invited to report on over 30 various cons last year (large and small) and we were only able to scratch the surface of a fraction of those shows.

This year the requests are coming fast and furious once again!

That's why we've turned to Indiegogo in order to keep our website up and running (we'll use the goal funds to pay for the site hosting through the end of 2013) as well as making it out to more shows, with more correspondents and higher quality coverage. I tackled enough events all by my lonesome to know there's only so much a single person can do and even with two people, at a larger convention, so much is going on most of it flies under the radar. The best scenario is three or four individuals providing coverage because that allows us to fan out a bit while still getting plenty of audio and video of the event.

As with many of the conventions we'd like to bring to you, the cost to travel and stay at that location varies depending on the location; heading to Pennsylvania is one thing while jetting to Germany is something else completely. By creating the various stretch goals you'll telling us what you'd like for us to cover and what's important to you. Plus, if there's a con you're heading to, and you'd love to have TGG in attendance, this is your opportunity to ensure we're there!

You've probably seen other projects of this nature where the aim was to attend a single particular show for "X" number of dollars as the goal. Rather than take that approach we'll utilize our project to pay for the hosting of The Gaming Gang website through the rest of 2013 as well as build a convention "warchest" - as it were in - order to provide you with as much fun and excitement from as many events as possible!

 

It’s very true my personal stance, since founding TGG in 2010, was to make the website completely self-sufficient so you’d never see donation badges on the site or hear about pledge drives on the podcasts. To this point we’ve never asked for a single dime from anyone coming to the site. Unfortunately, I recently underwent treatment for early stage cancer of the kidney and the medical expenses to this point have completely wiped out any funds which were set aside to attend conventions this Summer and Fall. Thankfully, I’m doing well and the prognosis is for a complete recovery; the toughest part of the treatment is behind me and there are no concerns about being able to attend any of the shows in which we reach funding goals to attend by myself and other gang members.

Also, to keep the website up and running through the remainder of 2013 will cost just over $600 so this project will also go a long way to keep the site humming along until things settle down for me as far as medical expenses. Even if we don’t reach our initial goal, whatever we raise will go a long way toward making sure The Gaming Gang doesn’t ride off into the sunset! 

So without any further ado...

Simply enough $600 will cover the cost to keep The Gaming Gang website up and running through the end of 2013. This is sort of the "mini goal" of the project as the average monthly operating cost of the site is $100 or more. Hitting this level insures TGG stays solvent until I've got a handle on the multitude of medcal bills which have begun to arrive.

This is what we're aiming to achieve as the main goal of the project and everything beyond that will be icing on the cake! Unfortunately we're already going to miss out on Origins Game Fair. Yes, 2013 will be the year we DIDN'T go to Origins. *Sigh*

Yet there's plenty of other goodness out there and if we're able to achieve our base funding the Gang will provide coverage for...

San Diego Comic-Con - July 18-21, 2013 in San Diego, CA

MaricopaCon 2013 –  Aug. 3-4, 2013 Mesa, AZ (not much of a stretch since I live here...)

Gen Con - August 15-18, 2013 in Indianapolis, IN

Chicago TARDIS (Doctor Who Convention) - November 29-December 1, 2013 in Lombard, IL

 

Receive a personal "Thank You" postcard (designed by our own Dion Long) signed by Jeff and mailed directly to you as well as having your name placed on the Founder Member Roll Call.

Sorry Dion doesn't have the artwork available as of yet...

Obviously, The Gaming Gang Guide to Great Game Mastering PDF (yes the title was conceived firmly tongue-in-cheek) is simply my thoughts on making any roleplaying game a memorable experience for the players in your own gaming gang and I’m sure plenty of folks won’t agree with my personal gaming style I’ve maintained over thirty years of running RPGs – GMs who simply grab some dice without any sort of gameplan in mind, and believe they craft memorable experiences, will probably despise how I run a game. Yet, I believe there are some tips which can be utilized by GMs (regardless of their experience) to ratchet up the excitement level of their games as well as provide sessions your players will remember years from now and look back on fond memories of hours of fun with their pals.

Of course I’m not an author nor was I looking to put together some vast treatise on the state of role playing in the 21st Century but just wanted to share some thoughts on how I normally put together games in which a lot of people seemed to enjoy.

The PDF and audio book are presented as a bundle.

Get your copy of a limited edition mini-poster of the cover artwork for Victory Point Games'Dawn of the Zeds autographed by our good buddy, the title's designer Hermann Luttmann! And if you haven't played the game already, shame on you. It rocks!

Knights and Magick from long defunct Heritage USA. There was just something about the rules which were easy enough yet had extra flavor to the make battles unique and interesting.

Now I’m happy to say you can get your hands on the complete classic rule set from TGG! Although we’re talking about the original edition of K&M, the digital PDFs are bookmarked and completely searchable, making them perfect to bring along on the go with a laptop or tablet. Of course, you can put them on your phone too but I think you’d have some issues with the screen size… Higher level pledges are for the soft cover and hard cover editions.

This 197 page rules set hasn't seen the light of day since it was originally published in 1980 and we're actually working on an updated and streamlined edition of K&M for release in late 2013 - early 2014! You'll also receive all the Soldato rewards too.

Your choice of a TGG Badge Wallet or Custom Dice Bag! 

If you're a convention goer then you know sometimes those badges you get can be pretty flimsy, especially it you just pin it to your shirt, and  easily get lost. Show you're a veteran of the con scene - as well as a supporter of TGG - with your very own badge wallet! Plus, you can keep your valuables safe around your neck too! These badge wallets will only be available through this project.

Gamers love their dice bags as there's nothing worse than digging through your pockets for your tried and true lucky D20. Keep all your loaded *ahem* dependable dice on hand and easily accessable with out custom Dice Bag! As will all our custom accessories, this is only available through our project and will never be produced again.

Youll get your choice and receive the Soldato rewards as well.

Nature of the Beast Special. A strategy card game which really deserves a lot more coverage is Eye Level Entertainment's Nature of the Beast and we're able to provide you with the latest boxed edition: Prairie vs Polar signed by Eye-Level's very own Mark Anticole for a $40 pledge. You'll even receive the hard to find 24 card bonus pack which was only available to PvsP Kickstarter backers!

You can check out the video of what's in the box as well as our review. I have to say if you haven't checked out Nature of the Beast you really need to give it a try!

Nature of the Beast is a non-collectible card game. That means no need to buy booster packs. We give you all the cards. No rarities. Just a sweet self-contained game for two people (or four if you buy another box).

Race to fill your playing field by shifting your animals around. Animals’ movement is governed by differing combinations of arrows on each card, so as you play the puzzle changes!

Winning means playing smart to fill your field, not playing ‘whack-a-mole’ against your opponent. With each attack, you risk driving your army into the sinister region of ‘Dark Nature’. While an easy path to more power, this can lead to the destruction of your army if allowed to go too far!

The ONLY game where a hamster can take out her opponent’s playground with a gasoline can!  Nature of the Beast is a serious strategy game that you can actually get a couple chuckles from while playing and it won’t cost you a fortune to play.

This special reward also includes the Soldato rewards as well!

At the $40 dollar level get your choice of a TGG T-Shirt or Baseball cap. At $55 you get both! These accessories will be produced for this Indiegogo project only. Once we get near the completion of the project we'll send out the color options available for all our custom accessories.

Of course, the Soldato rewards are included too.

Ghosts of Dragonspear Castle Gen Con Special! Limited to 20 backers. The Wizards of the Coast D&D Next preview will be available at Gen Con 2013 as an exclusive con item and will be found nowhere else. That is unless you decide to back our project for $45! 

Ghosts of Dragonspear Castle is a D&D Next preview and mini-campaign comprised of four thrilling adventures designed to advance characters from 1st level to 10th level. The book also contains everything a Dungeon Master needs to run the adventures, including D&D Next game rules developed during the massive public playtest, monster statistics, spell descriptions, magic item descriptions, and background information on the coastal town of Daggerford, where the campaign is based.

If you can't make it to the show, we'll get you a copy (as well as the exclusive Gale Force 9 mini) and ship it directly from Indianapolis. Don't let this opportunity pass you by! This pledge is only available to backers in the U.S. and also includes the Soldato level of rewards as well.

World of Darkness Pack. A limited number of specials are available for the World of Darkness Pack! Only 20 available at a $45 pledge. Receive the PDFs of two of the latestWhite Wolf releases (Mummy: The Curse and Werewolf: The Apocalypse 20th Anniversary Edition) for less than you'd pay to purchase them online!

Mummy: The Curse

Imagine being both dead and deathless at the same time. Imagine being cradled in the arms of death for years, sometimes decades on end, but all the while knowing that you will eventually not only arise again, but awaken to an unfamiliar world that mostly fears and hates you. Now imagine that your purpose, your entire existence, is bound within this cycle -- that you are chained to it for all eternity. You sleep, you wake, your serve your Judge's will in the lands of the living, and you return to the death-sleep once more. The ancient culture that empowered you is gone, lost to the sands of time... yet you endure.

In Mummy: The Curse, a Storytelling game set in the World of Darkness, you play one of these beings. Those who know they exist, from the cultists who serve them to the dark forces arrayed against them, call them the Deathless.

We call them mummies.

Werewolf: The Apocalypse 20th Anniversary Edition

Werewolf the Apocalypse roared into hobby games in 1992, inspiring a generation of fans to stand up and howl their defiance at a corrupted world in a battle they knew they were doomed to lose. WtA presented the Garou: creatures at once both man and wolf, and filled with a Rage against the evils that would destroy and corrupt both the natural and spirit worlds. Capable of transforming into a variety of forms and blessed with Gifts that enabled superhuman and supernatural powers, the Garou fought many foes, always knowing that in the end they would fall. But what stories would be told and what songs sang of their exploits!

This epic tragic story, combined with the unwavering dedication of an unparalleled fan base, is the reason this book is being published. Werewolf: The Apocalypse – 20th Anniversary Edition brings the entire World of Darkness experience full circle and will serve as the perfect anniversary milestone to celebrate two decades of gaming the epic sagas of the Garou.

The World of Darkness Pack reward also includes everything in the Soldato level as well.

This is limited to ten backers as TGG's very own master of the graphic arts, Dion Long, will provide you with a custom character sketch for a $60 pledge. Just provide a brief description of the character, and a photo if you'd like it to resemble yourself, and you'll receive the digital image emailed directly to you! You don't even have to be a roleplayer to enjoy your very own one-of-a-kind 8" by 10" piece of artwork. Plus all the Caporegime goodies!

If you'd really like to show your support of TGG, you can score all of our custom designed accessories (T-Shirt, Badge Wallet, Baseball Cap, and Dice Bag at the $70 level of backing plus receive everything at the Soldato level as well!

Dawn of the Zeds Reward. Limited to ten backers is our Dawn of the Zeds 2nd Edition the $75 Pledge Level with includes the Soldato rewards, a convention badge wallet or dice bag, as well as a copy of my Game of the Year for 2011 in all it's newly updated boxed glory. 

You can see what's in the box with this video and check out the review of Victory Point Games' original edition here!

Arising once again from the grave, from designer Hermann Luttmann and lavishly illustrated by Vinh Ha, arises Dawn of the Zeds Second Edition as you've never seen it before. In this States of Siege solitaire game of horror and survival, your strategies will be put to the test. The world has gone crazy – a deadly virus has turned ordinary people into vicious, zombie-like killers. The undead, nicknamed "Zeds," are now converging on your corner of the world. You have been left to your own devices to stop them while the National Guard organizes a relief column and fights its way to you – but that could take days, or even weeks, before they arrive.

At the town of Farmingdale and its surrounding villages, you must coordinate its defenses. Regular citizens may emerge as heroes as you work to halt the Zeds' advances by (re)killing them, discovering and implementing a cure to this vile scourge, and preserving the area and its inhabitants as much as possible. In addition to this madness, the crazy Doctor Marteuse has been working in the underground tunnels and unleashing his uber-deadly Super Zeds, a nasty bunch of beasts that give havoc a whole new name. Bring him to justice, destroy the infectious Zeds, and save your city from peril!

In a game that requires the utmost test of skill and nerve, will you survive long enough? Will you be able to fight hordes of Zeds while protecting the townspeople? Test your heroics and unearth Dawn of the Zeds, a game that will keep you on your toes!

Frontline General: Spearpoint 1943 Special. This includes everything from the TGG Caporegime reward as well a a special Frontline General: Spearpoint 1943 bundle provided by Collins Epic Wargames. You'll receive both the Spearpoint 1943 Western Front core game as well as the Origins 2013 nominated map expansion!

You can check our or review of the core game here and video of what's in the expansion box here!

Frontline General: Spearpoint 1943 is a fast-paced two-player tactical card wargame set in WWII. Spearpoint focuses on WWII frontline combat, chaos, tension, and fun. 100 Unit Cards feature an assortment of historical German and US squad level infantry, artillery, armor, and aircraft. 50 Command Cards give support and intel to players. 25 Damage Cards apply unique Damage Effects if a unit becomes damaged. Combat is quick and tense and resolves using four included D10 dice. Standard and Situation games play in about 30 minutes including setup.

This also includes the Soldato rewards as well.

(Limited to Sponsors Only) Advertise on The Gaming Gang for a month at a lower rate than usual. You can chose your ad space area and even include multiple ads in rotation. Two sponsor spaces per month (July, August, and September) are available on a first come/first serve basis. This level does not include any rewards other than sponsorship and inclusion in a special section of the Founding Gang Members Roll Call.

Become a TGG Underboss - Everything from the Flag Bearer level and the opportunity to "Hang with the Gang!" Heading to one of the shows we're planning to cover? Then set aside an evening during the show to enjoy dinner and drinks with the team. Plenty of laughs are in store for a memorable experience and, if you're a gamer, plan on kicking it over a game or two. This reward is limited to two individuals per show. Once again this is on a first come basis so please check the updates as to what cons are still available. As we unlock coverage for more shows (fingers crossed on that) we'll make more evenings of "hanging with the gang" available for those cons. We'll pick up the tab for dinner and up to a $30 bar tab.

Become a TGG Capo Bastone - Exclusively for miniature gamers, have up to twenty 28mm-32mm miniatures of any genre not only professionally painted to tabletop quality but also featured in The Gaming Gang's A Regular Joe's Guide to Miniature Painting series of videos. Jeff will take viewers starting from the process of prepping the miniatures all the way through basing and protecting your finished figures. Please note this includes the shipping of the miniatures (as well as insurance) both to and from Jeff and is only open to supporters located in the U.S. Due to the nature of this reward you must allow 90-120 days from receipt of the unpainted miniatures to the return of the completed painted figures. Also miniatures to be painted to particular gaming title specs (i.e. WH40k or Flames of War) reference materials and exact paints must be included in original shipment. All other figures which are open to creative interpretation only need to have guideline images forwarded either in the shipment or through email. Also includes everything from the Flag Bearer level of rewards.

Be the Capo Di Tutti Capi of The Gaming Gang! Limited to a single event, three of us will travel anywhere in the U.S. to spend a day of gaming with yourself, your friends and family. We'll shoot video of the experience and give you plenty of camera time to share your collection, favorite games and just about anything within reason. A custom one of a kind DVD will be created for your personal collection as well. If you'd like we'll even bring the games and grub - how would you like to play games months before they're available on store shelves? You'll even get to keep the games!

We'll take care of the travel, hotel, and rental car; all you need to do is be ready to have an awesome time! This also includes all rewards up to the Standard Bearer level, you choice of two of our game rewards, as well as plenty of extra goodies to make the experience well worth your while! Please keep in mind due to the convention season your custom day of gaming will need to be scheduled after August 31st, 2013 and may not conflict with any scheduled convention we're attending in force.

That may be what you're wondering but due to the time constraints to get the project up and running, so it doesn't end right in the middle of this summer's convention season, we were a wee bit pressed for time to get started. 

Wizard World Chicago - August 8-11, 2013 in Rosemont, IL

Pax Prime - Aug 30-Sep 2, 2013 in Seattle, WA

BoardGameGeek Con - November 20-24, 2013 in Dallas/Fort Worth, TX

 

 
Dragon*Con - August 30-September 2, 2013 in Atlanta, GA

Las Vegas Comic Expo - September 28-29, 2013 in Las Vegas, NV

New York Comic Con - October 10-13, 2013 in New York City, NY

GeekGirlCon - October 19-20, 2013 in Seattle, WA

Yes, this is the big one where we'd actually leave the good ol' U.S. of A. and make our way to Essen, Germany for Die Internationalen Spieltage taking place October 24 (my birthday dontcha know) - 27, 2013!

Of course not! You’ll see plenty of coverage of other events much closer to our homes throughout the convention season. We’re always on the lookout to bring our audience lots of goodness from shows of all sizes! The more successful this project is the larger our "war chest' will be to finance travel. 

All we’re doing is letting folks know if we hit certain levels of funding they can look forward to seeing video, hearing audio, and reading coverage of the specific events we’re already listing. These are by no means are the only shows we’ll tackle!

Feel free to contact Jeff with any questions you may have or post them here as we'll look to follow up ASAP!
story_txt:
