story:
What is LuxeVault?

Elegant Luxury Goods Management
for iPhone and Android devices.

Add the details of all of your watches, bags, purses, wallets, shoes and other luxury and fashion items directly from your phone. Add your own high quality images of your luxury and fashion items or take quick shots from within the app. Details including brand, color, material, serial number and more can be added to each item stored in the app.


Current Features

Add your own high quality images of your luxury and fashion items or take quick shots from within the app.

Include details about the brand, color, material, serial number of your items.

Add notes about the history, purchase location or other details about each item added.

Add, edit or delete items quickly to effectively manage your collection of luxury items.


Planned Features

Aviary photo editing integration

Ability to research potential purchases based on serial number

Improved sharing capability

General Enhancements to the User Interface and overall stability

Improved Photo Taking Ability

Creation of LuxeVault item database


What We Need 

Up until now, the project has been fully bootstrapped. We have now reached the point where we need to bring in more professionals who can help us reach our goal of updating and completing an amazing app.

We plan to use all funds raised to accomplish the following:

Aviary photo editing integration

Ability to research potential purchases based on serial number

Improved sharing capability

General Enhancements to the User Interface and overall stability

Improved Photo Taking Ability

Creation of LuxeVault item database

If we don't meet our goal, this is how any funds raised will be used:

$500        Minor Android App Update

$1,500     Refresh Website

$2,500     Begin Android App Upgrades

$3,500     Begin Work On Database

$5,000    GOAL Start iOS Project                

$7,500     Begin Testing on iOS App

$9,500     Begin Work on Database

$12,000   Continued Testing on iOS App

$15,000   REACH Finish Android App Upgrades

$17,500   Complete Aviary Integration

$20,000   Begin Database testing

$25,000   STRETCH Finish iOS App


The completion of the Database and its integration with the apps will require more funds that I will raise on my own.

What You Get

T-Shirts

Posters

Mugs

Stickers


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help financially, we want you to be a part of the LuxeVault project. Please download the existing free Android app and let us know what works and what doesn't. Is there a critical feature missing? Does an included feature not work properly? Let us know! The more people who use the app, the easier it is to see what needs to be fixed or updated in the next version. Also, be sure to share the link to this project with your friends and family!

www.luxevaultapp.com

Credits/Thanks

Thanks to Jahzzar!

http://freemusicarchive.org/music/jahzzar/

http://www.powtoon.com

story:
"WILL WORK FOR E3"

Hello, My name is Oded Sharon and I'm an independent game developer from Israel. I've made a bunch of games in my life, like Pizza Morgana and Star Shipping Inc.

I was in E3 in 2003  while working for Majorem who were exhibitor and i was there showing off Ballerium and haven't had a lot of time to myself there.
Ever since 2003, I've wanted to go to E3 again, but couldn't find a business excuse to spend the money it costs to travel. Every year for the past 10 years, I've been telling to myself "Next year", and this year, again, I couldn't justify the costs.

So I decided I will work for it. Or rather work FOR YOU.

 

Me and the Majorem guys at E3 2003

 

So how can you help? What's in it for you?

A flight from Tel aviv to LAX costs around $1500, which I don't have to spare, but I have some free time and willing to do some cool things for it.

 

So check out the perks I offer:

  • You can get copies of two of my games for $7.
    http://pizza-morgana.com/
    http://starshipping.corbomitegames.com/

 

 

  • A special postcard i will make for $9.

  • Some knickknacks I will get at E3 for $11. I usually get a bunch of stuff and give it to my kids. If you're in Tel-aviv you can literally be taking them away from my kids. 
    You can sell them on Ebay afterwards. They might be worth more than $11. 

  • You can get one of my T-shirts that form my collection of geeky/gaming t-shirts or one of the new t-shirts i'm bound to get at E3. 

(Check out some of these nifty t-shirts)

 

 

  • I will cook you dinner for $100 and it will be AMAZING.

(Check out some of the things I made in previous dinners)

Eat some of my amazing food! 

 

  • For $300 You can hire me to take beautiful pictures of yourself.

(Check out some of the photos I took)

Have a picture taken like these!

 

  • If i'm going - I will be hosting some cocktails, and you (or your company) can be a sponsor.

  • You can hire me to stand in line for you. (very valuable and affordable)

  • You can accompany me to some very exclusive parties you might not be able to get into otherwise.

 

Be my +1 for these parties!

 

  • Or here is the big one : I will make a game for you for $1500.

Don't know what game, but it will be one for you. And you could go around and show people that this is your game.
Unless you're a game developer and have the time to make games i think this is pretty cool. It can be a surprise gift for someone or A wedding proposal. Or just something for vanity.

 

Why are you doing this again? 

I already have my E3 ticket (which is a shame not to use), I will stay with relatives/friends. and eat cheap junk food to save costs. I will also put in something like $500 myself, but i want to make sure i get the majority of the cost.

It is really important for me to go but an expense I cannot easily make, and why i'm running this campaign. I will bring my DSLR camera and do an album similar to the ones i do at other conventions like San Diego Comic Con.

You will have the gratification of knowing you help create something unique and entertaining.

I also think most of the perks are offer are going to be fun to do, and i'd rather do fun stuff, and do them together with you.

If you help me get to E3, i will be eternally grateful. 

I hold grudges forever, and remember favors for even longer.

 

Is this it? Can i Contribute now?

Not so fast. 

Even if you don't feel like giving me a dollar (or hire me for some services rendered), you can still let people know about the campaign. I bet you thought the video was kind of ridiculous, so share it wirh your friends!

Also if you have anything else you think I would want to do for you, and you're willing to pay me to do it, let me know. If it's fun, i'll consider adding it here.

I'm considering adding perks like you cna get me to contribute hours to your project as a game design or development mentor. Or you can hire me to walk around E3 with a t-shirt of your brand that you want to promote and i'll happily talk about it while I'm there.

Anyways, thanks for reading all this long text. (even if you skipped it and just read this last line - that's great!).

If you're going, I hope to see you at E3!
And thanks for your support!

FAQ

Q: What is E3?

A: The Electronic Entertainment Expo 
http://www.e3expo.com/

story:
Hi my name is Smebb and I'm the project lead and designer for Crazy Maisys, a game in development by TwistedPlanet Interactive.

Follow us to receive notifications when the prototype is available and when we post updates. The link is above, or you can follow us on Facebook and Twitter.

Many people who know me personally will know I've been passionate about games ever since I was a child. Not just computer games, but games in general. I've designed and made games since I was 4 years old. The first computer game I designed was for the ZX Spectrum which my Dad programmed for me, and the first table top game I made was a like Ludo where I made my own "dice-popper" with springs I took out of some action figures.

I've always had an idea or two floating about and even if I didn't have one, I could pluck them out of thin air. I was always thinking of creative ways to solve problems and I had a huge imagination. That imagination grew up with me.

I'm here to ask for support to get our studio launched and our first game developed, tested and distributed. None of our team have ever released a game commercially before, but we are confident that this game idea is something that people want to play and get involved with.
Even small companies and businesses will want to get involved with what we have planned!

TwistedPlanet Interactive is an independent game development team that was formed by a handful of people who were very interested in gaming and the games industry back in 2010. Most of us became students in game design, programming and server operations in 2011. 

In late 2012 we decided and started to plan on setting up our own company. The thing is, we don't have the funds to get out of our bedrooms and living rooms and into a working environment. Or at least enough funds to last until our first game is complete.

We want to be an independent company free from publishers and working directly with our customers, receiving feedback, and developing the kinds of games we and our customers like instead of first person shooters and "what works". We are aiming to develop at least 1 full game a year, at least 1 social game and projects involving small businesses.

Crazy Maisys is a 3/4 top-down management role-playing game. ( play the prototype here (23Mb))

You play as a traveller looking for work, coming across a sign saying "JOB VACANCY & LODGINGS". After deciding to go and enquire about the job vacancy, you come across an old lady milking (and talking to) a cow...

Features:

  • There's a fair bit of humour in the game, as well as drama.
  • You have to keep  your relationship with Maisy amiable as well as running a successful farm.
  • It has a few role-playing elements in it like skills you have to work at (cooking, animal husbandry, growing crops...)
  • You have to manage the farm, and budget your costs
  • You have freedom to do what you want

We will be updating the game regularly with new content for free, which will introduce new products, actions, objects and events.

We plan on making more games about the epic saga of Maisy Powers (the elderly lady in the game) when she was younger and the events leading up to the time Crazy Maisys is set. We want to start near the end of her life, then go back to when she was a child, then a teen, then young adult, etc back up to her elderly life. We do not have a set number of games we are going to release, but we plan on telling her whole story.

We're working on a prototype right now for people to get an idea of the kind of game we're developing toward and how small companies and businesses could be involved.

All of the money we raise from this will go toward the development of Crazy Maisys:

  1. £540 is for developer and software licenses (so we can release the game on the Mac and iOS App Stores, and develop for iOS, Android and Windows 8 devices and phones)
  2. £10,200 Paying the artists, studio time for recording voices, music composition, audio engineer and an extra programmer, legal advice and documents, distribution and marketing and other labour costs (administration, web programming)
  3. £1,900 is for equipment and software (Operating Systems, low end server for live testing and web operations, the cheapest iPad and Android devices we could find, software for virtual machines for testing)
  4. £2,000 is for office space, bills (servers, electric, secure data storage, etc) and hiring furniture

The other £2,000 is to cover IndieGogo and PayPal fees.

All of the other costs of development (including our own time) we will cover ourselves which includes development and our own equipment.

If we don't make our goal, our priorities will be in the order above. We really want to get the game into as many hands as possible, so mobile development and Mac compatibility is a must. Even if it takes longer for us to develop for those platforms, we still want to be able to get the game into as many hands as possible.

We really want to develop for Linux so if we make enough we'll develop the game for that too, but that is only achievable if we make over our goal. An optional extra if you will.

Every person who supports our project will receive a personal thank you eCard (or digital postcard) from the TwistedPlanet Interactive Team no matter how small, every little helps! If you really want to support us or just want a personal message, your Twitter/Facebook URL on the side of a wagon or on a banner in the game, then there are options for you so long as they aren't obscene or offensive.

We've decided to name the perks after ranks in a space mission aboard the SS Pervidi (StarShip Explorer), the mission being to explore TwistedPlanet and make it habitable and create an economy... in other words, helping us get our game developed and set the foundations for our company.

The perks you can receive for supporting us are as follows:

£1 - Cadet
  • a personal thank you and digital postcard from the TwistedPlanet Interactive team!
£5 - Pilot
  • a personal thank you and digital postcard from the TwistedPlanet Interactive team
  • a digital download version of the Crazy Maisys game when it is released
£10 - Flight Engineer
  • a personal thank you and digital postcard from the TwistedPlanet Interactive team
  • a digital download version of the Crazy Maisys game when it is released
  • the digital soundtrack from the game
£10 - Test Pilot
  • a personal thank you and digital postcard from the TwistedPlanet Interactive team
  • a digital download version of the Crazy Maisys game when it is released
  • early access to the game while in development (Beta) where you can offer feedback or just see how we're progressing
£15 - Test Flight Engineer
  • a personal thank you and digital postcard from the TwistedPlanet Interactive team
  • a digital download version of the Crazy Maisys game when it is released
  • early access to the game while in development (Beta) where you can offer feedback or just see how we're progressing
  • the digital soundtrack from the game.
£50 - Officer
  • a personal thank you poster from the TwistedPlanet Interactive team
  • 5 digital download versions of the Crazy Maisys game when it's released
  • 5 copies of the digital soundtrack
  • early access to the game while in development for 5 people (Beta) where you can offer feedback or just see how we're progressing
  • you or your company will also be named in our credits as Officers of the SS Pervidi.
£250 - Liaison
  • a personal thank you poster from the TwistedPlanet Interactive team
  • 10 digital download versions of the Crazy Maisys game when it's released
  • 10 copies of the digital soundtrack
  • early access to the game while in development for 10 people (Beta) where you can offer feedback or just see how we're progressing
  • you will also be able to name one of the companies or characters the player regularly interacts with
  • you can have a logo or personal message put into the game
  • 33% off any of our Web Presence packages when we launch
  • you or your company will also be named in our credits as Liaisons of the SS Pervidi.
£500 - Commander
  • a personal thank you poster from the TwistedPlanet Interactive team
  • 25 digital download versions of the Crazy Maisys game when it's released
  • 25 copies of the digital soundtrack
  • even earlier access to the game while in development (Alpha) where you can offer feedback or just see how we're progressing
  • you will also be able to name one of the companies or characters the player regularly interacts with
  • you can have a product, service, logo or personal message put in the game
  • the company or character, and the product, service, logo or message will be used in our other games should you wish
  • 50% off any of our Web Presence packages when we launch
  • you or your company will also be named in our credits as Commanders of the SS Pervidi.

Businesses

Businesses who would like to invest in our project could benefit from it in at least 2 possible ways:

  1. You could have your company logo on a banner, billboard, or on the side of a cart/wagon that appears in the game. Or you could have your product in the game like branded seeds, soda, tins of soup, invites to certain events with "Photography services provided by <YOUR COMPANY NAME HERE>" on them or whatever your product is. All of the logos, products and services will be clearly in view or readable. Examples of products and services that will be seen a lot are:

    • Seeds, hay/straw
    • Tools, Signs, crockery and cutlery, cooking utensils
    • Soda/pop, condiments, soup
    • Animal feed, dairy distribution, 
    • Photography, transportation, animal husbandry, paving and maintenance, radio stations

    Even if your company has a product or service not listed above, we could probably find a creative way to fit it into the game.
  2. Once the game is developed, you could have your very own licensed version of our first game (Crazy Maisys) to use on your web site with Facebook integration and your own theme (instead of a farm environment, it could be an ice cream parlour, a resteraunt, or an off-roading site). Once the game is complete it's yours to do what you like with it! We'll work with your web developers to explain how to communicate with the game. 
    All of this of course would be custom made to your business and would require consultation and extra artwork to be created (which will be costly and time consuming) but your customers would have something extra to keep them visiting your web site and sharing with their friends, which could mean more exposure for your products and services!

The businesses who invest and want to get their product or service placement in Crazy Maisy will also receive several copies of the game (as mentioned above) to play and the option to play the game while it's in development so you can give us feedback or see how it's progressing. Also, the products will never get removed from the game so as time goes on and more people play and see the game, the more people will see your product!

Also any small businesses, entrepreneurs, communities or small companies who support us, will receive either a 50% or 33% off any of our Web Presence packages when we launch. The package details are still being written up but all of them include a domain, web site with content management system, and plugins for your industry.
There will be of course packages that include Social Media integration, managed web sites, cross-promotion, Facebook Adverts, Google Adwords, Search Engine Analysis, information packs, PayPal Integration, eBay Intergration, web apps, your own custom promotional/educational game for your web site... plus much more.

If you own a small business or company and would like to have your product or service in Crazy Maisys but have questions, feel free to send us a message with any queries you might have before investing.

We want to make our first commercial game successful which means we have to meet certain expectations and specifications. We want it to work on Windows, OS X, iOS, Android and through the browser so almost everyone will be able to play it, wether they're on a train, on the toilet, on their home computer or in a lunch break at work.

This is a lot to ask for with it being our first commercial game but the more we raise the more resources we can put into:

  • getting the game developed to a high degree of quality,
  • getting advice from professionals
  • simulataneously releasing the game for all platforms at the same time with high quality conversions (controls and User Interface designed for each platform, more options for the PC/Mac versions, etc)
  • researching and developing for new platforms (i.e. Linux)

The Saga of Maisy Powers is something we want to share with people, and by supporting us you're helping us get that little bit closer to getting our first commercial game developed and getting our company launched.

If you can't support us financially, but you'd like to help us out then don't worry! You can still help us by tweeting, sharing on Facebook, Google+ or other social media sites, email the link to our project to your friends or colleagues, or share the link to our project wherever you'd like!

Remember to follow us to make sure you get notified when the prototype is available and when we post updates. The links is at the top of the page, or you can follow us on Facebook and Twitter.

Thank you very much for reading,

The TwistedPlanet
Interactive Team
story_txt:
Hi my name is Smebb and I'm the project lead and designer for Crazy Maisys, a game in development by TwistedPlanet Interactive.

Follow us to receive notifications when the prototype is available and when we post updates. The link is above, or you can follow us on Facebook and Twitter.
Many people who know me personally will know I've been passionate about games ever since I was a child. Not just computer games, but games in general. I've designed and made games since I was 4 years old. The first computer game I designed was for the ZX Spectrum which my Dad programmed for me, and the first table top game I made was a like Ludo where I made my own "dice-popper" with springs I took out of some action figures.
I've always had an idea or two floating about and even if I didn't have one, I could pluck them out of thin air. I was always thinking of creative ways to solve problems and I had a huge imagination. That imagination grew up with me.
I'm here to ask for support to get our studio launched and our first game developed, tested and distributed. None of our team have ever released a game commercially before, but we are confident that this game idea is something that people want to play and get involved with.Even small companies and businesses will want to get involved with what we have planned!
TwistedPlanet Interactive is an independent game development team that was formed by a handful of people who were very interested in gaming and the games industry back in 2010. Most of us became students in game design, programming and server operations in 2011. 
In late 2012 we decided and started to plan on setting up our own company. The thing is, we don't have the funds to get out of our bedrooms and living rooms and into a working environment. Or at least enough funds to last until our first game is complete.
We want to be an independent company free from publishers and working directly with our customers, receiving feedback, and developing the kinds of games we and our customers like instead of first person shooters and "what works". We are aiming to develop at least 1 full game a year, at least 1 social game and projects involving small businesses.
Crazy Maisys is a 3/4 top-down management role-playing game. ( play the prototype here (23Mb))
You play as a traveller looking for work, coming across a sign saying "JOB VACANCY & LODGINGS". After deciding to go and enquire about the job vacancy, you come across an old lady milking (and talking to) a cow...

Features:

There's a fair bit of humour in the game, as well as drama.
You have to keep  your relationship with Maisy amiable as well as running a successful farm.
It has a few role-playing elements in it like skills you have to work at (cooking, animal husbandry, growing crops...)
You have to manage the farm, and budget your costs
You have freedom to do what you want

We will be updating the game regularly with new content for free, which will introduce new products, actions, objects and events.
We plan on making more games about the epic saga of Maisy Powers (the elderly lady in the game) when she was younger and the events leading up to the time Crazy Maisys is set. We want to start near the end of her life, then go back to when she was a child, then a teen, then young adult, etc back up to her elderly life. We do not have a set number of games we are going to release, but we plan on telling her whole story.

We're working on a prototype right now for people to get an idea of the kind of game we're developing toward and how small companies and businesses could be involved.
All of the money we raise from this will go toward the development of Crazy Maisys:


£540 is for developer and software licenses (so we can release the game on the Mac and iOS App Stores, and develop for iOS, Android and Windows 8 devices and phones)

£10,200 Paying the artists, studio time for recording voices, music composition, audio engineer and an extra programmer, legal advice and documents, distribution and marketing and other labour costs (administration, web programming)

£1,900 is for equipment and software (Operating Systems, low end server for live testing and web operations, the cheapest iPad and Android devices we could find, software for virtual machines for testing)

£2,000 is for office space, bills (servers, electric, secure data storage, etc) and hiring furniture

The other £2,000 is to cover IndieGogo and PayPal fees.
All of the other costs of development (including our own time) we will cover ourselves which includes development and our own equipment.
If we don't make our goal, our priorities will be in the order above. We really want to get the game into as many hands as possible, so mobile development and Mac compatibility is a must. Even if it takes longer for us to develop for those platforms, we still want to be able to get the game into as many hands as possible.
We really want to develop for Linux so if we make enough we'll develop the game for that too, but that is only achievable if we make over our goal. An optional extra if you will.

Every person who supports our project will receive a personal thank you eCard (or digital postcard) from the TwistedPlanet Interactive Team no matter how small, every little helps! If you really want to support us or just want a personal message, your Twitter/Facebook URL on the side of a wagon or on a banner in the game, then there are options for you so long as they aren't obscene or offensive.
We've decided to name the perks after ranks in a space mission aboard the SS Pervidi (StarShip Explorer), the mission being to explore TwistedPlanet and make it habitable and create an economy... in other words, helping us get our game developed and set the foundations for our company.
The perks you can receive for supporting us are as follows:


£1 - Cadet 
a personal thank you and digital postcard from the TwistedPlanet Interactive team!



£5 - Pilot  
a personal thank you and digital postcard from the TwistedPlanet Interactive team
a digital download version of the Crazy Maisys game when it is released



£10 - Flight Engineer 
a personal thank you and digital postcard from the TwistedPlanet Interactive team
a digital download version of the Crazy Maisys game when it is released
the digital soundtrack from the game



£10 - Test Pilot 
a personal thank you and digital postcard from the TwistedPlanet Interactive team
a digital download version of the Crazy Maisys game when it is released
early access to the game while in development (Beta) where you can offer feedback or just see how we're progressing



£15 - Test Flight Engineer 
a personal thank you and digital postcard from the TwistedPlanet Interactive team
a digital download version of the Crazy Maisys game when it is released
early access to the game while in development (Beta) where you can offer feedback or just see how we're progressing
the digital soundtrack from the game.



£50 - Officer 
a personal thank you poster from the TwistedPlanet Interactive team
5 digital download versions of the Crazy Maisys game when it's released
5 copies of the digital soundtrack
early access to the game while in development for 5 people (Beta) where you can offer feedback or just see how we're progressing
you or your company will also be named in our credits as Officers of the SS Pervidi.



£250 - Liaison 
a personal thank you poster from the TwistedPlanet Interactive team
10 digital download versions of the Crazy Maisys game when it's released
10 copies of the digital soundtrack
early access to the game while in development for 10 people (Beta) where you can offer feedback or just see how we're progressing
you will also be able to name one of the companies or characters the player regularly interacts with
you can have a logo or personal message put into the game
33% off any of our Web Presence packages when we launch
you or your company will also be named in our credits as Liaisons of the SS Pervidi.



£500 - Commander 
a personal thank you poster from the TwistedPlanet Interactive team
25 digital download versions of the Crazy Maisys game when it's released
25 copies of the digital soundtrack
even earlier access to the game while in development (Alpha) where you can offer feedback or just see how we're progressing
you will also be able to name one of the companies or characters the player regularly interacts with
you can have a product, service, logo or personal message put in the game
the company or character, and the product, service, logo or message will be used in our other games should you wish
50% off any of our Web Presence packages when we launch
you or your company will also be named in our credits as Commanders of the SS Pervidi.



 
Businesses
Businesses who would like to invest in our project could benefit from it in at least 2 possible ways:

You could have your company logo on a banner, billboard, or on the side of a cart/wagon that appears in the game. Or you could have your product in the game like branded seeds, soda, tins of soup, invites to certain events with "Photography services provided by <YOUR COMPANY NAME HERE>" on them or whatever your product is. All of the logos, products and services will be clearly in view or readable. Examples of products and services that will be seen a lot are:
Seeds, hay/straw
Tools, Signs, crockery and cutlery, cooking utensils
Soda/pop, condiments, soup
Animal feed, dairy distribution, 
Photography, transportation, animal husbandry, paving and maintenance, radio stations

Also, the products will never get removed from the game so as time goes on and more people play and see the game, the more people will see your product!
Also any small businesses, entrepreneurs, communities or small companies who support us, will receive either a 50% or 33% off any of our Web Presence packages when we launch. There will be of course packages that include Social Media integration, managed web sites, cross-promotion, Facebook Adverts, Google Adwords, Search Engine Analysis, information packs, PayPal Integration, eBay Intergration, web apps, your own custom promotional/educational game for your web site... plus much more.
If you own a small business or company and would like to have your product or service in Crazy Maisys but have questions, feel free to send us a message with any queries you might have before investing.

This is a lot to ask for with it being our first commercial game but the more we raise the more resources we can put into:

getting the game developed to a high degree of quality,
getting advice from professionals

researching and developing for new platforms (i.e. Linux)

The Saga of Maisy Powers is something we want to share with people, and by supporting us you're helping us get that little bit closer to getting our first commercial game developed and getting our company launched.
If you can't support us financially, but you'd like to help us out then don't worry! You can still help us by tweeting, sharing on Facebook, Google+ or other social media sites, email the link to our project to your friends or colleagues, or share the link to our project wherever you'd like!

story:
Our Story

PHOE·NIX [fee-niks]
"A mythical bird that never dies, the phoenix flies far ahead to the front, always scanning the landscape and distant space. It represents our capacity for vision, for collecting sensory information about our environment and the events unfolding within it. The firey bird rising from the ashes is a classic symbol of life and freedom and self-determination: nothing in this world can ever stop the phoenix. The phoenix gives us strength to carry on, and the will to succeed. The phoenix, with its great beauty, creates intense excitement and deathless inspiration."

 

The Carolina Phoenix rose from the ashes in 2007 with 15 dedicated players and a coach who would not accept anything but their best. Following a tough opening loss, the team went on to post a 5-1 record in its inaugural season. The Phoenix have since accumulated a 24-5 record heading into the 2011 season.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I desperately am seeking your HELP! This campaign is designed by me to be a fundraiser to help Phoenix players like myself raise money to cover the cost of our player league dues. These dues are composed by many factors such as training fee, equipment, travel, lodging, and uniform costs. Consistent with IWFL requirements, anyone who makes the team pays a player training fee to the Carolina Phoenix. Many prospective players seek community and family patrons help to pay their players training fee and support the team, thus why I am reaching out to you!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Share these links or simply visit our website at carolinaphoenixfootball.com 


 

Get ready Phoenix fans! Checkout the 2012 Schedule! Looks like it will be the most exciting year yet! Go to carolinaphoenixfootball.com to purchase your season tickets! 

April   7th  Away Philadelphia
             14th   Away   Atlanta
             21st   Bye
             28th   Away   Baltimore

May       5th     Home  Florida
             12th   Away   Chattanooga
             19th   Home  Atlanta
             26th   Bye

June      2nd   Home      Chattanooga
            16th  Home       Philadelphia


All home games played at Durham County Stadium

750 Stadium Drive  

Durham, NC

story:
www.jeklynnheights.com

Why a Campaign?

Jeklynn Heights is an indie game that started in 2010.  Our team is made up of developers from all around the world with one single goal in mind - creating innovative and fresh new games.  As of now this project has been entirely self funded, so now we are asking for your support as we start to move this game into beta testing!  We are using the Unreal Development Kit to power this game

What is the essence Jeklynn Heights?

Jeklynn Heights is a multiplayer game that incorporates a multitude of genres and themes including 1st and 3rd person combat, RPG, strategy, and adventure. The game takes place entirely at night, a time when violence and peculiarity are at their peak.

Gameplay:

The town of Jeklynn heights is separated into two sides:

                  The Slums (Poor)                                The Square (Rich)

Each team starts out on the opposite side of the map. Both teams have several unique characters you can play as throughout the duration of the match. Each character has a different attack rotation, ranged weapon, and various special abilities.

Primary Objective
The goal of the game is to acquire the Orb of Egression located in the other team's base. In order to capture the orb, the teams will need a portion of their overall players channeling it based on the team size.  Successfully capturing the orb is your ticket out of this crazy town, but it comes with high risk.


Secondary Objective
Throughout each playable map there are structures called Sanity Posts and Ability Orbs. Capturing a Sanity Post will give the acquiring team a forward position and more sanity; a resource used to level up your character to gain special attacks. Capturing Ability Orbs will give the acquiring team a huge advantage by making various passive and active abilities accessible. Sanity Posts and Ability Orbs can be recaptured by the enemy team however, so it is crucial to defend them and brainstorm which ones would benefit your team.

Where does the money go?

As mentinoned earlier, all of the money spent on this project has been self funded.  Additional funds will help us tremendously as our focus redirects into expanding our company and our content.

  • Marketing/Advertising of our game once we enter beta
  • Hiring additional developers in animation, programming, artwork, customer support, design, etc.
  • Creating new characters, weapon, and other content (goes hand in hand with expanding our team size)
  • Continued development beyond beta and release.
  • Server Costs

Final Words

This project has been a labor of love and we can't wait to share it with everyone.  If you think our project looks cool, please consider a donation of any amount to help an upcoming indie game!  We are very close to entering beta - so this is a perfect opportunity to get involved with our community and support this project.  Aside from donating, spread the word about our project to friends and make sure to register on our website.

story:
Why Is Arcade Extravaganza Being Created?

My dream is to create an insanely successful game application for the iPhone/iTouch/iPad (iDevice) community.I love serving people, I love iDevices, and I’m committed to achieving my goal. By doing so I believe I will inspire others to pursue their dreams too. I’m so excited about Arcade Extravaganza because I want to use my creativity to provide the iDevice community with an incredibly fun and extremely addictive new application.

In March 2010, when I turned 13 years old, I was acknowledged for my online success with ItouchTechTalk.com by a very successful internet marketing guru who became my mentor. I’ve really enjoyed helping the iTouch community through my blog. Upon asking him how I could better serve the iDevice community, he responded “Create an iDevice application.” And the first thing that went through my mind was “Wow, that’s a great idea!” and I thought it would be really easy. Now that I’ve been working on this project for a little while, I’ve come to realize that it may be a simple idea; however it’s not as easy as I first thought it would be.

I’ve been working really hard building a team to help realize my dream. I have application developers who are waiting to begin the work and other support people. The success of our main menu artwork has been amazing and inspiring, see for yourself.

Arcade Extravaganza is really cool, but we haven’t forgotten our humanitarian side either. We’ve decided to donate 10% of all Arcade Extravaganza sales to organizations who fight hunger/malnutrition. When you support our project or buy Arcade Extravaganza, you’ll also be contributing to making the world a better place to live for all.

I’m at the point where my piggy bank is empty. I’m asking the iDevice community, to help me complete my Arcade Extravaganza application. Please donate now by clicking the “FUND MY PROJECT” button to the right.

What is Arcade Extravaganza?

Arcade Extravaganza will consist of six games that you might find in an arcade or carnival. Over the last eight years or so of my life, I’ve always enjoyed the special times I spent with my family at carnivals and arcade rooms. I was unable to find an application that would give me those same great feelings, so I decided to create one.

We are going to begin by creating the application framework along with the first game called Stack Em Up (based on Stacker). Our research has shown there are similar games available, but don’t be fooled because our game will consist of 10 brand new creative and enhanced levels along with a prize redemption area. The remaining five games will be just as incredibly creative and enhanced as Stack Em Up. They are similar to: slam-a-winner, whistle stop, mountain ski ball/capsule craze, flaming finger, and carnival duck shoot game.

Our goal is to have a number one winning application among iDevice users. So we know we’ll have to create an application that blows the community away. To achieve this goal we will be focusing on quality, reliability, stability, creativity, and fun.

Any additional funds will be used to complete the remaining five games. Arcade Extravaganza full version owners will get the 5 additional games through free updates. We are also considering community improvements and suggestions. As a result, Arcade Extravaganza will be an iDevice community effort.

How You Can Help

First and foremost, we need your gracious donation to help make Arcade Extravaganza real. Now it’s your turn. We will provide you with regular updates as we progress. Our intention is to continue development of Arcade Extravaganza for as long as needed.

The bottom line is we want our dream to become your dream too. Please help us to create a #1 winning application called Arcade Extravaganza. I want to make a difference in the way applications are developed. I believe if we all work together, we will build and create an iDevice application that’s never been as much fun or creative, and exhibits a more wonderful experience than what we can create together.

I want to thank you from the bottom of my heart for your help in making the new Arcade Extravaganza application. Not only am I thankful and appreciative for your support, but I’m at your service too. I will create Arcade Extravaganza resulting in an application that we will love and enjoy for years to come. I’m in the business of serving the iDevice community for life. Go to the right side of the page and help fund our cause now. You’ll be glad you did, I promise.

Please spread the word to all you friends and co-workers, on all your social networks, at your iTouch/iPhone/iPad groups, and church gatherings. Arcade Extravaganza is coming in 2010 and with your help it will be a huge success!

Love and thanks in advance for your help,

Susan Levine
http://www.iTouchTechTalk.com

Arcade Extravaganza will consist of six games that you might find in an arcade or carnival. Over the last eight years or so of my life, I’ve always enjoyed the special times I spent with my family at carnivals and arcade rooms. I was unable to find an application that would give me those same great feelings, so I decided to create one.
We are going to begin by creating the application framework along with the first game called Stack Em Up (based on Stacker). Our research has shown there are similar games available, but don’t be fooled because our game will consist of 10 brand new creative and enhanced levels along with a prize redemption area. The remaining five games will be just as incredibly creative and enhanced as Stack Em Up. They are similar to: slam-a-winner, whistle stop, mountain ski ball/capsule craze, flaming finger, and carnival duck shoot game.
Our goal is to have a number one winning application among iDevice users. So we know we’ll have to create an application that blows the community away. To achieve this goal we will be focusing on quality, reliability, stability, creativity, and fun.
Any additional funds will be used to complete the remaining five games. Arcade Extravaganza full version owners will get the 5 additional games through free updates. We are also considering community improvements and suggestions. As a result, Arcade Extravaganza will be an iDevice community effort.How You Can Help
First and foremost, we need your gracious donation to help make Arcade Extravaganza real. Now it’s your turn. We will provide you with regular updates as we progress. Our intention is to continue development of Arcade Extravaganza for as long as needed.
The bottom line is we want our dream to become your dream too. Please help us to create a #1 winning application called Arcade Extravaganza. I want to make a difference in the way applications are developed. I believe if we all work together, we will build and create an iDevice application that’s never been as much fun or creative, and exhibits a more wonderful experience than what we can create together.
I want to thank you from the bottom of my heart for your help in making the new Arcade Extravaganza application. Not only am I thankful and appreciative for your support, but I’m at your service too. I will create Arcade Extravaganza resulting in an application that we will love and enjoy for years to come. I’m in the business of serving the iDevice community for life. Go to the right side of the page and help fund our cause now. You’ll be glad you did, I promise. Please spread the word to all you friends and co-workers, on all your social networks, at your iTouch/iPhone/iPad groups, and church gatherings. Arcade Extravaganza is coming in 2010 and with your help it will be a huge success!
Love and thanks in advance for your help,
Susan Levine http://www.iTouchTechTalk.com

story:
The Company

Binaye is a toy company, based in Durban, South Africa, focused on providing kids with a holistic learning experience. Our ultimate goal is to get children to connect with and understand the Qur’aan. Our first toy range will be called Binaye Blocks, where we couple a story from the Qur’aan with a construction toy.

Binaye Blocks

Why couple a construction toy with a story from the Qur’aan?

At Binaye, we believe that spatial and visual skills will assist children in understanding and connecting with the Qur’aan. Toys that have a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics) element to them are ideal for developing spatial and visual skills, which enables logical thinking and reasoning. So, if we want to develop these skills in our kids, the best place to start is with toys!

Each box will consist of a story book and a toy, including everything you need to use the toy.

The Story Book

All Binaye Blocks Story Books will have the following features:

  • A story from the Qur’aan that is short, age appropriate and easily understandable
  • Art that is beautifully hand drawn. Care will be taken to ensure that faces of Prophets, etc. will not be depicted
  • A theme or moral that will be immediately apparent when reading the story. However, this will be highlighted merely as a guide for parents and teachers. The beauty of the Qur’aan is that there are many themes or morals that can be deduced from any particular story
  • Reference to all verses used in the development of the story, as well as some key Arabic words from the Qur’aan, along with their closest English translations

The Toy

All toys in the Binaye Blocks range will have the following features:

  • A focus on developing spatial and visual skills, whilst still relating to the story
  • An element of construction, to provide an interactive learning experience
  • 'Modularity' (like Lego, Meccano, etc.), in that it will consist mostly of blocks and bars that can be put together in various ways. Since it is modular, it will be compatible with all future toys in the Binaye Blocks range
  • Compliance with industry standards, ensuring that all toys are free from harmful chemicals like BPA

The first toy in the Binaye Blocks range will be called "The Story of Creation".

The First Toy in the Binaye Blocks Range: The Story of Creation

The Story of Creation features the story of Adam (peace be upon him). This is the raw text, comprising just the story (excluding the Build-along section, story moral and references)

The construction toy will feature a ‘Magical Printing Machine’, which is based on the concept of a 3D Printer (what is 3D printing, you ask? Check out this link). Children will have the experience of manually 'printing' various objects with ‘clay’, while subconsciously learning about the Cartesian coordinate system and manufacturing methods. The clay will be included, along with recipes for play dough and other fun, homemade materials that you can use in your Magical Printing Machine.

This Toy is aimed at children from 4 to 9 years of age. We recommend an upper age limit of 12 years.

So, what does a 3D printer-inspired toy and the story of Adam have in common? Support our campaign and you will soon find out!

Why should you support our campaign?

  1. Be part of the revolution! You will be part of something special, something exceptional! A new, fun way of getting the next generation engaged in stories from the Qur’aan. Why not join in as well?
  2. Acknowledgement! All backers, irrespective of the size of your contribution, will be acknowledged by name in the "Backer Community" Section of our website. Permanently.
  3. Get involved! You will have the opportunity to be involved in the development process – If you contribute, you are welcome to make product improvement suggestions. You will also be given the opportunity to vote in selecting a cover page for our first story book!!!
  4. Save! You will benefit from a cheaper price than our projected retail price of approximately 45USD* for the toy.

*This price will vary depending on the country in which it is sold.

Help us bring this project to reality. Let’s get Binaye Blocks on the shelves of major toy retailers!

Available Perks

We have a limited number of Early Bird Specials, so claim yours while they are still available!

Note: T-Shirts are an Indiegogo EXCLUSIVE!

What’s next for Binaye Blocks?

When this campaign is successful, inshaAllah, be sure to expect more toys to be released in the Binaye Blocks range. We have barely scratched the surface with the Qur’aan – the possibilities are endless!

We have already begun working on the next toy in the Binaye Blocks range.

Stretch goals

  1. If we reach $40,000 US or more, ALL backers get the free Story of Creation app! Sent to you via email (if it isn’t yet available on the Play Store/iStore by the time we have shipped)
  2. If we reach $45,000 US or more, all toys will come pre-packed with Handling Tools (for your amazing 3D printed creations) included in the set!

The Team

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

Q: What does "Binaye" mean?

A: It is a derivation of the 3-letter Arabic verb "to build".

Q: Why are you raising funds in USD?

A: Unfortunately, at this stage, Indiegogo only allows you to raise funds in USD, GBP, CAD, AUD or EUR. USD was the most cost effective option for us.

Q: If I order a toy, what will I get in the box?

A: You will receive a construction toy and a story book to go with it.

Q: What is the age group for the first toy?

A: This toy is ideally suited to children from 4 to 9 years of age. We recommend an upper age limit of 12 years.

Q: What is the cost for shipping?

A: Shipping anywhere in South Africa is free. International orders will have an additional shipping fee, which will automatically be added to your cart at checkout. For international orders, we have opted for Airmail as it is the most effective method. You are welcome to request Surface Mail, but please be advised that Surface Mail will take 8 to 12 weeks AFTER we have shipped (sometimes longer from our experience).

Q: How long will it be before I receive my order?

A: We plan to start shipping all toy orders towards the end of March, 2017, InshaAllah. This delay is largely due to the manufacture of tooling. The tooling manufacturer is awaiting go-ahead. The sooner I give them the go ahead - the sooner we start shipping. Toys will be shipped on a first-come-first-served basis. Approximate shipping time for local (South African) orders is 5-7 business days and 14-20 business days for international orders.

Q: Do you have any Islamic Qualifications?

A: I, along with my team members have all been through an Islamic Education System of some form. We have seen first-hand where the system can be improved as we have noticed a major gap in Qur'aanic education. By the grace of Almighty Allah, Ahmed and I have completed the memorization of the Qur’aan, but I am merely a student in Arabic. We are constantly learning and we hope to, one day, recruit creatives who are as enthusiastic as ourselves. As a company, we will always strive to maintain a corporate culture of continuous learning, especially in Qur’aanic Studies.

Q: What will the funds be used for?

A: This chart gives you an overview of how the funds will be spent.

Note: We have excluded costs related to development, marketing, administration as well as a trip to commission tooling at the manufacturer in China (this is necessary, in order to provide you with a quality product).

Q: What toy was used in the video?

A: At the moment, we have a working prototype, which has been 3D printed (yes, we see the irony) and performs core functions. We have put this prototype through extensive product testing. It differs from the finished product in terms of material (the prototype is resin based while the actual toy will be manufactured from a high quality, durable plastic). The colour of the finished product will also differ from the model shown in the video.

Q: Where will the toy and book be manufactured, and by whom?

A: We will try our utmost to use local manufacturers, where preference has been given to Muslims. Although expensive, I believe that local manufacture is the better option, which will allow me to closely monitor quality. The tooling for the plastic components, however, will be manufactured in China, which I will personally commission before it departs from the factory. We have partnered with an exceptional, local, plastic products manufacturer, with over 31 years of manufacturing experience. I will personally oversee the manufacture and ensure that the toys are shipped as soon as reasonably possible, with the highest quality standards. 

Q: What happens if you do not reach your funding goal?

A: We have opted for Fixed Funding, which is an all-or-nothing funding model. This means that if we do not reach the goal amount before our time runs out, you will receive a full refund from Indiegogo and this campaign will not go ahead. So please help spread the word!

story:
“One of the coolest gaming concepts of the decade” Moviepilot

“Turns the Whole Planet Into A Giant Laser Tag Battle Arena” Futurism

 

What is Father.IO?

Father.IO ™ is the world's first real-life Augmented Reality First Person Shooter.
Experience the adrenaline, tactics and strategies of gaming in your everyday life. Combining Augmented Reality and First Person Shooter battles, Father.IO brings a battleground into your backyard.  
 
 

What is Father.IO’s Inceptor?

 

The Inceptor is the first portable smartphone device that converts the real world in a huge laser tag arena. Get the Father.IO FPS app, plug the Inceptor into your smartphone and get ready for the most exciting Augmented Reality battle you have ever experienced!

The Inceptor device allows to shoot players at 50 metres distance and offers a wide range of weapons with unique features in terms of rate of fire, potential damage and shooting distance. Pick the class you prefer, use its exclusive geo-location based abilities to win battles and find enemies and co-players with your GPS radar.
 

  • CQC or Sniper style? Choose between 4 different weapons (Assault rifle, Sniper rifle, SMG and Handgun) each with different shooting distance and accuracy, rate of fire and damage potential: pick your favourite fps gaming style!
  • 4 Classes with unique GPS based abilities: Ammo crate, Medikit, EMP and Claymore!
  • Fast paced real life actions! Aim your enemies up to 50m/150feet distance - if you have a sniper rifle
  • “Lan Party” Minimal lag thanks to the Inceptors Local Broadcasting via SubGhz
  • GPS based radar to locate team mates, enemies and respawn points. Of course, you’ll see enemies on map and radar only when they are shooting. We are gamers!
  • Up to 16 vs 16 in team matches or 32 free for all
  • Indoor and outdoor gameplay with automatic IR power calibration, based on light condition
  • Headshot recognition up to 20 meters / 65 feet

 

 

 

 

Compatibility

The Inceptor device works with all iPhone 5c or newer and Android 4.4 or higher with Bluetooth 4 (Low Energy). Tablet or iPad devices are not compatible. The Universal Mounting is compatible with smartphones of width up to 8 cm.

 

The Father.IO AR FPS is available soon for free on App Store /Google Play

 

Is the Inceptor and Father.IO game ready?

YES! We developed the inceptor and Father.IO thanks to the support of 7000 backers. We couldn’t have done it without you guys! 

 

What's Included in a single box?

  • 1 Inceptor
  • 1 Universal Mounting

USB cable NOT included

 

What's Included in the double pack?

  • 2 Inceptors
  • 2 Universal Mounting

USB cable NOT included

 

FAQ

Is the Inceptor a camera?

NO. It is a Bluetooth Laser Tag. It connects via Bluetooth 4 to the smartphone and shots and receive IR up to 50 meters.

Can I play with the Inceptor alone?

No, you need at least one other person (equipped with an Inceptor device) to play against.

Do I need an internet connection?

An Internet connection is needed to play Father.IO. Data consumption is reduced to the bare minimum as we don’t stream 3D information in real time.

Do I have to pay VAT / GST?    

Customers are responsible for assuring the product can be lawfully imported to the destination country. The recipient is the importer of record and must comply with all laws and regulations of the destination country. Orders shipped may be subject to import taxes, customs duties and fees levied by the destination country. The recipient of an international shipment may be subject to such import taxes, customs duties and fees, which are levied once a shipment reaches the recipient's country. Additional charges for customs clearance must be fulfilled by the recipient; Proxy42 has no control over these charges.

What is your refund policy?    

Refunds are processed on a case-by-case basis. At some point we will need to lock down refunds in order to go into production and ship product to you. We will not be able to refund orders once they've shipped.

story:
Short Summary

You just found Demoria's fundraiser page, one of the few MMORPG's developed with Unity3D and the only running MMORPG made with Unity. Unity isn't popular now but it is soon going to be bursting with popularity on Unity 5's release. 

Demoria Online is associated with a non profit organization called Ruletech Games which young adults about to graduate from adolescene get a sense of the workplace and how it is to work as a team. We also have actual developers within the organization that do this for a living. We run entirely on donations and need funds to get this project off the ground.

  • Hello, I'm Michael also known as IRuletech on Youtube and AwakenedRage in the developer community and I'm the Lead programmer for Demoria Online.
  • The reason I hold this project in high priority isn't just popularity, I have been creating Fanfictions for years now and have been a fan of Square Enix's Kingdom Hearts series since I was 7 and I have noticed that barely any MMORPG's that have multiple worlds with different themes and mechanics to the extent that Kingdom Hearts does. We plan to make a game unique in its own way.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Particularly we need 2000$ of the 5000$ trying to raise in order to get assets, software and hardware for our servers. Demoria Online is a MMORPG which will require powerful servers and multiple of them.
  • Lawyers and Copyright, we don't want people stealing the glory that we worked hard for.
  • The funds will go towards these things if we don't make it towards the 2000$
  • You can get a variety of rewards such as an Alpha Key for testing Demoria as soon as it is in its Alpha stage and contribute to fixing bugs by donating $15.

The Impact

Every contribution makes a difference to us and the world. By donating you have helped Demoria Online become to the first Multi-Themed world MMORPG made with Unity.

  • Demoria Online will always keep you occupied, within a reasonable level. We cover all aspects and have world that each have different natures. Make an impact on MMORPG's like never done before.

Risks & Challenges

cSharp is a very rare programming language to find people to recruit for projects without pay and Demoria uses that programming language to implement advance mechanics. We have also been having some security issues and need funds to patch those security holes.

  • To pay cSharp developers if we get stumped.
  • There are people who do not want this project to happen. We suspect it is another project that is using Unity3D. We need to have funds to be able to promptly to any security threats they generate.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Advertise Demoria!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • If you are good at 3D Modeling, Animation or Programming and feel that you can help the project send a request through Skype to student4001243

  The Impact Every contribution makes a difference to us and the world. By donating you have helped Demoria Online become to the first Multi-Themed world MMORPG made with Unity. Demoria Online will always keep you occupied, within a reasonable level. We cover all aspects and have world that each have different natures. Make an impact on MMORPG's like never done before.

  Risks & Challenges cSharp is a very rare programming language to find people to recruit for projects without pay and Demoria uses that programming language to implement advance mechanics. We have also been having some security issues and need funds to patch those security holes. 
To pay cSharp developers if we get stumped.
There are people who do not want this project to happen. We suspect it is another project that is using Unity3D. We need to have funds to be able to promptly to any security threats they generate.
 Describe your plan for solving these challenges. 
  Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: 
Advertise Demoria!
 Use the Indiegogo share tools!
If you are good at 3D Modeling, Animation or Programming and feel that you can help the project send a request through Skype to student4001243

story:
Pushe (pronounced push) is a very simple game. All you do is push some animals up a bunch of lanes, in order to get one of each animal on the top row, at which point you can clear that row and score points.

You can even play a live demo of it on my website. (Not there anymore (hasn't been since 2015), but I might remake it.)

But everyone I've shown it to, even strangers on the Internet, say it's fun, addictive, and would be perfect as a mobile app. And so, I want to make it into one. But to do that, I need your help.

 

Who I am

I'm Joe Zeng, a designer and programmer of games. I've made a few mildly successful games online in my spare time, such as 144 and Goomy Clicker, the latter of which has received over 360,000 hits since I created it back in October 2013.

But both of those creations have in common the fact that they're both clearly derived from other, already-popular works - 144 is a spinoff of 2048, and Goomy Clicker is a spinoff of Cookie Clicker involving a Pokémon.

Pushe is the first original work that I've put out to the public.

 

Why I'm raising funds

I won't lie, this game took quite a while to polish up a demo for. Despite having a simple premise and minimalistic gameplay, it took a long time to design all parts of the program to work as smoothly and look as good as they do in the demo.

To make a mobile app and distribute it is going to be an even bigger challenge, and I need a revenue stream to make sure it's worth my while. Putting this proposal out there to see how many people would help crowdfund a mobile version of this game is an awesome way to gauge interest and see if people are interested enough in playing it for a revenue stream to exist.

 

What the app will have

You may be wondering what the mobile app would have to make it better than the version I've posted online as a demo.

The app will have the 5 animals you see in the demo as defaults, plus 20 unlockable animals. (As a bonus, four of those unlockables will appear in the top image of this Indiegogo campaign as time goes on.)

It will have three modes of play:

  • Classic Mode: clear as many rows as you can in 90 seconds.
  • Arcade Mode: the more rows you clear, the more time you get.
  • Endless Mode: just shift animals and clear rows. The game never ends.


It will have two levels of difficulty - four columns and five columns - in case you want to make the game a little easier by playing with one less column.

It will have a high scores table, as well as a global scoreboard to compare your scores to other players.

 

Goals

The $2,000 I'm asking for in this campaign is bare-minimum funds for a basic, ad-supported Android version (although all funders will get an ad-free version as thanks). Supposing you managed to collectively raise more than that, here's what I'd use it towards.
 

  • If you raise at least $5,000, then I will also make an iOS version of this game. The extra $3,000 will go towards buying an iOS development system and toolkit and an Apple developer license, as well as the extra work that it would take to make that iOS version.
  • If you raise at least $8,000, I will make the game entirely ad-free for everybody, and convert the perk of an ad-free version into the perk of a special funder-only edition with bonus material.
  • If you somehow manage to raise more than that, I will make more stuff up as stretch goals.

Also, for every $200 you raise past the initial goal, I will put one more unlockable animal into the game.

 

Risks, Challenges, and Contingency Plans

Originally I wanted to do this campaign as all-or-nothing funding. So that if the first goal of $2,000 wasn't met, nobody would be charged anything.

But the fact that fixed funding on requires people to commit through PayPal was enough to make me choose the flex funding campaign instead. Supposing that this campaign doesn't reach its funding goal, here's what I would use the funds toward that were raised:

  • Improving the web game. Right now the game is a completed but tiny demo of what I have envisioned for the mobile app.
  • Starting other, better games. Pushe is my first serious venture into crowdfunding and commercial game development, and I'd like to work on more of these games in the future, potentially even in teams with other people.
  • Building the mobile app more slowly. I'd have to work on it in my spare time only, which, for anyone who's done game development before knows, takes a very long time to accomplish.

story:
WHAT THIS IS...

In the spirit of “Grim Fandango” and "Discworld Noir", but with the classic look of golden era point and clicks such as “The Secret of Monkey Island”, “The Big Sheep” is a dark, twisting murder mystery conspiracy story based on the idea that all nursery rhymes are fractured, confused accounts of events in the same twisted story. It will provide a treat for fans of old school adventures and mystery lovers alike.

The Big Sheep was a concept created from a love of point and click adventure games, folklore, and classic hardboiled noir detective stories and films. It recasts Bo Peep as Bo the Peeper, and teases out the dark edges of these beloved childhood poems by pairing them with the shadowy overtones of the noir genre.

 

The player takes the role of Bo the Peeper, private detective and one of few surviving believers in justice in a town gone bad. What seems like a  straightforward case for her leads to clashing heads with Duke York, the chief of The Town's police force, and the Jacks, a sinister mafia-type organisation that seems to be running The Town from beneath. As Bo gets entrenched deeper and deper in the swirling, bloody pot of mysteries, can she get out alive? Maybe you can even help her solve the mystery that is still closest to her heart - Where HAS her sheep gone?


The game will feature over thirty unique and painstakingly drawn interactive rooms, a huge cast of characters, and a complex, involving mystery that will keep you guessing and gasping up to the very end.

 

WHO WE ARE...

We are a dedicated two person creative team based in England UK consisting of Davy and Kimberleigh Malay. Davy is an artist from the North of England whose work includes comics and point and click adventure games. His large scale installation piece “This is only this” was recently displayed at the Northern Gallery for Contemporary Arts. He is working as main writer and background artist on “The Big Sheep”. He has been active in the indie adventure game scene for more than a decade, and his previous adventure games include “The Day That Nothing Happened” and the forthcoming “Teardrop”.  
Kimberleigh is a folklorist from Michigan USA who gives the project a strong backbone of support; editing, voice acting, play testing, and giving the occasional hand with coding, animating, or concept art.  



THE IMPACT...

By funding “The Big Sheep”, you are allowing us the opportunity to work full time on this project, giving us the chance to fully devote our energies toward creating the most polished and most professional game we can. With this money, we will also be able to employ an animator to take some of the load of the graphics work from Davy, and to pay for the moody, bluesy noir soundtrack that Bo's world deserves. It will also allow us to hire actors to fully voice the game, and feed and support ourselves while we work on it. We have already poured countless hours into this project, and would love to be able to work on it full time on this project, and with this funding, we can do so. With full funding, we aim to have the game completed by the new year.

Donating also gives you the chance to receive the incentives packages detailed in the sidebar. Higher levels of donation come with more exciting perks, including the opportunity for yourself or a friend to have a character in the game based on their likeness, or even provide a voice for a character.   

If we don’t make goal: The people who donated will still get their incentives, and we will still make the game, but it may take longer to be finished for release, and the overall polish of the finished game probably won’t be as high. 
If we make goal: The game will get made, hopefully finished for release by coming new year, with voice acting, music, and an offbeat noir story. 
    If we make 5k: The game release will include special features.
    If we make more than that: MockPuppet games will be able to fund other game projects we have planned.

If we exceed our goal the game will have more special features and over all polish. Depending how much more, we may also have the opportunity to launch other projects.

You can also lend your support to this project by sharing it with your friends and helping us reach a wider audience. We’re grateful for everyone’s enthusiasm and encouragement!

To keep you informed about this and other projects we’ve created a blog that will give regular updates on the game’s progress: http://mockpuppetgames.wordpress.com/

story:
We are a group of artists and software developers which is born with the purpose of making Indie videogames, with its own style characterised by a great gameplay, atmosphere and art surrounding them.. With our video games we want to transmit feelings, because of that we call them "video games with soul"

Visit our website for more info about us

And check out our blog


Traducciones/translations: 

  • Español
  • Française


*** THE GRAPHICS AND VIDEOS SHOWED ARE FROM A PRELIMINAR RELEASE, WE ARE WORKING ON IMPROVE THE GRAPHIC ART ==> WE WILL INFORM ABOUT OUR PROGRESS ACROSS NEW UPDATES ***  


For our first crowdfunding campaign we present "Coco", we think it is the first video game designed with ChromaDepth displaying (we have not found any other like this up to now, apart from our public demo of Nagual)



"Coco, the first ChromaDepth displaying video game ever"

  1. Update 1: Spanish translation
  2. Actualización 1: Traducción al castellano
  3. Update 2: Coco cover making-of
  4. Update 3: Press media. Articles about Coco
  5. Update 4: Now we are Nintendo´s authorized developers!. New Funding Goal for WiiU version has been added
  6. Update 5: Pitch Video of Futuresco Games and Coco returns
  7. Update 6: Online Demo release. enjoy it on: http://www.futurescogames.com/coco-returns-online-demo---en.html
  8. Update 7: New media press referrals
  9. Update 8: Coco gameplay video
  10. Update 9: The evolution of our hero Coco
  11. Update 10: Traduction française
  12. Update 11: New demo downloads website, access here


We want to offer all you participate in this innovative project being one of our firsts backers who support the effort of our team investigating this technique and obtain great rewards.

Help us to get the first ChromaDepth video game ever!

We are asking a short goal because our team is willing to finish the game even though we don't reach the goal. Also we will schedule new goal steps for funding the release of the game in more platforms and with new features and levels


With Chromadepth technique the gamer will play "Coco" in 2D display mode or in 3D mode, with the use of a special glasses that we will include as reward.

Pedro Orts, our graphic artist, is a pioneer in the use of this technique and has a great expertise of many years in this innovative and unique 3D.

(You can also buy ChromaDepth glasses on some online shops, take a look to our website for further information)

                        


                        

Showing our video games and ChromaDepth glasses and stuff in RetroMadrid 2013



Estimated release date:  4Q 2013 - 1Q 2014 (Depending on the funding goals result)
Platforms: Initially for Windows PC and tablets (but depending on the funding goals reached in the campaign we would extend it to MAC and ubuntu linux computers and tablets Android and iPAD)


The funds we ask are destined for:

  • Buy GameMaker licenses
  • Buy physical devices: Tablets (iPAD, Android, Windows, Ubuntu Linux), MAC computer 
  • Buy a server for our virtual team
  • Production of the rewards
  • Develop new levels, features, platform compatibility... incluided in the new goal steps
  • Administrative procedures rates

Our campaign is flexible, if we do not reach the first goal we are commited to finish the game (first goal step) and send all the rewards. 

"Coco" is a puzzle style game based on the mazes´s classical video games, with a funny cartoon graphic style that remind us to video games like Pacman.

You play Coco, a young spirit trapped on his fears, your mission is guiding to Coco to find the gate towards the freedom. But take care, many dangers will await you: different types of enemies, transporters, secret doors, sliding blocks... 

Reach the exit and escape!

The origin of "Coco" game comes from an amateur free video game created by Raúl Hernández, you can find further information on our website (and even download the old version). Because of this reason we also call the game "Coco returns".

We have evolved this old version with new great features:


  • ChromaDepth displaying system: Put your ChromaDepth glasses on and enjoy of a 3D visualization that will transport you to the Coco´s world. Yes!, without extra hardware!. And if you don´t have any ChromaDepth glasses you can also play Coco in 2D mode
  • Touchscreen or mouse control system
  • At least 40 levels that will surprise you for its originality and increasing difficulty
  • Two different initial difficulty levels, Normal and Inferno
  • Graphic restyling, new scenarios and character's designs
  • Great gameplay elements and powerups
  • First release for PC-Windows and Windows tablets (first step goal)
  • Enjoy the soundtrack remake 
  • Score system

 

                         

                         

                         

                         

You can find more screenshot on Coco pinterest board.


The original theme "Ode to Cassadra" is a work of art by the canadian composer Denis Desbiens. We have arranged it with several variations, made by the twice considered to Grammy awards of Los Angeles, Julio Soria.




Visit our team webpage to know more about our team members

And check out our Futuresco Games team board

You can spread this innovative project across your friends and professional collegues circles using social networks and the tools that Indiegogo provide to do it.

And finally... our most sincerelly THANKS for your support to get this project happen.

story:
Where are all the great games?

Hi there, my name is Xanther Logan and I'm here to ask for your help in getting my first game app financed so that I can create even more great and exciting game apps. Iâ€™ve got a number of really fun apps planned, but such is life, I just donâ€™t have enough capital to get the ball rolling. I can get the designs done for the first app, but actual coding costs a bit and I just donâ€™t quite have the funds for it :(


The Impact

I'm like you. I want to know where my money goes if I give it to someone or some cause. It's only natural. Without going into too much detail I can tell you that by helping to get my app created, you will have helped start something great and fun. Once this first app is created, the revenue from it will allow me to develop the rest of the games I have planned.


What We Need & What You Get

I'm not asking for a lot because, frankly I don't need a lot. I've got most of the funding myself through savings but I need just that little bit extra to get everything rolling. I'm needing $5000.00 and all of this will be going towards paying a fantastic team of designers and developers to create my first mobile game app for IOS and Android. If I don't get all of the funding, I'll have to skip the Android development initially until the IOS app brings in revenue and then I will get the app ported to Android devices once I have the funds for it. Both myself and the developers are excited about these projects, and I personally can't wait to see people enjoying my first app...


The first app we're making is a bit of a mixture of genres from old school games that I know everyone will enjoy. Think Super Mario Brothers meets Crash Bandicoot meets Street Fighter. This is going to be a truly epic game that has a really cool, cartoonish design similar to that you see in the Halfbrick games and Angry Birds. For every $5 donated, I will ensure that you get a free copy of not only this app gifted to you for you to enjoy but every app I do this year (there are currently half a dozen planned and more to come â€“ each will be $0.99/Â£0.69 per download.) and for every $10 donated, I will gift this first app to you and all of your friends (plus you'll still get every app I do this year free too!)


Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to help me out financially, that's ok. I know times are tough. But if you can't lend a buck, please could you tell everyone you know about my campaign as maybe they can provide some funding or know someone who can. Thank you all for taking the time to read this and hopefully this will be the start of something really amazing.
