 producción. El margen de beneficio es 0 para Questron.Anteriormente, en nuestra campaña personal, ya recogimos fondos para hacer una primera tirada impresa, pero debido a que la repercusión de esa primera recaudación fue bastante reducida, llegando a oídos tan sólo del núcleo que formábamos en Questron-Rol, decidimos, tras recibir numerosas peticiones por parte de aficionados y tiendas del ramo, abrir una nueva campaña una vez el juego estuviera traducido y maquetado para que todo el mundo tuviera la oportunidad de hacerse con un ejemplar.No existe ningún riesgo a la hora de contribuir a esta campaña. Tal y como hicimos en nuestras campañas personales, Questron se compromete a sacar adelante este proyecto se recaude lo que se recaude. Simplemente queremos respaldarnos con toda la ayuda posible, pero el juego impreso SALDRÁ, repetimos, se recaude lo que se recaude.Lo que más necesitamos, además de vuestro apoyo económico, es que esta campaña no padezca el mismo mal que padeció nuestra primera campaña personal, y esto es: NECESITAMOS QUE LA GENTE SEPA QUE ESTE PROYECTO EXISTE. Por favor, difúndelo como veas oportuno y puedas. De igual manera que necesitamos vuestro dinero, también necesitamos vuestra voz.
El tiempo de espera a la hora de recibir vuestras recompensas será mínimo. Como hemos dicho ya en este texto, el juego ya está traducido, maquetado y editado en PDF. Una vez finalizada la campaña, se daría orden de impresión, y una vez recibidos todos los ejemplares, les haríamos llegar sus ejemplares correspondientes a cada mecenas a través de mensajería (no correos, mensajería, servicio 48h)... Esto es, nos comprometemos a que los libros estarán en vuestra casa a los dos meses de finalizar la campaña. Obviamente, todo este proyecto cuenta con el consentimiento y apoyo de la editorial Mongoose Publishing, poseedora de los derechos sobre este juego.Por favor, no dudéis en hacernos llegar cualquier duda o pregunta que se os pueda plantear al respecto de este proyecto a través de esta misma página, o a través de nuestro mail traduciendorol@gmail.com

story:
**CONTEST**

Hello All,

We have decided to start a bit of a contest for everybody!

The rules are:

1. You must have pledged a minimum of $5

2. You must use your unique indiegogo link found under the video on the main page

What to do?

We want you to try to get as many people to this campaign as possible! This means that we will pick the person that has referred the most amount of people to our campaign and bump them up to the next highest perk pack for free as well as have a completely free downloadable copy of OBSUDO for you when it comes out.

Lets start referring! 

Thank you for all your help to make this a reality!



Summary

OBSUDO is a multiplayer hacker game which provides you with an immersive virtual environment for which you play. This game is a perfect mix between Uplink, The Sims & MMORPG game structure. Bringing together a fully simulated metropolis, with full network structure, and a built-in progression system that is actually meaningful to players.

The artificial intelligence (AI) of the OBSUDO servers are highly advanced and built from the ground up specifically for the game. The way we have it laid out allows for 1 000 000 completely unique, low impact NPC's with fast lookups so you feel like you are playing with real people. On top of this, the state of the art AI is so advanced that the politics and economy of the game will continue to grow and evolve despite any player activity. Yeah, that's right, OBSUDO still plays itself, even without any players online.

OBSUDO is a virtual world with cities, people, companies, politics, hangouts along with a full economic and political system. And what makes everything better, just like the world today, everything is hackable!

Platform

At this time OBSUDO will run soley on Computers but is cross platform! OBSUDO is being designed to run on Windows, Mac OSX & Linux!

What We Need and What You Get

Where the money is going

  • 7-12%   - Indiegogo & related fees
  • 10%      - Perks & shipping of perks
  • 20%      - Game servers & related services
  • 58-63% - Support of staff salaries

The Perks

We have had fun developing our perk packs and hope you enjoy them just as much as we did. Our perks offer you one-of-a-kind merchandise and opportunities all directly related to OBSUDO.

**NOTE: Any and all customs fees are your responsibility as the receiver of the product. Also, for those pledging from outside of Canada and the U.S., shipping fees may apply to perks. 

What if we don't reach our goal?

If we don't end up reaching our goal we will still use funds raised for game development. Of course game development will be much slower as we will have to dedicate more of our time and resources to other jobs in order to pay our bills.


Stretch Goals

$45,000 ~ We Will Build It

This is the minimum amount we require to build OBSUDO. With this amount we will build OBSUDO to a fully operational state.

$50,000 ~ Custom Challenges

Most of the game is procedurally generated. If we raise this level of funding, we will manually go in and create custom puzzles to challenge the ambitious players and keep the game interesting.

$60,000 ~ More Game Content

We will develop much more "in-game content". This will include, but is not limited to, easter eggs, services, global companies, operating systems, hardware, software, and minigames.

$75,000 ~ Graphical Mod Support

Up to this point, the game is limited to what we as developers have decided the graphics should look like. If we reach this goal we will develop extra graphic options that will make the game much more immersive. We will also add the option to mod your operating system graphics with in game tools so that you can have a very personalized gaming experience.

$80,000 ~ Signed Copy of Game

If we reach this goal we will give everyone that donated from tier 3 ($50) or higher a promo code for the OBSUDO website. This code will, upon purchase of the downloadable copy, give you a free CD copy that has been signed by the lead developers.

$100,000 ~ Single Player Mode

We will develop a full single player campaign that can be played offline. This will be complete with as many features from multiplayer as are appropriate.

$110,000 ~ Request Based Extras

This is where the fun begins! We will take feedback from YOU and fit in as many realistic feature requests as possible to make the game more interesting and fun for you to play.

$140,000 ~ Expansion Pack

We have tons of ideas that just aren't economically feasible for the first version of OBSUDO if we want to get it to you in a reasonable time. At this level we will begin development on an expansion pack for OBSUDO as soon as production of the main game is completed.

? ~ Overkill Development

Anything over $140,000 we will use to add features, support, server improvements and anything else we can do to make OBSUDO a much more entertaining game for you to play!

The Impact

STEAM

Yes, we do mean the popular gaming community used by over 30 000 000 gamers worldwide. We have plans to develop into the Steam system to give you an environment that you know and love! You will be able to more easily chat with friends, get subscriptions, game vouchers etc. in the friendly and easy to use Steam environment. Due to the steam acceptance process we can't guarantee that OBSUDO will be on Steam at this time, but as game development progresses we will have a better grasp of whether it will actually be on Steam or not. We of course will keep you posted on updates about Steam and when we have it in the Steam consideration process we will need your help to get the word out so it is accepted for distribution by Steam.

Subscriptions

No, this is not a subscription based game! We are going to offer many opportunities in the game to add levels of immersion. One of which will be subscription packs. These subscriptions will allow for added functionality and convenience. One thing we do NOT want to do is to weigh the game in favor of those who are paying more money, so we are not adding advantages, merely conveniences. We have not fully laid out what our subscription packs will include as we will need a almost completed game in order to fully develop these packs but I have put an example of one of the features below.

In OBSUDO, you will obviously be able to log out of your game. The catch is that you will be able to log out in one of two ways. 

1. Disconnect your system from the OBSUDO network leaving your computer safe from attack while you are not physically there.

2. Leave your system connected to the OBSUDO network allowing for programs to continue auto hacks, password decryption, contribute to your clans network etc.

One of the features of the subscription pack will allow you to get a warning directly to your phone via SMS (text message) or to email in the event that your OBSUDO system is under attack while you are not physically there.

This is just one of the many features that will be added into the subscription packs. We will release more as it comes available.

Interested, But Don't Have the Cash?

That’s okay! You can still do so much to help us out and we appreciate every bit of help you can give us.  Because of you, our dreams aren't so farfetched. Below are some awesome ways you can help us without donating money directly.

Share Share Share

Tell everyone you know about this campaign and ask them to do the same. You can use the Indiegogo Share tool or for your convenience we have made an easy to remember link to this campaign - www.obsudo.com/indiegogo

Join our affiliate program.

We have an extensive affiliate program that we are very excited about! Basically, you tell people about OBSUDO and we will give you OBSUDO FREE! After you have the game you have the option of continuing to tell people about our game and getting cool stuff such as game subscriptions and more all for FREE. To learn more go to www.obsudo.com/affiliate

Blog, Facebook & Twitter

Another excellent way to help us out is by sharing our game on social networking sites. This includes Facebook, Twitter, Blogspot and any other social networking sites you might be part of. If you do blogs please write a good review with a link to the campaign and the OBSUDO website. Again, we really appreciate any help you can give us. Remember, you can sign up for our affiliate program and post your affiliate link to get a little extra for yourself.

Bloggers - If you write a good solid blog about OBSUDO, send us an email with a link to it and proof that you wrote it and we may even add a special note about you on our sponsors page.

Concept art

story:
Dungeon Designer is a game where you and your crack staff of artisans create dungeons for Boss Monsters. Get paid as hopeful heroes die! Keep getting paid until the Boss is slain! Micro-manage your way to the top in this challenging Dungeon Simulator! With gorgeous pixel art and killer chip-tune soundtrack, this neo-retro sim game is what you've been waiting for.

above: early sketches of Artisans (your staff)


Dungeon Designer is a Business Simulator being developed with Unity3D for PC, Mac, and Linux.

Mobile versions for IOS and Android will be created if we meet our extended goals! (see below)


Boss Monster Clients approach you to make their dungeons for them.

Choose every feature of your dungeon, from Monsters, Puzzles, Traps, Treasure, and even interior design! With near infinite different dungeon combinations, creating the perfect dungeon for the client requires skill and intuition!

You aren't alone! You have the skills of 6 skilled artisans to design and craft for your dungeon. As they level up, unique skill trees help you research feature upgrades and stats! 

  • Over 2500 possible clients! Never have the same demands twice!
  • Use logic, skill, and intuition to give your Boss Monster the optimal environment!
  • Decide the Location, Monsters, Traps, Puzzles, Interior, Treasure, and MORE!
  • Watch as puny heroes try and conquer your mighty dungeon!
  • You have a staff of artisans that level up and unlock new dungeon features!
  • Keep earning money from your dungeon until a hero kills the Boss Monster! 
  • Unique Heroes with families and emotion that can level up, posing larger threats!
  • An ever-shifting global paradigm to motivate heroes!
  • Comprehensive rating system!
  • Complete special challenges to win the Boss's Treasure for your self!
  • Protect the treasure you've won by building dungeons for yourself!
  • Story line with multiple endings!



  • Main Building and Rating system 80%
  • Main Database 60%
  • Dialog 10%
  • Balance 60%
  • Graphics 10%
  • Music/SFX 0%



  • 12'000 - Build for ios and Android.
  • 16'000 - New mode: Hero Storm! Be a mighty hero and take on dungeons you've made!
  • 20'000 - level cap goes from 15 to 20, with all new extra content for higher level challenges!


Our development team Chrono Studios is comprised of three awesome people!

Jesse Miki - Lead designer/coder
Nicholas Drescher - Graphics
Sam McLean - Dialog and flavor text

Together we form Chrono Studios. Based out of Winnipeg Manitoba Canada, we have been working together since we were childhood friends making board games together in our parent's houses. Now we have joined together to bring you a game we all truly believe in and have always wanted to play.


The funds are to pay for licenses, computer upgrades, and the ability to work solely on Dungeon Designer for the duration of production. 

Thanks for donating! Don't think you aren't getting anything in return though! Thanks to your generous donation we are able to make our dream come to fruition, and we want to thank you with perks!

story:
The Last Train is an Alternate History Survival Strategy Game, set in North America post the Atomic Bombings on Hiroshima and Nagasaki. It is currently being developed by Smash Game Studios.

You will begin your journey on the West Coast. As one of the last few survivors of post World War II America, you will have to help and guide the remaining survivors through the catastrophe that happens during the war. You will be given rewards everytime you help someone, use the rewards gained to cook a good meal for yourself or you could offer it to one of the survivors waiting in the station. However cooking is not the only thing you will be doing,  use the items to craft different tools which you can use to scavenge items upon entering each city. Almost every object within the city will be interactive.

When released the game will be launching on PC and Mac on Steam.

We love survival adventure games a lot, so we asked ourselves this pressing question, what would we want to create if we had a chance to do something crazy? The answer was what ended up being The Last Train. As huge World War history nerds we absolutely loved the idea of having an alternative timeline to what happened after the Bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki.

The question we had in mind was WHAT IF Japan had the resources to retaliate, what could have happened? What could have happened to the lives of people going about their normal day to day lives. Would it have been the America that we know and love right now for its amazing culture and influence around the world?

We took a step back and started to take a route, where we wanted to focus more on the normal people rather than the Great Soldiers who fought valiantly on the battlefields. How would they go about their lives if a catastrophe of that magnitude hits them? That was the core philosophy that we wanted the game to represent. We want the game to tell you stories about how people regardless of their Gender, Sexuality and Status were affected by this catastrophe.

Your objective in the game is to pick up passengers from one city and drop them off at another, however the process will not be that simple, as each passenger gives you different classes of rewards. You will have to choose your options wisely based on what you need, because at the end of the day even you are a survivor trying to make it out alive. We have over 200 different passengers, each of them have their own unique backstory, destination and reward they will be giving you. All those things have been carefully handcrafted because we didn't want to break the immersion of the game by showing a reward that is unbelievable from a person with a certain backstory.

During each playthrough of the story mode you will encounter about 100 of the passengers, we wanted to create more since we wanted your story to progress based on how you engage with each passenger. Different events happen in the main story based on the type of survivors you choose to help out. Are you going to be selfish and figure out a way for yourself to survive? or are you going to make sure you help as many people as you can. The choice is yours.

We will also be adding a Sandbox Mode which will allow you to keep helping as many people as you can before you die and be able to compete with your friends in the Online Leaderboards.

  • Travel Mechanic
  • Passenger Interactions
  • Drop or kick off passengers halfway through if you find a passenger with better rewards
  • Scavenging and basic crafting mechanic
  • Main Art for the stations, cities, maps, buildings and basic UI
  • 40% of the character art has been completed

  • After we played the New Legend of Zelda we were inspired by the randomness and the surprise of the cooking system, so we want to have a version of it into the game
  • Story Mode Cut Scene Artwork
  • Character Art
  • Highly interactive 2D Scavenging Gameplay
  • Sound Design
  • Expand the crafting system to have more recipes
  • Steam Exclusive features (Leaderboards, Trading Cards, Etc.)

 

 

PC, Mac and Linux versions of the game will be launched initially on Steam. We will later be adding it into the DRM free stores like GOG and itch.io if the funding goals are met.

The game would be first launched in English, French, German, Russian and Chinese. Others will be determined after release.

The project is made by 3 people, one Programmer, one Artist and one Designer/Artist. All of us with a passion for Technology, Art and History. We are using Unity 3D to develop the game. The programmer has worked on many games which have been published on Steam. We use Photoshop and Illustrator to work on the art for the game and have been working on the project full time for the last 4 months. We just need your help to get us through the final phase of development.

We are looking to hire a sound designer and a character artist to help us with the art for the story mode.

We believe in what we do and truly love it.

The game is in the alpha stage of development. There is a lot of work to be done, the development is progressing full steam ahead. We are working on giving the players the possible experience we can. 

This Indiegogo campaign is planned to help us complete the project. We are looking to hire a sound designer and a character artist to help us finish the sound design and the art for the passengers respectively. Apart from that we will be hiring localising services to help us translate the game to multiple languages.

Budget has been broken down keeping the 5000$ budget in mind. We will be updating it as we keep reaching our goals for the project.

Closed Alpha Version September 2017

Closed Beta Version December 2017

Final Release Early 2018

Which platforms will the game be available on?

The game will be playable on PC, Mac and Linux on Steam at launch.

What will be the system requirements for this game?

The game already works on a whole range of mid-high range configurations. Currently i5 CPU, 4 GB Ram and not too old 1GB GPU is the actual minimum for low settings, but this may change at the time of release.

Where can I buy the game after release?

The game can be bought on Steam initially, but after a while we are planning to get the game up and running for the GOG and itch.io Stores as well.

Will there be multiplayer in the game?

When we started work on the project we wanted the game to tell numerous interesting stories than allowing the players to each other.

Will there be combat in the game?

The game is intended to be a very grounded narrative experience, so combat will not be a part of the game.

When will the game be released?

The game will be released in Early 2018.

Will there be an Early Access or Open Alpha?

No, we do not intend to launch the game as an Early Access. It will be out worldwide at the same time on Steam.

Will there be a Console Version?

Right now we are solely focussing all our efforts on the PC Version of the game. We would definitely love to work on getting the game ported to consoles as well and all you awesome people of the VITA Island, we want to get our game there more than anything :)

Why don't you have any physical rewards for the backers?

We believe developing the game is the most important thing. Since we are a really small team we don't want to spend our time worrying about how to sell you Cups, T shirts and other Swag. We truly believe and love the project, we want to work our tails off to make it as great as it can be.

The biggest challenge we are facing right now is because of the size of the team.

We are a small team of 3, but we will give it our all to get the project to the finish line. We are focused on delivering the best possible experience we can to all you lovely people!

If you've come this far down the description we really thank you! You are the best and we love you. Even if you can't help us by backing it we would really appreciate it if you can get the word out to your friends and family. Thanks Again.

Keep up with the development by following us on Facebook, Twitter, Youtube for the latest dev blogs and the updates section of this campaign page.
story_txt:
The Last Train is an Alternate History Survival Strategy Game, set in North America post the Atomic Bombings on Hiroshima and Nagasaki. It is currently being developed by Smash Game Studios.
You will begin your journey on the West Coast. As one of the last few survivors of post World War II America, you will have to help and guide the remaining survivors through the catastrophe that happens during the war. You will be given rewards everytime you help someone, use the rewards gained to cook a good meal for yourself or you could offer it to one of the survivors waiting in the station. However cooking is not the only thing you will be doing,  use the items to craft different tools which you can use to scavenge items upon entering each city. Almost every object within the city will be interactive.
When released the game will be launching on PC and Mac on Steam.

We love survival adventure games a lot, so we asked ourselves this pressing question, what would we want to create if we had a chance to do something crazy? The answer was what ended up being The Last Train. As huge World War history nerds we absolutely loved the idea of having an alternative timeline to what happened after the Bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki.
The question we had in mind was WHAT IF Japan had the resources to retaliate, what could have happened? What could have happened to the lives of people going about their normal day to day lives. Would it have been the America that we know and love right now for its amazing culture and influence around the world?
We took a step back and started to take a route, where we wanted to focus more on the normal people rather than the Great Soldiers who fought valiantly on the battlefields. How would they go about their lives if a catastrophe of that magnitude hits them? That was the core philosophy that we wanted the game to represent. We want the game to tell you stories about how people regardless of their Gender, Sexuality and Status were affected by this catastrophe.

Your objective in the game is to pick up passengers from one city and drop them off at another, however the process will not be that simple, as each passenger gives you different classes of rewards. You will have to choose your options wisely based on what you need, because at the end of the day even you are a survivor trying to make it out alive. We have over 200 different passengers, each of them have their own unique backstory, destination and reward they will be giving you. All those things have been carefully handcrafted because we didn't want to break the immersion of the game by showing a reward that is unbelievable from a person with a certain backstory.
During each playthrough of the story mode you will encounter about 100 of the passengers, we wanted to create more since we wanted your story to progress based on how you engage with each passenger. Different events happen in the main story based on the type of survivors you choose to help out. Are you going to be selfish and figure out a way for yourself to survive? or are you going to make sure you help as many people as you can. The choice is yours.
We will also be adding a Sandbox Mode which will allow you to keep helping as many people as you can before you die and be able to compete with your friends in the Online Leaderboards.


Travel Mechanic
Passenger Interactions
Drop or kick off passengers halfway through if you find a passenger with better rewards
Scavenging and basic crafting mechanic
Main Art for the stations, cities, maps, buildings and basic UI
40% of the character art has been completed



After we played the New Legend of Zelda we were inspired by the randomness and the surprise of the cooking system, so we want to have a version of it into the game
Story Mode Cut Scene Artwork
Character Art
Highly interactive 2D Scavenging Gameplay
Sound Design
Expand the crafting system to have more recipes
Steam Exclusive features (Leaderboards, Trading Cards, Etc.)


 
 




PC, Mac and Linux versions of the game will be launched initially on Steam. We will later be adding it into the DRM free stores like GOG and itch.io if the funding goals are met.

The game would be first launched in English, French, German, Russian and Chinese. Others will be determined after release.

The project is made by 3 people, one Programmer, one Artist and one Designer/Artist. All of us with a passion for Technology, Art and History. We are using Unity 3D to develop the game. The programmer has worked on many games which have been published on Steam. We use Photoshop and Illustrator to work on the art for the game and have been working on the project full time for the last 4 months. We just need your help to get us through the final phase of development.
We are looking to hire a sound designer and a character artist to help us with the art for the story mode.
We believe in what we do and truly love it.

The game is in the alpha stage of development. There is a lot of work to be done, the development is progressing full steam ahead. We are working on giving the players the possible experience we can. 

This Indiegogo campaign is planned to help us complete the project. We are looking to hire a sound designer and a character artist to help us finish the sound design and the art for the passengers respectively. Apart from that we will be hiring localising services to help us translate the game to multiple languages.

Budget has been broken down keeping the 5000$ budget in mind. We will be updating it as we keep reaching our goals for the project.

Closed Alpha Version September 2017
Closed Beta Version December 2017
Final Release Early 2018

Which platforms will the game be available on?
The game will be playable on PC, Mac and Linux on Steam at launch.
What will be the system requirements for this game?
The game already works on a whole range of mid-high range configurations. Currently i5 CPU, 4 GB Ram and not too old 1GB GPU is the actual minimum for low settings, but this may change at the time of release.
Where can I buy the game after release?
The game can be bought on Steam initially, but after a while we are planning to get the game up and running for the GOG and itch.io Stores as well.
Will there be multiplayer in the game?
When we started work on the project we wanted the game to tell numerous interesting stories than allowing the players to each other.
Will there be combat in the game?
The game is intended to be a very grounded narrative experience, so combat will not be a part of the game.
When will the game be released?
The game will be released in Early 2018.
Will there be an Early Access or Open Alpha?
No, we do not intend to launch the game as an Early Access. It will be out worldwide at the same time on Steam.
Will there be a Console Version?
Right now we are solely focussing all our efforts on the PC Version of the game. We would definitely love to work on getting the game ported to consoles as well and all you awesome people of the VITA Island, we want to get our game there more than anything :)
Why don't you have any physical rewards for the backers?
We believe developing the game is the most important thing. Since we are a really small team we don't want to spend our time worrying about how to sell you Cups, T shirts and other Swag. We truly believe and love the project, we want to work our tails off to make it as great as it can be.


The biggest challenge we are facing right now is because of the size of the team.
We are a small team of 3, but we will give it our all to get the project to the finish line. We are focused on delivering the best possible experience we can to all you lovely people!

If you've come this far down the description we really thank you! You are the best and we love you. Even if you can't help us by backing it we would really appreciate it if you can get the word out to your friends and family. Thanks Again.
Keep up with the development by following us on Facebook, Twitter, Youtube for the latest dev blogs and the updates section of this campaign page.

story:
The Project

Player 2 will be a bar in Denver, hopefully expanding to many other cities, that has been developed to celebrate nerd culture. We've been avid nerds since early childhood, getting addicted to Donkey Kong Country and endlessly dying in Battletoads. In middle school, we even went so far as to create a pen and paper clone of D&D, without knowing that D&D existed.

We don't understand why there are so few bars that cater specifically to nerds. This makes it hard for us to find social settings in which we feel comfortable and engaged. That's where Player 2 comes in.

Here are a few of our main objectives:

  • Create a community that celebrates the nerd lifestyle
  • Offer a large selection of tabletop games to play
  • Prepare quality food and beverage options for all ages
  • Provide video-gaming stations
  • Host tournaments, league games and events

For our first location, we feel like that there is no better place to start than downtown Denver. With a growing tech industry, and the fastest growing population of 21-35 year olds in the nation, this will be a great place to make our mark.

With our success we will expand to multiple cities around the US, while also spurring the growth of similar businesses.

What We Need

We're asking for $50,000, but every dollar counts. This initial amount gives us the  necessary capital to acquire a small business loan for the rest of the startup costs. We are planning to bear the majority of the financial responsibility ourselves, we just need a bit of a boost to secure that loan.

While our indiegogo funding will be used to acquire the loan, here are few examples of the costs that the money will go towards:

  • Purchasing and Installing Equipment
  • Inventory
  • Renovations
  • Rent and Down-payment
  • Advertising
  • Interior Decoration
  • Staffing
  • Build a New Website

If we meet or exceed our goal we can go straight to the bank and get started right away.

How Are We Different?

The concept of Player 2 was developed from the beginning with nerd culture as the focus. We are not aiming to attract the sports viewers or the night clubbers, we are aiming to create a strong community for those interested in tabletop games, video games, anime, science fiction, theoretical physics, computer coding, etc. Too often these interests are banished to internet chat rooms, we aim to be the bar that welcomes it into the light.

What makes us different than a barcade? I'm glad you asked. Barcades are often focused on the nostalgia of arcade gaming. They also lack a strong sense of socialization as most games are single player, and your friends can only hover over your shoulder awkwardly as you play. Player 2 is focused on facilitating socialization through in person multiplayer gaming. This varies from the tabletop experience, to couch co-op/ multiplayer platforming, to squad based competitive matches. We also plan to strengthen the community we build through tournaments, leagues, events, and theme nights for you to get to know all the other members of our local nerd populace. 

Risk Management

We have already spoken with multiple banks who are excited about the project. After working at length with them, we have found that projected profits are much higher than is standard for the industry thanks to a more diverse revenue stream. This allows us to leverage our money more effectively, as well as to expand more rapidly.

Due to the nature of the industry, there are often unforeseen obstacles with extra costs. To deal with these costs we have a diverse revenue stream and have built a necessary cushion into startup costs.

Why Flex Funding?

We chose flex funding so that no matter what we raise we have something to go to the bank with to leverage a loan. If we don't quite make our $50k goal, we still want to have something to work with rather than be out of luck. We realize this is sometimes associated with scams, but are really just trying to get as much of a leg up as we can.

About Us



Shadoe Konicek was born and raised in Lander, Wyoming. He went to the University of Wyoming on a full academic scholarship and graduated with a degree in Elementary Education in the spring of 2013. However, as his time in academia came to a close he decided that what he really wanted was to open a bar. He has spent the last 5 years studying the industry while he took positions varying from slinging pizza to rolling sushi to bar tending at Mt Bachelor ski resort. All this while, he healthily enjoyed playing video games and had possibly an unhealthy obsession with board games and tabletop games. The concept for his perfect bar came to him in the form of Player 2. His next year and a half has been spent in pursuit of that dream, including completion of Silicon Couloir's Startup Institute in Jackson Hole where he spent his time planing out all the little details of this business model.

Dane Herr was born in Columbus, Ohio and raised in Lander, Wyoming. Interned at WLRC as a MIS in the summer of 2007 & 2008, and worked for 6 years in retail at both Radioshack and Verizon Wireless. He currently runs a tech consulting company. A computer nerd from birth, he enjoys playing all types of video games but really enjoys tabletop games as well.


Tony Huemer was born in Denver, Colorado and raised in Lander, Wyoming. He graduated with honors with a degree in Computer Technology from Central Wyoming College in the fall of 2016. In 2008 he lived abroad in Melbourne, Australia and worked as an Apprentice Mechanic for South Belgrave Motors. For six months in 2014 he lived in Kitakata, Fukushima, Japan. An avid FPS gamer, he started out his online gaming days with the Halo and Call of Duty franchise's, and eventually moved on to MMORPGs like FFXIV and Wild Star. He currently spends most of his time playing Rocket League and GTAV. Despite his performance in the campaign video, Tony is an enthusiastic fan of professional sports in Denver.

I've Donated! Now What?

  • Thanks for the donation! We really appreciate your support!
  • Share this campaign with everyone using the IndieGoGo tools at the top of the page.

Questions?

Feel free to email us with any additional questions at Player2Denver@gmail.com or hit us up on Facebook @ https://www.facebook.com/Player2Denver

Other Ways To Help

You don't have to contribute to help, just share this campaign with anyone and everyone who might be interested. Creating a buzz helps the campaign reach more people to help us achieve our goal. Please help us by sharing our page through Facebook, Reddit, Twitter, or simply through word of mouth.

story:
Ever wonder what it'd be like to be 1 inch tall and take on the challenges of the world? See the world differently through much smaller eyes. Confront and eliminate pesky foes throughout your outdoor journey. SlugShot is one adventure you do not want to miss out on. This action packed 2D game includes three different game modes.

★ Adventure (Explore unknown territory while defending yourself)
★ Survival (Fight off waves of bugs and try to survive)
★ Strawberry Climb (Jump, climb and avoid obstacles)

http://jbern.itch.io/slugshot
Funders who contribute $1 or more will receive the full version of the game once it is complete. With your help the final version will be complete within the first two weeks of September. This free demo is just the beginning of SlugShot and we are working on adding A LOT more features and levels to the game. We also love to hear new ideas from you guys and we will do our best to add it to the game.

★ A lot more levels in Adventure and Strawberry Climb mode
★ Improve Survival mode, add power ups to the game
★ A lot more bugs and bosses added to the game
★ Improve all art and add new animations
★ Multiplayer mode (co-op and vs)
★ New achievement system

Building the remaining features of the game will take time and we will need money to cover our programming costs. We will need to pay licence fees to release it on certain platforms as well as pay for debugging and test tools that will ensure a high build quality to the game. It is important to us that SlugShot is the best that it can be and the people supporting it are most happy with it. Having people contribute towards this game allows us to work on it full time and advertise to tell as many people as possible about it. Every bit helps and we are always listening for new ideas to implement into the game while improving all aspects of it. Become a part of SlugShot today and check out some of our perks you will get.

We at Divine Gaming plan to constantly keep improving and enhancing the SlugShot gaming experience. Contributing towards this project will give us time to constantly keep adding new awesome updates to the game. With your help SlugShot will be the fun and awesome game we have always dreamt of it being. By becoming a part of SlugShot we can ensure you that we will not stop until this game is finished. Can't contribute? be a part of slug shot by spreading the word around.

★ Windows
★ Linux
★ Mac

This project has been fun from the start. This has been a great learning experience for us and we are always pursuing to improve our skills and knowledge. We are hoping that our creativity and love for what we do will bring as much joy as it has to us to others. We are a committed team of two and want to bring you the best we have to offer. As a gamer myself, I get all my inspiration from most of the games I played throughout my childhood. Our only obstacle is time. We can only prepare for the future, because the present moment becomes history all too quickly.

Spread the word about this project. Tell your friends, family and anyone you think might be interested. Every little bit of help is greatly appreciated, thanks again for all your support and for taking the time to check out SlugShot.

story:
Update Videos:




What is this?

I have fond memories of playing snake video games as a kid. I've played at least a hundred variations from dozens of computer and smartphone versions, old phones and graphing calculators back in the 90's, and possibly even a few console versions. The one thing I've always thought newer versions were missing was a properly implemented 3-dimensional element. 

Snake Cubed is my attempt at a 3d version of the classic snake game.  You control the 3d snake in a 3d environment: as it wraps itself around objects you must maneuver around obstacles and find food while avoiding your ever growing tail.  You have complete control over the snake direction as well as the camera movement.


Snake Cubed is currently being developed as a single-player 3D puzzle game for Windows, Mac, Linux, Android, and iOS. It’s a twist on the classic game Snake, played on 3D environments, allowing you to go “over the edge!” as you explore all sides of the map while avoiding your ever growing tail. The gameplay has been updated with traps, enemies, power-ups, jumps, portals, time shifting, achievements, and all around awesomeness.  In its current state it's completely lacking graphics, sound effects, and anything really sexy.  It's a working game prototype, but it definitely needs some love.



Why do I need your money?

Currently the game is in early alpha stage. I have working prototypes with all the mechanics that do what they should. My only challenge at this point is funding.

Successful funding will allow me to add more levels, source out graphics, audio, and sound effects, test test test test and test, and complete the build into a final game I'm proud to release to the gaming community.

Funding beyond the goal will allow for things such as more complex levels, multiplayer online, an in-game level editor, and expansion to more platforms.


What do you get?

Contributions range from $1 up to $5,000 with a variety of rewards being added on each time.  By pledging at least $1, you're guaranteed a lite version of the final game, $10 for a full version, and $75 gets you the sexy shirt you see below.  Check out all the rewards, pick the one that fits you best and let's make this into an awesome game!  When you're done, head over to Steam Greenlight to give us a vote to be on the Steam store, and http://snake.noggins.info to signup for an email notification once the game is complete.

story:
Hi There,

 My name is Ewan and I've been a Member of the Canadian Affiliate now known as Canada @ Midnight since 1997 and we are now hosting the 12th, Annual National Convention known as CAiNE in Vancouver, BC and we've invited all our friends both longtime and brand new to come and game with us, and after the games we like to host great parties. I am both the Charity and Fundraising/Party Lead for the Convention so it is time to try some new tools.

 We have been known to host (in)Famous Parties at Conventions down in the States known as "Canadian Parties" go figure and they have consistently been among the most popular parties at conventions, now we have a challenger to reverse the tables as it were and throw a "US Party" on Canadian soil.

 And since the Canadian Party has always been fairly open to include all of our Members, we felt it was time to allow the challenge and open the door to help fund all the parties.

What We Need & What You Get

 We are going to Split the total funding for the parties we recieve between the three nights of Parties evenly, to help folks have an enjoyable and safe convention experience by keeping our friends and members in a safe environment to not have people aimlessly wandering to find a room party or where their friends of gone as they can check in with the party, that is going on.

 We know not everyone can make it to every event, and while we wish we could, it is helpful to know your friends are thinking of you even if you can only share $5 bucks your name appears in the Thank you for contributing, or you can become one of the founding members of the Canada Vs. US  Party Campaign and get your membership card for $25 and for that Brave trio who decides to step up and Join the Hosts as Co-Hosts for the Parties the $150 will be well spent.

And if we go over then the parties became self sufficient and we can add all the Bonus funds to increase the Charity take, as we have always been a very charity oriented group as well.

The Impact

 This is a Pilot Project, as you have some well known Party Planners for the Cons helping out, and we are testing with this project to see how viable it may be to include for Future events and get stronger budgets to keep them going, as well as maybe help a few other affiliates find thier feet in the party planning phase.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate please share this Campaign with your Domains/Regions/Countries and friends to help broaden it's reach as we are looking forward to bigger events to build on.
story_txt: Hi There, My name is Ewan and I've been a Member of the Canadian Affiliate now known as Canada @ Midnight since 1997 and we are now hosting the 12th, Annual National Convention known as CAiNE in Vancouver, BC and we've invited all our friends both longtime and brand new to come and game with us, and after the games we like to host great parties. I am both the Charity and Fundraising/Party Lead for the Convention so it is time to try some new tools. We have been known to host (in)Famous Parties at Conventions down in the States known as "Canadian Parties" go figure and they have consistently been among the most popular parties at conventions, now we have a challenger to reverse the tables as it were and throw a "US Party" on Canadian soil. And since the Canadian Party has always been fairly open to include all of our Members, we felt it was time to allow the challenge and open the door to help fund all the parties.What We Need & What You Get We are going to Split the total funding for the parties we recieve between the three nights of Parties evenly, to help folks have an enjoyable and safe convention experience by keeping our friends and members in a safe environment to not have people aimlessly wandering to find a room party or where their friends of gone as they can check in with the party, that is going on. We know not everyone can make it to every event, and while we wish we could, it is helpful to know your friends are thinking of you even if you can only share $5 bucks your name appears in the Thank you for contributing, or you can become one of the founding members of the Canada Vs. US  Party Campaign and get your membership card for $25 and for that Brave trio who decides to step up and Join the Hosts as Co-Hosts for the Parties the $150 will be well spent.And if we go over then the parties became self sufficient and we can add all the Bonus funds to increase the Charity take, as we have always been a very charity oriented group as well.The Impact This is a Pilot Project, as you have some well known Party Planners for the Cons helping out, and we are testing with this project to see how viable it may be to include for Future events and get stronger budgets to keep them going, as well as maybe help a few other affiliates find thier feet in the party planning phase.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't donate please share this Campaign with your Domains/Regions/Countries and friends to help broaden it's reach as we are looking forward to bigger events to build on.

story:
Who is Novare Res?

The Novare Res mission team is comprised of three recent college grads who are passionately in love with Christ and His people in Jamaica.  Matt and Amy Zucco recently celebrated their one year anniversary and will be serving as a mission family with their new son Joseph.  Anna Hogan graduated from Franciscan University in May with a degree in History. Each of us has worked in Montego Bay in the past and are eager to return and begin long-term ministry there.  

The mission of Novare Res (to make a revolution) is to aid in the promotion and strengthening of faith communities in Montego Bay.  Due to the extreme poverty in most areas of Jamaica, many mission organizations will send groups there to help provide better housing, food, or medical care.  This is incredible work, but it sometimes fails to recognize that what these people are most hungry for is love.  The people we work with in Jamaica are constantly telling us how much it means to them that we sit, and talk, and pray, and eat, and just share our lives with them.  Our mission is to restore the church of Jamaica by fiercely loving each person we meet.  

Working in union with the bishop, we hope to accomplish our mission by providing

  • basic physical needs
  • an evangelical presence
  • catechesis (as well as the training of catechists)
  • formation and strenghtening of faith communities
  • any task the bishop deems as an honest need for his people

To learn more visit bringhope.org or email us at novare.res.mission@gmail.com

Your Part!

We have spent long sleepless nights devising this easy 3-step process JUST FOR YOU!

  1. PRAY. PRAY. PRAY
  2. DONATE $3
  3. SHARE OUR CAMPAIN

As it was with the early Church, this mission can only succeed if we are being sent.  Jamaica is a third-world country and as such cannot fund any missionaries, although there is so much work to be done!  So we need your help to meet our final fundraising goals.  Our expenses are extremely limited and will cover the costs of:

  • Airfare
  • Housing
  • Food
  • Transportation in Jamaica
  • Insurance

Because we will not be working, anything extra will be used to help with our college loans! 

The intentions of each of our benefactors will be in our prayers throughout the mission so please feel free to email us with your specific intentions!

story:
The Gist

Our dear friend Ivy and her trusty bicycle would like to participate in the Gay Games and this August they'll be hosted in our very own city of Cleveland. However, the fees for entering cycling events aren't cheap! She's an important member of our bike community, so let's all give up a bit of beer money to help her get there.

Breakin' It Down

Here's where funds raised will go:

  • The general registration fee ($195).
  • Event registration fees for two events ($330).
  • A victory beer ($5).
  • Indiegogo fees and credit card charges - 12% if we don't reach the goal, 7% if we do.
  • If we do reach the goal and end up going over budget, extra funds received will go toward helping Ivy with additional training expenses like yoga/cycling classes or a tune-up at JMBS.

Other Ways You Can Help

If donating money doesn't work for you, you can help out by scheduling times to work out with Ivy so she doesn't have to train all by herself. (Or donating extra energy gel shots or that old chamois butter you have in your closet? Ew, actually don't do that.)

story:
Alt Shift: Our Story

 

Alternative Shift is an independent video game studio from Montpellier (France) created by 5 young passionate gamers (you can see some of us in the video above ;). 

Vincent and Guillaume used to work as engineers at UbiSoft Montpellier, Julien and Frederic(=me) are currently finishing a PhD in artificial intelligence and social media and our last partner, François, is our first investor and house physician (so we can be healed if we get hurt working on video games ;). 

Born in May 2010, our studio is currently working on Besyde, a location-based MMO game for smartphones, tablets and web browsers. Our idea was to create, from scratch, not only a brand new universe, but also a whole new game experience, worldwide, truly immersive, using new devices such as smartphones and GPS. Here are some details about the Besyde experience:

 

 For the english speaking contributors, you can skip the next paragraph ;)

 

Un petit mot en Français pour nos contributeurs nationaux !

Pour ceux qui ne nous connaîtraient pas, Alt Shift est un studio indépendant de création de jeu vidéo de Montpellier, créé par 5 jeunes joueurs passionnés en mai 2010 (on nous voit dans la vidéo ci-dessus en Français d'ailleurs!). Dans l'équipe, Vincent et Guillaume travaillaient comme ingénieurs chez UbiSoft et nous ont rejoint dès mai 2010, Julien et Fred (=moi), finissons une thèse en IA pour l'un et en social media marketing pour l'autre. François, le dernier larron, est notre premier investisseur et est interne en médecine (il nous soigne lorsque nous nous blessons en travaillant sur Besyde...).
 
Notre studio mène depuis le 29 février, une campagne de "crowdfunding" (don collectif) pour financer les dernières étapes du développement du jeu Besyde, notre premier jeu massivement multijoueurs géolocalisé. Disponible sur Facebook pour la version web et bientôt sur iTunes pour la version iPhone. Besyde est un jeu « géosocial » cross-plateformes permettant de jouer dans un espace virtuel géolocalisé superposé à la réalité.
 
Grâce à la plateforme de crowdfunding Indiegogo, Alt Shift compte offrir à ses contributeurs, non seulement les traditionnels "goodies" (comme des posters en édition limitée, des polos, de la monnaie du jeu, voir dans la catégorie "Perk" ci-dessous), mais aussi un privilège très spécial : l'opportunité de nommer un arbre virtuel situé sur l'un des lieux les plus populaires de la planète, tels que la Tour Eiffel, La Statue de la Liberté, Le Colisée (voir l'exemple ci-dessous), etc.
 
Chaque contributeur pourra donc choisir parmi la liste de lieux célèbres encore disponibles. Alors, attention, premiers arrivés, premiers servis ! (La liste est disponible ci-dessous dans le paragraphe "Elite Besyder").
 
Au total, nous avons besoin de 67000$ (50000€) pour finaliser techniquement Besyde tel que nous l’imaginions (avec de nombreux contenus, des quêtes géolocalisées partout sur la planète, les fonctionnalités sociales et communautaires, une infrastructure serveur solide et testée, etc.) et sortir une version beta ouverte entre mai et juin 2012.
 
10000$ (7500€) est notre premier objectif sur Indiegogo pour arriver au lancement d’une version stable sur navigateur dès que possible mais nous espérons que vous nous soutiendrez jusqu’au but final pour que nous puissions développer toutes les fonctionnalités et les contenus intéressants que nous avions prévus pour chaque plateforme (navigateur web, smartphones et tablettes) !
 
Les dons possibles vont de 1$ à 500$ (je sais, le site ne propose pas de contribution en euros... snif) mais si la crise vous a vraiment ratissé jusqu’au dernier centime, vous pouvez aussi nous aider en parlant de cette campagne autour de vous ! Les petits ruisseaux font les grandes rivières ! Et pour ceux qui peuvent participer par le don, il suffit de cliquer sur le bouton "contribute" en bas de page en choisissant la somme et le cadeau que vous voudriez. Si vous avez besoin de plus d'info sur le principe, n'hésitez pas à me demander directement sur contact@altshift.fr !
 

Cette campagne de crowdfunding nous aidera donc à finaliser notre projet Besyde (développement, design et tests) et devrait nous permettre de lancer une béta ouverte durant le mois de mai 2012. Pour rester informé de nos avancées, vous pouvez vous abonner à notre page facebook.

 

Besyde: Mask of Harmony

 



Besyde is a location-based MMO game which allows players to participate in the defense of Eora, a parallel world in which little cute creatures (the "anymas") protect a tree of life regularly attacked by plagues. The goal is simple: help anymas to protect their tree of life and the magical ambers that give it strength against the incessant plagues attacks.



 

How?

 

    • By rescuing the trapped anymas on the map
    • By collecting geolocated resources to grow the anymas and the tree of life
    • And by helping the anymas to protect the tree ambers against the plagues.
  
  

The more ambers you bring to your tree of life, the more it strengthens against its enemies and rewards you with special powers and personal distinctions. Collaborative geo quests will also allow players to play together to release more anymas, find rare items, and ultimately grow their community tree faster than others!

Indeed, at the first login, each player must choose a geolocated tree to defend. Some players will choose to protect a tree of life close to their home; others will choose a tree near their work, or the tree in which their friends are already connected. In the end, everyone contributes, through his/her geotagged actions, to the defense of his/her community.

Besyde will be available for both mobile and non mobile players. Indeed, web players will be able to play on any browsers in the area around the tree of life they have chosen at the beginning, and mobile gamers will be able to play wherever they are on the planet thanks to the GPS on their phone. In fact, the more you will play with your mobile in different places, the more you will find rare items and anymas allowing you to better defend your tree!

A first private beta version had been launched between July and September 2011 among 500 testers and we had a lot of excellent and promising comments and suggestions. Based on these community feedbacks, we developed a whole new version of the game with many new features but we need funds to finish it, test it, and release a new beta version.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

We need 67000$ to technically finish Besyde as we want it to be (lots of contents, geoquests all around the world, social and community features, a solid and tested server infrastructure, etc) and release the final open beta between May and June 2012. 

10000$ is our first goal on Indiegogo to release a first reliable web browser version as soon as possible but we hope you will support us to meet our final objective so we can develop all the cool features and contents we planned for each platform: web browsers, smartphones and tablets. 

In return for your donation, we are offering cool merchandise featuring the Besyde characters. These items include your name in the app credits, an exclusive access to the next private beta versions of Besyde, posters, t-shirts and a chance for you to get your name on one of the Besyde’s trees of life located in famous places on the planet. 

Here are some more details about these perks:

Perks 

Chipping in

1$: A private thanks by email ;) Each dollar you donate will make our project a little bit closer to becoming a reality!

Friends

5$: A special thanks over our channels on Twitter and Facebook and a shout of your website, name or business.  

Besyders

10$: your name in the game credits and an access to the next private beta versions!

Bronze besyders

25$: your name in the game credits, an access to the next private beta versions and 1000 free gems for the final commercial version of Besyde (real value : 50$, so it’s 50% off!). For your information, "Gems" are the currency of Besyde and will allow you to buy additional and rare items in Besyde.

Silver besyders

95$: All the previous perks (your name in the game credits and 1000 gems) and one Besyde poster from our limited edition (only 1000 units, numbered and signed by our designer) (size: 420 x 594 mm) (free shipping in Europe, add 15$ to cover international fees out of Europe).


 

Gold besyders

195$: All the previous perks (your name in the game credits, 1000 gems, our limited edition poster) and one of our special Besyders polo shirt (only 100 units) (Any size) (free shipping in Europe, add 15$ to cover international fees out of Europe) (may differ from photo).

 

Elite besyders

500$: All the previous perks and you get to choose YOUR tree of life located at one of these 50 famous and prestigious places on earth named after you in Besyde during one year (ex : Alan Johnson’s Tree of Life). Be quick! First in, first to get the choice ;)



Places still available for your tree of life: 

In Europe and Russia:

  • Tour Eiffel (Paris / France)
  • Arc de triomphe (Paris / France)
  • Le château de Versailles (Versailles / France)
  • Place de la Comédie (Montpellier / France)
  • Stade Velodrome (Marseille / France)
  • Place des Quinconces (Bordeaux / France)
  • Place du capitole (Toulouse / France)
  • Place du Général de Gaulle (Lille / France)
  • Place Bellecour (Lyon / France)
  • Coliseum (Rome / Italy) (see the example above)
  • Piazza San Marco (Venice / Italy)
  • Tore pendente de Pisa (Pisa / Italy)
  • Museo del Prado (Madrid / Spain)
  • Sagrada familia (Barcelona / Spain)
  • Big Ben (London / England)
  • Trafalgar square (London / England)
  • Wembley stadium (Londres / England)
  • Stonehenge (England)
  • The Brandenburg gate (Berlin)
  • European parliament (Brussels / Belgium)
  • The Acropolis (Athens / Greece)
  • Edinburg castle (Edinburg / Scotland)
  • Dublin castle (Dublin / Ireland)
  • The Red Square (Moscow / Russia)
  • The Hermitage (St Petersbourg / Russia)

 

In America:

  • Empire state building (NYC / USA)
  • The Statue of Liberty (NYC / USA)
  • Times square (NYC / USA)
  • Wall Street (NYC / USA)
  • The White House (Washington / USA)
  • Hollywood boulevard (Los Angeles / USA)
  • Alcatraz island (San Francisco / USA)
  • Golden Gate Bridge (San Francisco / USA)
  • Las Vegas strip (Las Vegas / USA)
  • Niagara falls (Ontario / Canada)
  • Center of Amazonia National Park (Brazil)
  • The Plaza de la Constitución (Mexico City / Mexico)
 
In Asia, Oceania and Africa:
  • Shibuya station (Tokyo / Japan)
  • Tokyo tower (Tokyo / Japan)
  • Sydney Opera House (Sydney)
  • Taj Mahal (Agra / India)
  • The Merlion (Singapore)
  • Auckland domain (Auckland / New Zealand)
  • FNB stadium (Johannesburg / South Africa)
  • Bangkok grand palace (Bangkok / Thailand)
  • Grand Bazaar (Istanbul / Turkey)
  • Hong-Kong park (Hong Kong / China)
  • Mount Everest (Nepal)
  • Great pyramid of Giza (Egypt)
  • Mount Kilimanjaro (Tanzania)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

You can also help us by getting the word out about Besyde. Join our page on Facebook on www.facebook.com/besyde.fr (if you are french) or on www.facebook.com/besyde. You can also follow us on Twitter here www.twitter.com/AltShift_Games. 


Thank you!

195$: All the previous perks (your name in the game credits, 1000 gems, our limited edition poster) and one of our special Besyders polo shirt (only 100 units) (Any size) (free shipping in Europe, add 15$ to cover international fees out of Europe) (may differ from photo).





 


Elite besyders



500$: All the previous perks and you get to choose YOUR tree of life located at one of these 50 famous and prestigious places on earth named after you in Besyde during one year (ex : Alan Johnson’s Tree of Life). Be quick! First in, first to get the choice ;)








Places still available for your tree of life:

Other Ways You Can Help
 
You can also help us by getting the word out about Besyde. Join our page on Facebook on www.facebook.com/besyde.fr (if you are french) or on www.facebook.com/besyde. You can also follow us on Twitter here www.twitter.com/AltShift_Games. 

Thank you!

story: The Threat Neutralizing Unit [TNU] has been around over 10 years now and have out lasted 2 consoles, 7 game titles, countless tournaments and clans and is not slowing down.  We have been extremely successful in past tournaments and are looking forward to moving onto a brand new console with a great title to move onto where the competition will be steep.  With so many changes going on we are reaching out to our members to help build a better, more interactive, and all inclusive website to act as our new headquarters.

story:
• Who we are

Hi! We are the Sundae Factory, a great team of friends and fond about video games. Ecotone is our first, but not last, indie video game. Our team is composed by a 2D artist, 2 sound designers and 2 game/level designers.  Each one of us has an experience in the video game and entertainment industry..  We worked on projects like the game "Squids" or on books like “ l'Epouvantable Noël du vieux monsieur tout de rouge vêtu” .  Our aim is to offer to gamers a new experience of gaming with an original concept and gameplay.

  • Ecotone, our indie game project

Ecotone is a single-player platform game with an evolving gameplay which allows brainwork and/or skill phases.

The game’s primary focus is to invite the gamer in a new kind of world, and features a unique, dreamlike and mysterious atmosphere.

In the weird Ecotone’s world, the gamer embodies a strange little character lacking a real identity. But beware, the character goes through a dangerous environment full of strange creatures and monsters, and some of them may be dangerous. Each level is based on a sentence,   which is the key to solving the riddle.

  • Here is an idea of some of the things you can expect in Ecotone when it's released

-          A PC and Mac release, assuming the Indiegogo campaign is succesfull.

-          A strange universe and 3 worlds to explore with a lot of enigmas.

-          Our sound designer offers a sound atmosphere and gives a deeper sense of immersion.

-          An unforgettable story: Throughout the entire game, the story will allow the player to further immerse himself and learn more about his character and its story. While the gamer is free to make up his own idea about the world and the end of the game… But this, it’s a secret.

  • Why we need your help?

As our first project with sundae factory, we need to raise money in order to develop the Ecotone project and our future video game studio. That's why Indiegogo and you come in. We are very excited to try this crowdfunding system. We are working on the game in our free time. Completing and publishing this game is a major commitment and labour of love. We never give up easily being so involved in the process of creating novel games . If we get enough funding we will be able to make Ecotone the way we always wanted it to be. Our goal at $12 000 is minimal needed to enable for some of us to work full time. With this money, we will be able to pay some legal fees (like insurance), software properties (Stencyl Licence, Apple SDK etc…), sound design, graphics and perks cost. We also need to cover some marketing costs.  

Thank you all for your support!

  • What happens if you get over-funded?

     

Moar Stuff!

If we get more than we planned, we will make more worlds, levels, music and monsters to keep the adventure going!

Mobile Version!

If we get more than 20 000$, we will make an ios/android version of the game, we think this game can be great on iPad or iPhone as on Android !

 

 

Thanks you !

 

PS : we are on facebook and twitter !

story:
Hey there, my name is Jude Campbell, and need a leg-up.

I'm an avid writer, a designer, full-time teenager and a gamer. That's an understatement, I'm a HUGE gamer. I've been playing for just over 10 years now. Anyway, I'm straying from the point and going into my personal life, and this is NOT what it's about. Well, kinda. Anyway, being the smart cookie I am, I was writing a chapter of a book I've been working on, as well as the occasional Faster Than Light break (an amazing game by the way) when it struck me. What if I can combine the two things that I love. What if, I could do this, entertain and give advice about what to spend their hard-earned money on to the masses along with giving our indie developers exposure, in order that they can keep making the games we very much dear love. This is the product of that thought. Now, I want this to happen, I very dearly do, but I need your help.

Alright, you've got my attention, so what's gonna be in this mag?

To put it short, quite a bit. Of course, the focus is reviewing games by indie developers, but we want to get more involved than that. We plan to also include exclusive interviews with the developers and host exclusive competitions. This is nowhere near everything included, but it gives you an idea of the essence of this magazine.

So, what do you need?

Straight off the bat, I'm gonna come clean, we need $750. This is to cover many things, and basically start it up. Get ready for a bullet point list.

  • Printing costs! Sure, I could print on A4 paper, but we want this to be a real magazine, with that fancy glossy paper and I'll just say it's not the cheapest around.
  • Paying our writers! I can't write a whole 25 pages on games by myself! I'll be taking some good friends along the Are You Game experience to write for the mag.
  • Buying the games! This money will go towards buying the games that we review.
  • Website costs and development! This magazine is planning to release on a hard copy, but we're also going to set-up a digital version. Basically the same thing but for people without the money! (Don't be discouraged and not donate, we're looking to include little bonuses to the people who buy the hard copies.)
  • To get a better logo! 

This is nowhere near all of the costly things related to developing a magazine, but just some ideas of what you'll be paying for.

What's in it for me, then?

Glad you asked! Did you really think you'd help us start this up and you not get anything?! Most definitely not! To your right hand side, there a things named 'perks.' These are little bonuses that we throw in to thankyou for donating to kickstart this project. Remember, the more you donate, the better the bonuses.

 

So uh, what if this gets funded?

Well, I, myself would be speechless. I would literally have no words to explain how amazing it would be to get this to come true. Oh yeah, except for one.

 

Thankyou.

story:
It's awesome when you can make some product for people. Something that others can test, explore and enjoy. Computer game is a sort of such product and we are well experienced to create one.

      We are independent developers, so nobody tells us what and how we should create, except our fans. It allows us to test and implement new ideas, rely on opinion and advice of our future players.

So, we have started this project on Indiegogo with a few goals:

  • To make a game funded by it's future players/fans
  • To get feedback from community
  • To stay independent

 

      "Bad Weekend" is the computer game with old-school atmosphere of old horror movies/games.

      The hero, an ordinary man, fights against mysterious creatures of darkness, alone in the woods. Sounds familiar? Yeah, our project is inspired by Evil Dead movie, Heart Of Darkness game and other similar things!

      The game will feature a mix of tactics, action and tower defence with black humor, crazy sound and gameplay-dependant music!

      Summary:

Genre: 3D Action, Survival

Platform: PC, Windows

Multiplayer: None, single-player only

Camera: Third-person

Language: English, Russian

 

      Game Features:

  • Player and enemies are able to interact with environment
  • Light and Dark: find a way to use the power of darkness against itself
  • Skills and achievements
  • Vivid enemies with funny behaviour
  • Five different game modes
  • Use tactics: brute force is not enough

 

 

 

      We are working on the game in our free time. We need your support to make a good game.

      With your help, we will make high quality graphics and models. We will also buy some content (music, sound) and software, pay for site and game content servers. If you think that our goal - 6 666 - is too low for a high quality, don't worry: most of our project is based on our priceless, so we will not ask money for our own skills.

      Our primary platform is PC (Microsoft Windows), but we want to make a version for Mac OS too. In case of over-funding, we will consider it as a primary goal after game release.

      There are some ways you can help us:

  • Fund the project
  • Use our game site and forum to express your ideas, propose game features, vote for features proposed by other people if you like it
  • Tell other people about our project, maybe they can help us too! Indiegogo share tools are great for this.

 

      Your help will be rewarded! There are some perks for you!

      This includes your name on credits screen, access to private part of developer's forum, game soundtrack, special game modes, your photo in game, special gift editions of the game (with your text for your friend and ingame cake)! Just get perks you like. You can even design your own game mode and we will implement it!

      At the global scale, your contribution is a step towards alternative game funding, where players affect and support developers at the stage of development. We think it's a correct way and it should become more popular.

      In case of successful funding, we will implement the best game feature proposed by contributors. Those who supported this idea will be mentioned in a special list on game credits screen. Plus, we will make a cool musical video with game characters who thank all the contributors! The video will end up with a list of contributors and will be published on the title page of game site.

story:
All the best miniatures are CAST IN RUIN!

Like this one by Bob Olley:

And this one by John Pickford:

Those are just two of the Interloper Miniatures available through this project.

This is a campaign to fund a dozen 28mm scale metal miniatures for use in post-apocalyptic role-playing and tabletop skirmish games.

After 30 years hoping somebody else would make them we got tired of waiting. So here we are getting it done.

The concept art is by Toren Atkinson.

The sculptors involved are Nicholas Genovese, Paul Muller, Bob Olley and John Pickford. Some of the greens are works-in-progress and they're starting to come in. We'll post pictures of them as they arrive.

All these miniatures are 28mm scale. A couple of the bugs are smaller (approx. 25mm) and the rabbits are big beasts (approx. 40mm).

The perk amounts take into account the relative sizes of the miniatures. They're also a result of only having one perk at any given dollar value.

 

 

Goals & Stretch Goals

  • If we reach $5,000 we'll make a fourth fiendish fowl. He'll be a trooper type to bulk out the flock. Every Mutant Master will get one. And we'll make an army-builder three-pack available as a separate $20 perk.

  • If we reach $7,500 we'll make a trio of pigstronauts, porcine explorers from space rooting around a blasted Earth. They'll be available as a $19 add-on perk.
  • If we reach $8,500 we'll make an armed-to-the-tongue "@#$% you, I'm an anteater!" miniature exclusive to this indiegogo campaign. Every Mutant Master will get one and it won't be available anywhere else.
  • If we reach $10,000 we'll make a trio of wasteland wanderers: a savage with a laser-blade, a psychic princess and an ape-man with a bow. Every Mutant Master will get the three-pack and we'll make them available as a $22 perk too.

We've got more ideas but we'll reveal them later, as necessary.

 

Every perk includes worldwide shipping.

Shipping will commence in March 2013.
