GriMagia's art and gameplay are complete, and it's already been rigorously playtested in several locations, including Anime Expo, card shops in Japan, and multiple colleges. In other words, it's totally ready to go into print, so there's honestly very little risk in investing in GriMagia!

The biggest challenge in getting this project off the ground is securing the funding to print it; if we don't reach the full $13k goal, we won't be able to print the game on a large enough scale to be able to sell it at a reasonable price, so there's no point in taking anyone's money.

Beyond that, we've already found people willing to print GriMagia and stock our game in card stores, should we secure the necessary funds. There may be unseen challenges waiting for us in the future, as there is with any project, but we've successfully dealt with such challenges before and we're prepared to handle anything that may come up as professionally as possible. Besides, it's all part of what makes the journey interesting!

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help us by spreading the word about GriMagia's Indiegogo campaign! The more noise we can make, the more people can help fund GriMagia, and the closer we'll be to reaching our goal! If we raise enough money, we'll even be able to create more cards and expansions for the game! Each and every person's help counts!

As a special thanks to those who go all-out promoting us, we'll be awarding a copy of the Indiegogo-exclusive version of GriMagia to whoever brings in the most contributors using Indiegogo's sharing tools! This particular version of the game, which will be signed by the directors of GriMagia, won't be offered anywhere else but through this campaign! It features rare alternate-colored versions of all of the monsters along with alternate flavor text. Be sure to create an Indiegogo account first so we can tell it's you who's referring people!

Although these people aren't part of our core team, we'd like to thank them for their essential help in getting GriMagia this far!


Matthew Ungamrung - R&D Advisor

Sebastien Skaf - Composer (Trailer Theme)

Naba - Tutorial Narrator

Garrett Lane - Tutorial Video Editor

...and YOU!

Let's have a huge round of applause for everyone who has ever helped us! There are too many people to list in the space we have on this page, but we appreciate each and every one of you! We're truly grateful for your support, so thank you!

Regarding Release DateIf you have any concerns about the project, direct them to Jeremiah Alinea (GriMagia's

printing/shipping/IGG rewards/finances/refunds/any future updates and 
can be reached at: grimagia@gmail.com____________________________________________________________________________WE DID IT!! We've reached our $13k goal and GriMagia is now funded! Thank you so much, everyone, for helping us reach our goal - we're overwhelmed by your support!!STRETCH GOAL #1 - $16,000: GOAL REACHED!! - EGYPT-THEMED EXPANSION (50 more cards!)An expansion with monsters based off of Egyptian gods and desert residents! Booby traps galore!Monsters include: Anubis, Scarab, Mummy, Sphinx, HorusSTRETCH GOAL #2 - $19,000: GOAL REACHED!! BACKER-CHOSEN EXPANSION (50 more cards!)Backers will be able to vote on their favorite themed expansion out of 10 different choices!Choices include: Tropical Paradise, Japan, Greek, Legendary Weapons, Monster Fans Collection (working titles)STRETCH GOAL #3 - $25,000: GOAL REACHED!! CORE EXPANSION: DRAGONIC AWAKENING! (100+ more cards!!)A HUGE expansion with a wide variety of monsters and character cards with player abilities!
STRETCH GOAL #4: $30,000: NEW ARTISTS!We'll hire more artists onto our team! We already have some artists in mind, and being able to have them on the team would speed up our production rate.


GriMagia (gri-MUH-gi-uh) is a 2-6 player anime-themed card game about fighting and 
capturing monster girls! Take up the role of a GriMeister, specializing 
in summoning and confining monsters with the aid of magical books known 
as Grimoires!
GriMagia, while NOT a TCG, borrows some familiar elements that are found in many TCGs and RPGs, throws in some unique mechanics, and mixes them together in a simple and fun game that anyone can pick up! It's possible to learn the basics in as quick as 10-15 minutes (as proven during our live demos at Anime Expo 2014), and there are many layers of depth and strategy to the game that make it entertaining for experienced players as well!


Above Image: GriMagia at Anime Expo 2014!

** Note for International Contributors: If you live outside the US, please add +$10 USD to your contribution in order to cover international shipping costs and ensure you get your perks in good condition. **





In GriMagia, each player assumes the role of a GriMeister, specializing in summoning and confining monsters with the aid of magical books known as Grimoires. Learn how to play by watching the above video or reading the description below!
The objective of GriMagia is to either capture 3 of your opponents' 
monsters OR reduce every opponent's HP to 0 (each player has 5 HP). 
These caps are flexible depending on how long you'd like the game to 
last.
At the start of each game, the 100 card deck is shuffled and players must decide the turn order. In a standard game of GriMagia, each player starts with 5 cards in hand.
 All players share the same deck and draw 2 cards each turn (except the 
first turn; draw 1 card). There's a hand limit of 6 cards, so if you 
have more than that at the end of your turn, you discard cards until you
 have 6 again.

SUMMONING BASICS: You can summon monsters from your
 hand to the field to aid you in battle! Each monster has individual strengths and weaknesses depending on which of the three basic types it is (ATK, DEF, HP). Attack unarmed opponents 
directly, weaken monsters for capture, or defeat every monster in sight -
 it's up to you!SUMMONING GAUGE: Each GriMeister has a Summoning Gauge of 8
 hearts, meaning that they may only control a maximum amount of monsters
 that have a printed total of 8 hearts on the field. Exceeding that 
limit will cause Fatigue to the GriMeister, slowly draining away their 
life force.

BATTLE BASICS: In battle, compare the ATK stat of your monster to the 
DEF stat of the opponent's monster; if your monster's ATK is higher than
 the opposing monster's DEF, the attack goes through. The hearts in the upper right corner of each Monster Card represent its HP (1 heart = 1 HP). Each attack does -1 HP
worth of damage, and if a monster takes damage equal to its HP, it's 
destroyed and sent to the discard pile.INTERCEPTING: Monsters are able to intercept incoming attacks to take damage instead of the intended target. If the monster that intercepts has higher DEF than the attacking monster's ATK, however, then it won't take any damage.ACTIVE/RESTED POSITIONS: When a monster attacks, 
defends, or intercepts an attack, it gets shifted from Active position 
(face-up, forwards) to Rested position (sideways). Monsters in Rested position are unable to attack/defend/intercept until they're shifted 
back to Active position at the start of your next turn.MOBBING: A monster in Rested position cannot defend, and is thus vulnerable to any attack, regardless of its DEF. Therefore, you can mob a high DEF monster with multiple attacks from different monsters. Because that monster cannot defend itself from all those incoming attacks, it will take damage.

CAPTURING BASICS: Your role as a GriMeister is to capture your opponents’ monsters with the mystic power of Grimoires - magical books with immense powers of confinement. Each basic Grimoire corresponds to one of the three basic types (ATK, DEF, HP). In order for a Grimoire to be able to capture a monster, its type must match the monster's type, and its MP must be greater than or equal to the remaining HP of the monster.CATCH BLOCKING: If you don't want your opponent to capture your monsters, you can block a capture with a Catch Block! Discard a card from your hand (monster or Grimoire) of the basic type that beats the basic type of Grimoire your opponent played, rock-paper-scissors style. 

ATK beats HP, HP beats DEF, and DEF beats ATK.BLOCK REVERSALS/FINAL BLOCK: If you've performed a Catch Block, your opponent can retaliate with a Block Reversal by discarding a card of the basic type that beats yours to make the capture successful. However, you can respond with a Final Block; again, discard a card of the type that beats your opponent's card type. After a Final Block, no more cards can be discarded to influence the outcome of the capture, and it is deemed unsuccessful.

RELIC BASICS: GriMeisters are able to wield Relics, ancient items that can be used at any time during the game,
 even during an opponent's turn or in response to an action! If utilized
 properly, they can turn the tides of a game in your favor! Use them 
wisely, as there can be only one of each unique Relic in the deck!RESOLUTIONS: If two or more Relics activate in response to one another, the effect of the last Relic that was played resolves first, and so on. In other words, effects resolve backwards.

ABILITY MONSTERS: Some monsters have abilities that they can use in order to gain the upper hand over an opponent! Ability Monsters generally have weaker stats than regular monsters, but they make up for it with their useful powers. Different Ability Monsters function in different ways: some monsters' abilities activate on summon, some can be activated on command by shifting the ability monster to Rested position, some activate automatically under certain conditions, and some have effects that last indefinitely.SP MONSTERS:  There exist Special (SP) Monsters with abilities so powerful that they can alter the course of the game, for better or worse. These mystical beings are so rare that there can only be up to 4 SP Monsters in a standard deck, and there can be only one of each unique SP monster in the deck!FUTURE EXPANSIONS: In each expansion, we will be able to add more mechanics to the game to make it even more interesting! All future mechanics will be optional, but will provide new options for players, as we'd like to keep the game fresh and exciting while keeping it as flexible as possible. In other words, players will be able to pick-and-choose which mechanics they like best and play with them while not feeling like they're missing out on something.

All of the 100 cards you'll ever need to play a standard game of GriMagia are included in a single box. This includes:
• 40 Monster Cards (4 SP Monsters)


Monsters are powerful creatures that roam the world of GriMagia, but can be tamed or sealed away with the power of magic.


• 40 Grimoires


Grimoires are magical books used by GriMeisters to capture monsters.

• 20 Relics


Relics are mysterious one-of-a-kind items that, when used at the right time, can aid their wielder in combat.



It's NOT a
 
TCG! Instead, GriMagia is packaged like a board game - all you'll ever need to 
play the game is in the box! Our primary focus with GriMagia was to make a fun game with great art, not to make tons of money selling booster packs.

The core gameplay is simple enough that it only takes a single game to get the hang of, but at the same time it achieves complexity in that there are many different options for players depending on which cards you decide to play and when, thus leaving a wide range of strategies open. Each cards' effects/abilities have different uses depending on when/how you use them, and each person will use them differently; it's up to you to determine your playstyle!

You can unite two monsters you control into one stronger monster; the types of monsters you unite will determine which of the monster's stat(s) gets boosted, and by how much. This has strengths and drawbacks; on one hand, the Unioned monster is more powerful and better suited to battle, and it may gain useful abilities. On the other hand, it means you have less monsters on the field, and it's a greater loss if that monster is captured by an opponent.

Since it's not a TCG, the standard mode of GriMagia is played with a shared deck of 100 cards instead of having each player build their own deck (though in non-standard modes, players will be able to build their own unique decks using expansions, if they choose).
 Each player draws from the same deck and discards to the same pile. 
This means that anything you can do to your opponent, they can also do 
to you, so watch out!


It's versatile and encourages creativity in players. There are multiple ways to play GriMagia; for example, in addition to standard mode, we've created a split deck mode and an RPG mode as well as a deckbuilding mode for more advanced players. Since all of the game's mechanics were designed to be flexible, the creation of new game modes is highly encouraged as well - the only limit is your imagination!

Board/card games with anime themed art like GriMagia's are extremely hard to come by in countries besides Japan, due to the effort required to translate, import, and localize those games, especially when it comes to physical board/card games.


  




Since GriMagia was created by a small company, we can't afford to print the game on a mass scale at high quality. And if we don't print GriMagia on a mass scale, we won't be able to get a bulk discount on printing in order to sell the game at a reasonable price. Therefore, we turned to crowdfunding for help, in order to ensure we can produce a high quality product at an affordable price!
Since we're doing a Fixed Funding (all or nothing) campaign, if we don't meet our goal, everyone will be refunded and we won't be able to print the game. That would be a huge shame considering the game's art and gameplay are complete, and it's already been rigorously playtested in several locations, including Anime Expo, card shops in Japan, and multiple colleges. So hopefully, with your support, we can reach our goal!
If we surpass our goal, the additional funds will go towards future additions to GriMagia, including the creation of expansions, additional promo cards, or even a possible digital version of the game for PC/mobile. These additions will all be displayed in Stretch Goals if our initial $13k goal is reached. The more we raise, the more we'll be able to create!

A GriMagia-themed t-shirt AND mat!



** Note for International Contributors: If you live outside the US, please add +$10 USD to your contribution in order to cover international shipping costs and ensure you get your perks in good condition. **

Sage Level



This tier includes...

Everything from the Succubus Tier!
An uncut promo sheet of all the Indiegogo-exclusive promos!



** Note for International Contributors: If you live outside the US, please add +$10 USD to your contribution in order to cover international shipping costs and ensure you get your perks in good condition. **


This tier includes...

Everything from the Succubus Tier!
An uncut promo sheet of all the Indiegogo-exclusive promos, signed by the directors of GriMagia!
An Indiegogo-exclusive Making of GriMagia artbook, featuring full art of all the monsters, unseen development sketches, bonus art, and a foreword from Studio Melonseeds!



** Note for International Contributors: If you live outside the US, please add +$10 USD to your contribution in order to cover international shipping costs and ensure you get your perks in good condition. **



This tier includes...


Everything from the Succubus Tier!
An uncut promo sheet of all the Indiegogo-exclusive promos, signed by the directors of GriMagia!
An Indiegogo-exclusive Making of GriMagia artbook, featuring full art of all the monsters, unseen development sketches, bonus art, and a foreword from Studio Melonseeds!

Indiegogo-exclusive edition of GriMagia with alternate-colored monsters and alternate flavor text for all the cards!




** Note for International Contributors: If you live outside the US, please add +$10 USD to your contribution in order to cover international shipping costs and ensure you get your perks in good condition. **



This tier includes...


Everything from the Succubus Tier!
An uncut promo sheet of all the Indiegogo-exclusive promos, signed by the directors of GriMagia!
An Indiegogo-exclusive Making of GriMagia artbook, featuring full art of all the monsters, unseen development sketches, bonus art, and a foreword from Studio Melonseeds!

Indiegogo-exclusive edition of GriMagia with alternate-colored monsters and alternate flavor text for all the cards!

CUSTOM RARE SPECIES! Design an alternate color palette for one of the monsters, which will be featured in the Indiegogo-exclusive edition of GriMagia with credit to you as one of the contributors!* (Certain 
rules/restrictions apply.***)


* Each monster may only have one alternate version. Monsters will be picked on a first come, first served basis.


** Note for International Contributors: If you live outside the US, please add +$10 USD to your contribution in order to cover international shipping costs and ensure you get your perks in good condition. **
*** Rules: No copyrighted characters or trademarks; no sexually explicit content/excessive gore, or otherwise offensive material.  However, palettes inspired by existing characters are fine!



This tier includes...


Everything from the Succubus Tier!
An uncut promo sheet of all the Indiegogo-exclusive promos, signed by the directors of GriMagia!
An Indiegogo-exclusive Making of GriMagia artbook, featuring full art of all the monsters, unseen development sketches, bonus art, and a foreword from Studio Melonseeds!

Indiegogo-exclusive edition of GriMagia with alternate-colored monsters and alternate flavor text for all the cards!

CUSTOM MONSTER CARD! Work alongside your artist(s) of choice to have the monster of your choice illustrated into a one-of-a-kind exclusive promo card! (Certain rules/restrictions apply.*)

* Rules: No copyrighted characters or trademarks; no sexually explicit content/excessive gore, or otherwise offensive material. 
** Note for International Contributors: If you live outside the US, please add +$10 USD to your contribution in order to cover international shipping costs and ensure you get your perks in good condition. **

Deity Level



This tier includes...
 

Everything from the Undine Tier!

DESIGN AN EXPANSION! Work alongside our development team - pick your theme choice and/or suggest the monsters you want to go in it! We'll refine your ideas into a fully illustrated and playable expansion with credit to you as a co-director! (Certain rules/restrictions apply.*)



  
* Rules: No copyrighted characters or trademarks; no sexually explicit content/excessive gore, or otherwise offensive material. 
** Note for International Contributors: If you live outside the US, please add +$10 USD to your contribution in order to cover international shipping costs and ensure you get your perks in good condition. **


GriMagia's art and gameplay are 
complete, and it's already been rigorously playtested in several 
locations, including Anime Expo, card shops in Japan, and multiple 
colleges. In other words, it's totally ready to go into print, so there's honestly very little risk in investing in GriMagia!The biggest challenge in getting this project off the ground is securing the funding to print it; if we don't reach the full $13k goal, we won't be able to print the game on a large enough scale to be able to sell it at a reasonable price, so there's no point in taking anyone's money.Beyond that, we've already found people willing to print GriMagia and stock our game in card stores, should we secure the necessary funds. There may be unseen challenges waiting for us in the future, as there is with any project, but we've successfully dealt with such challenges before and we're prepared to handle anything that may come up as professionally as possible. Besides, it's all part of what makes the journey interesting!
  

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help us by spreading the word about GriMagia's Indiegogo campaign! The more noise we can make, the more people can help fund GriMagia, and the closer we'll be to reaching our goal! If we raise enough money, we'll even be able to create more cards and expansions for the game! Each and every person's help counts!As a special thanks to those who go all-out promoting us, we'll be awarding a copy of the Indiegogo-exclusive version of GriMagia to whoever brings in the most contributors using Indiegogo's sharing tools! This particular version of the game, which will be signed by the directors of GriMagia, won't be offered anywhere else but through this campaign! It features rare alternate-colored versions of all of the monsters along with alternate flavor text. Be sure to create an Indiegogo account first so we can tell it's you who's referring people!






Although these people aren't part of our core team, we'd like to thank them for their essential help in getting GriMagia this far!

Matthew Ungamrung - R&D Advisor
Sebastien Skaf - Composer (Trailer Theme)
Naba - Tutorial Narrator
Garrett Lane - Tutorial Video Editor
...and YOU!
Let's have a huge round of applause for everyone who has ever helped us! There are too many people to list in the space we have on this page, but we appreciate each and every one of you! We're truly grateful for your support, so thank you!

story:
Gather your friends in this browser-based, free-to-play MMO and hunt down the unique fragments of the infamous book of deadly magical secrets, the NECRONOMICON!

Each piece of the Necronomicon unleashes amazing powers. It also has a chance to kill the operator, true, but what a small price to pay! Use these powers, if you dare, to turn the tide for your faction. Or struggle to gather enough fragments to perform a ritual to enhance your faction’s abilities. With the right fragments, the Deep Ones could summon mighty Cthulhu himself! Or gather and hide the fragments for later use.

Explore expansive environments. Struggle against dozens of monsters released by the power of the Necronomicon. Perform quests for Lovecraftian characters like Henry Armitage, Herbert West and Brown Jenkin. Explore famous Lovecraft locations such as Miskatonic University. Collect magic items and spells to use against your enemies. Upgrade your character in levels to gain access to new weapons and abilities.

Arkham is awash in secrets. Can you find all of them?

Miskatonic Mayhem!

Man thinks he is the master of his world, but forces exist far beyond his understanding. Those forces constantly threaten to tear through the fragile wall that separates our reality from madness. 

Our story begins in Arkham, Massachusetts, 1929. Arkham is a town with a long history of paranormal disturbances. It’s also home to Miskatonic University, a storage house for ancient and forbidden objects of power. 

With the arrival of the Necronomicon, the greatest spellbook ever created, the fragile fabric of reality was torn and hell was unleashed upon the town. The precious stores of the university were looted, and the Necronomicon, the key to the beyond, was ripped to pieces in the chaos.

Now, in a race against time, three factions fight to reclaim these ancient books and artifacts and control the oncoming tide of madness.

The Human faction is made up of scholars, detectives and thugs, either survivors of the Necronomicon “incident” or simply drawn towards the alluring mystery of the town and then trapped there. The only alternative to working together is to band together with inhuman hordes, so there is a fair amount of tension among the coalition, particularly the gangsters and the investigators. 

The Deep One faction is made largely of survivors from Y’ha-nthlei, the great Deep One city on Devil’s Reef that was recently attacked and destroyed by the U.S. Navy. Some were attracted to Arkham when they heard stories of the resurfacing of their mystical deity Dagon, while others were attracted by the opportunity to gain the Necronomicon’s power. Deep One society consists of two castes: “full-blooded” Deep Ones who can be centuries old and “halflings,” those born with a human parent and slowly transitioning to a full aquatic state.

The Ghouls are flesh-hungry, animalistic creatures with varying control over their primal instincts. They range from mindless, brutal zombies to cunning scientists and magic users who seek to turn their condition to their advantage. The ghouls are divided. Some seek power to reclaim more of their humanity. Others want the power of the Necronomicon to create a larger feast of flesh.

What You Get

Check out VIP Perks for the rewards for supporting H.P. LOVECRAFT’S ARKHAM in this fundraiser: Beta access, in-game credits, premium weapons and more!

And if you’re a longtime friend of Arc Dream Publishing there’s an extra bonus for supporting H.P. LOVECRAFT’S ARKHAM. We have a stake in the game. You get the fun of dynamiting Deep Ones, grenading Ghouls, hamburgerizing Humans and shotgunning shoggoths (um, good luck with that last one), AND the warm, fuzzy glow of knowing that it all supports our roleplaying games and fiction.

H.P. LOVECRAFT’S ARKHAM will be in Beta from December 2010 to February 2011. It goes live to the whole world in Spring 2011.

Sign up now and reserve your place in the carnage. The Necronomicon is waiting.

Video by Rachel K. Ivey. Video music by Kevin MacLeod.

story:
Grassroots Gaming Expo

About Us

                                                                    

     Hello, my name is Elizabeth Bolinger and I'm the co-founder of Grassroots Gaming Expo.  I've been a gamer my entire life, either watching my parents play video games or playing them myself.  Video games have always been a big part of my life. 

In 2010, I started setting world records, and now have over 100 verified records, as well as being featured in the Guinness Book Of World Records: Gamer's Edition 2012 for "The Most Prolific Dancing Game High Scorer."  Over the last three years, I've also dedicated a lot of time volunteering for various charities, such as Child's Play, Able Gamers, The International Video Game Hall Of Fame and the American Cancer Society.  I try to combine gaming with charity work.
 


     My husband and I conceived of the idea of Grassroots Gaming Expo after a local event by the International Video Game Hall Of Fame fizzled out only two months prior to the event date in 2011.  We wanted to give the people that were already planning on coming to Ottumwa an event to go to, so with only two months to pull it off, we managed to gather enough local support to make it happen.

     This year, we want to not only continue to do the event, but we want to make it better.  We want to make our event the most interactive and enjoyable gaming event possible.

 

What We Need And What You Get

     All money raised will go to fund the infrastructure of the event.  The venue rental fees, needed equipment and staffing/lodging expenses.  The amount we set our goal at is less than the actual operating costs of the event, but that is the bare minimum of what we need.  Anything raised in excess of our goal will go towards event costs.  Anything in excess of the operating costs will go towards next years event.  If we do not reach our goal, the event will still go on, and all available funds will still be applied to operating costs.  We are confident that we will meet our goal.

 
     We have October 12-14, 2012 reserved at the Bridge View Center.
 
     We think that the perks we are offering are pretty enticing.  From simply being named as a sponsor, to exclusive merchandise, all the way up to special VIP treatment at the event, there is a little something for everyone.

$5 Donation Button:

 
     Your contributions will have a great impact on our event by not only helping to make it possible, but to help pave the way for more events to be held in the Midwest.  There is a great deal of interest in gaming outside of the east and west coasts, but not a lot of events happening.  We believe that every event benefits all events, and your support can help that idea grow.
 

How you can help

 
     Aside from donating money, there are plenty of ways you can help.  The easiest is to help spread the word through friends and social media. IndieGoGo has some great sharing tools available.
 
     We will gladly accept donations of gaming and networking equipment.  We are not a non-profit, so your donation would not be tax deductible, but it would still be greatly appreciated.
 
     If you are in the area, you can also volunteer your time to help at the event. 
 
     You can get in contact with us via e-mail at: contact@grassrootsgamingexpo.com
 
 

Thank you!

 

Elizabeth Bolinger

Grassroots Gaming Expo

story:
Summary

We're Lloyd, Jimmy, and Amber. We've been gamers for a long time, and running a store is a goal we share in common. FLGS stands for Friendly Local Game Store. A FLGS is a place for gamers and other geek-friendly people to hang out and play some games. We discovered that the name FLGS is available, and we're naming our store after this common acronym.

Game stores are great places for kids to hang out, learn developmental skills like resource management and problem-solving (but don't tell them that!) and meet new friends. We're talking about rubbing elbows, laughing with friends, and sharing stories about movies, comics, and The Big Bang Theory. Helping us get open keeps kids from working in meth labs through a false dichotomy!

Sure, FLGS isn't a city necessity like a fire station or a hospital, but it makes people happy.

Our Business Principle

Two-thirds of all ex-gamers say they quit because they "can't find somebody to play with". We plan to make "finding somebody to play with" our raison d'être. The game room, the social networking, bulletin boards--the entire business model revolves around people enjoying the company of other people.

What We Need & What You Get

We need inventory! We need current inventory to get people playing games again. Although we could spend $15,000 for this new inventory, we're willing to take it one step at a time. $2,000 will get us the most essential items.

We need to advertise to let people know about the stuff we have. We need about $1,900 to do a direct mail to the area around the store. We also plan to get an A-frame sign for the sidewalk so that all that traffic from NAS Jax sees us as they drive by. Those cost about $100.

Merchandise and advertising are our two most critical needs. No part of your contribution will go toward a salary toward the new owners. We believe in this project enough to not take anything out for at least a year. We really want this store to be the best it can be.

If we don't reach our goal, everything we get goes is split between goodies for the shelves and a smaller mailout.

The Rewards

Choose a contribution level. For your donation, you get specific game items or categories, usually at a significant discount. For the largest donations, you get blanket store credit that you can redeem however you want, all at a bonus. If we exceed our goal, we plan to introduce additional benefits for existing contributors.

Oh, and there's no rule that says you and your gaming group can't go in on one of the contributions as a group--as long as one person stands up and makes the contribution, you can split it however you want.


In all cases, international contributors are responsible for shipping costs. Contact us for details.

$10 - Kobold Minion: You get 3 booster packs of Return to Ravnica. That's $2 off retail, it includes shipping.

$30 - Bugbear Brigand: You take home any RPG title worth $35 or less. Pick up the latest release or fill in a hole in your collection. Take a chance on a new game.

$31 - Ogre Champion: This one's similar but for minis. Get any minis blister or box worth $31 or less.

$50 - Hill Giant Chieftain: Settlers of Catan plus the 5-6 player extension. The retail price is $62. You save $12, and domestic shipping is included.

$100 - Fire Giant King: Get any Space Marine army box or corresponding box for another GW army.

$125 - Immortal Titan: A Booster box of Return to Ravnica, shipping included. That's $20 off retail.

$300 - Silver Dragon: You get a $360 gift certificate and credit on a plaque in the store.

$500 - Gold Dragon: You get a $625 gift certificate and everlasting fame identifying you as a Gold Dragon Contributor on our wall.

$1000 - Platinum Dragon: $1300 gift certificate and a plaque dedicated solely to you.

NEW $2,500 - Publisher Extravaganza: For game manufacturers only. We'll buy $2,000 worth of your products through distribution and restock them for at least a year before we even check sales records.

 

Manufacturer Rewards

Choose one of the gift certificate rewards and a contribution level. You'll get a chance after the campaign to work out the details. We'll buy your products through distribution if available or directly if not.

The larger the contribution, the more effort we'll put into sales. For $100, we'll put it on the shelf and mention its arrival through our normal communication. At the $500 level, we'll run demo games and report sales levels to you afterward.


Why support us? Two main reasons. One is that we can't keep track of everybody out there, and this gives you an automatic "in". More importantly, of course, is the potential for downstream sales, and it's why we love inventory. We'll restock anything that sells (okay, IF it sells within the first year. We have to be reasonable), and we'll keep restocking it. Your $50 donation could mean $500 in sales--and more as your SKU list grows.

The Impact

  • FLGS will be picking up the legacy of War Dogs Game Center, the last full-service game store in Jacksonville with all the main product lines and a game room. It brought the magic of games to millions of kids in Jacksonville. Okay, maybe not millions, but certainly thousands. 
  • We'll be moving into Sun Coast Comics' old space. While some people are expected to become customers of the new online venture the current owners are starting, we'll be glad to take care of the customers who choose to stay.
  • Starting next year, we'll participate in Free RPG Day, offering a chance to get free games. It's a good opportunity to bring a friend in and get him hooked. 
  • Since 2004, Lloyd has been writing business plans for other would-be store owners. He literally wrote the book on how to start and run a retail game store. You can be confident that this isn't a fly-by-night effort. No wasted contributions here!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can still help!

  • Share us on Facebook or Twitter or however you socialize with your friends.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools below to make it easier to tell people.
  • If you've already donated, pester your friends into contributing so that you can increase the value of your perk through our bonus perks.
  • If you want to get a tattoo of a QR code linking to this campaign, we'll provide your inker with the graphic. Go for it!

Thanks for reading, and we hope you'll help us with our goal. Also, world peace.

The Impact

FLGS will be picking up the legacy of War Dogs Game Center, the last full-service game store in Jacksonville with all the main product lines and a game room. It brought the magic of games to millions of kids in Jacksonville. Okay, maybe not millions, but certainly thousands. 
We'll be moving into Sun Coast Comics' old space. While some people are expected to become customers of the new online venture the current owners are starting, we'll be glad to take care of the customers who choose to stay.
Starting next year, we'll participate in Free RPG Day, offering a chance to get free games. It's a good opportunity to bring a friend in and get him hooked. 
Since 2004, Lloyd has been writing business plans for other would-be store owners. He literally wrote the book on how to start and run a retail game store. You can be confident that this isn't a fly-by-night effort. No wasted contributions here!



Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, you can still help!

Share us on Facebook or Twitter or however you socialize with your friends.
You can use the Indiegogo share tools below to make it easier to tell people.
If you've already donated, pester your friends into contributing so that you can increase the value of your perk through our bonus perks.
If you want to get a tattoo of a QR code linking to this campaign, we'll provide your inker with the graphic. Go for it!


Thanks for reading, and we hope you'll help us with our goal. Also, world peace.

story:
What is Game Related?

We started Game Related because we couldn't stop playing video games, and we knew we could make our obsession much less expensive. And much more fun.

Game Related is a subscription based service that allows you to trade the games you're tired of playing for the games you can't wait to play!  You can trade your games for other used games with gamers across Canada; or for the latest and greatest games from Game Related. 

We're raising money to allow us to lower our subscription costs for you, our users. It will also allow us to buy our games in greater values, again, lowering the costs to our users. We just want to smartly deliver value to gamers like us.

If you turn a gaming console on at least once a month, we're positive Game Related is for you. But if you're not into donating right now, but you agree with us that it's a good idea, then please: Share! a Tweet orlike our campaign on Facebook. Help us get the word out there and make gaming less expensive in Canada!

How Does It Work?

What We Need & What You Get:

Primarily, we believe that Game Related is something that gamers want in their lives. This round of funding will help make our continued existence more certain and more rewarding for our users by helping us to offer the following to you.

  • No mark ups on any new games we sell! We know games aren't cheap. We are going to change that by selling all our new games at wholesale prices and what ever discount we get, we are going to pass that right on to you.
  • Offer you 50% off the trade-in cost when you trade in your pre-owned 3 star games. 
  • A more engaging social platform that makes it easier not just to connect with other gamers, but to instantly trade, find the games you want, share each other’s reviews, opinions and comments on all your favourite games and even build a network to know what games your friends are trading, what they want and what they will be playing next so you can join them.
  • A rewards program which pays you back $15 every time you spend $60 on pre-owned games which you can accumulate, that can go as far a saving you $15 on a new game, to getting you free games or even a free console.
  •  Also, we want to give you 33% off when you buy 3 pre-owned games that are the same price.

But we're also going to make it fun. Take a look at our perks which include:

  • A discounted or a one year free membership to Game Related.
  • A limited edition "just-for-this-campaign" Game Related t-shirt signed by our team.
  • "Thank You" on sponsorship mailer: The next 500 games sent out from Game Related will include a personalized message from the founder and a list of all the sponsors (or their associated company, twitter handle, etc) that made Game Related possible.
  • Draw for Sennheiser U320: A multi-platform gaming headset will be given to the victor of the draw, if the campaign reaches $30,000. Different perks give the donor different amounts of ballots.
  • Passes to Fan Expo Canada 2014 or "Comic-Con North" with guests like Stan Lee and more. 



Questions and Answers:

Who is behind Game Related?

Behind Game Related are Ebi Enisuoh and Brent Hutzal, Ebi is the founder and takes care of the day to day operations of Game Related and Brent is the CFO that takes care of Game Related`s financials.

Ebi Enisuoh: Video games are my passion and always will be, I have been working on Game Related for the past 5 years to solve a lot of the problems that gamers have and find unfair with the way games are being sold and traded, I have a strong sales background that has taught me to put customers over profit, innovation and relationship building . I’m a family man who’s married to an awesome woman and the most supportive wife ever, and a new dad to an unbelievably awesome little boy who is now a year and 3 months. 

Brent Hutzal: I provide professional and business services for small businesses in southwestern Ontario and the GTA, including Business Strategy, Consulting, Project Management, Bookkeeping, Remote Controller, and Remote CFO services. I love spending time with my wife and 4-year old daughter.


Why is Game Related better than just trading my game in at my local Game Stop, etc?

We’re way better than "Big Box Stores" or any other video game retailer because our goal is to get games to you at the lowest price possible. Our trading system is better because it’s built to put gamers first, with our trade in system, you will never trade in more than 3 games to get the game you want, so we give you more value for your used games, Our trade in system also gets you up to 3 games by trading in only 1 of your games. Your trade in also benefits other gamers as well, giving them the opportunity to trade for the games you traded in or buy them for $5 to $30, saving gamers more money than any other retailer.

How are trades assessed? How does the star rating system work?

All games in our data base are given a star rating of 1 to 3, these star ratings are determined based on the age of the game, what gamers thing about the game and how they feel about it, we then take that information and give the game a rating of 1, 2 or 3 stars, 1 being games that gamers have little to no interested in, to 3 being games that gamers are very excited about and can’t wait to be released, If extra copies of a game remains in our trade inventory for one month from it's release date, it will then be put on sale and discounted by 60% off it's retail price. If a user wants a game, all they have to do is offer enough games to equal the star rating of the game they want, if a user offers a game that is above the star rating of the game they want, they can select more games they want to equal the star rating of the game they are offering. A game will keep it’s star rating for up to 4 months then decrease by one star every 4 months and remain at one star until it is no longer accepted by Game Related.

Why was Game Related started?

Game Related started as an alternative to corporate video game retailers, we wanted to create something that put gamers first and was always looking for ways to save gamers money. We know a lot of gamers aren't happy with the value they get for their used games and new games aren’t getting any cheaper, so we set out to change that, by offering more value on used games and in return selling those used games at very low prices. We then thought to ourselves, "How can we lower the cost of new games?" We decided to sell all our new games at wholesale price and create a loyalty program that can be used to discount new games even further. We want to get gamers to play and discover more games for less money.

How can I browse available games?

You can always browse available games by checking our trade or sell page, also on the trade and sell tabs on our home page, we don’t upload games if we do not have them in our inventory.

What is the origin of the name?

When we came up with the idea, we wanted a platform where gamers can buy, sell and trade anything related to video games, so we then decided to call the site Game Related, as time went on we thought to ourselves that there are too broad a range of video game related products so we simplified the concept of the site for now.

Isn’t it expensive to mail my games?

Shipping is the one thing that we are constantly trying to reduce; if you have a trusted network of people on Game Related you trade with, you can ship without tracking for about $2.20 through Canada Post. If you are trading with Game Related, we take care of the shipping cost. We introduced a lot of our discounts to offset shipping as well so we can continue to have lower prices then any other retailers.

I’m not a heavy gamer, is this service for me?

Most definitely! By not being a heavy gamer meaning you don’t want to spend a lot of money on the games that you do play, with Game Related you save a lot of money by trading in the games that you no longer play to get the new games you want for no more than $30. If you are not the type to buy games when they are first released, then get a pre-owned copy with Game Related from $5 to $30 and earn your $15 credit every time you spend $60 on pre-owned games that can be used to help you save more on new games that you may want in the future. 

Can you give me a real example of a trade?

A user recently traded their copy of Thief [PS3] (a 3 star game), for a new copy of Assassins Creed IV: Black Flag [PS4] (a 2 star game) and a new copy of The Last of Us [PS3] (a 1 star game).

Both of these games are currently still over $60 each at retail, at the time of this writing.

In October 2013, a user traded in Asura's Wrath, Twisted Metal (PS3) and Street Fighter X Tekken ( all 1 star games) for Batman: Arkham Origins (a 3 star game at the time).

In November 2013, a user traded in Ninja Gaiden 3, Anarchy Reigns, and Crysis 3 ( all 1 star games) for Battlefield 4 for PS4 (a 3 star game at the time).

Are there any restrictions?

Currently no, but with our new updates there will be only one restriction, to add as much value to Game Related and offer those who buy pre-owned games from us the lowest prices possible, we will only accept trade in's going back as far as 2 years from the games release date. The reason being is because games that are really old are already sold at very low prices at retailers due to the lack of demand, even if we where to sell these games as low as possible, we would still have the additional cost of shipping, which would bring the cost of the game to the same price you would pay in store or slightly higher, and we are all about offering the lowest prices. Plus it gives our users the chance to trade those games with each other for way less then they would spend in store!  

How is shipping covered to Game Related? From Game Related?

With our upcoming updates, Game Related will cover the shipping cost whenever you trade with us, we`ll provide you with a pre-paid shipping label sent to your email and also in the package of the game you receive from us to send your game to us, then notify you through email when we have shipped our game to you.

How do you know whether or not I’ve sent my game? How do I know you’re sending a game to me?

We notify all our users through email when we have accepted their trade and sent out there game, the email will also have a tracking number so you can track your package through Canada Post.

We are going to be supplying our users with pre-paid shipping labels that they can use to send their games to us, we then track the game on our end until we receive it.

Who can join? Can Americans join?

Currently Game Related is only available to Canadians, but we do have plans to make it available to Americans in the near future.

That's all for now, but:

Share!

If you have any other questions, just email me. Seriously. Anything.

Ebiala Dot Enisuoh At Game Related Dot Ca

story:
THANKS TO ALL OUR CONTRIBUTORS, THE SHOW IS GOING AHEAD!
VISIT THE OFFICIAL WEBSITE
 

www.screen7.co.uk/adventurex

 
 
ALL NEW VENUE IN
CENTRAL LONDON !

www.screen7.co.uk/adventurex

The UK's first & finest adventure game gathering is set to return in December (15th & 16th) this year, in London, UK. With guest speakers, games to see & play, short game design masterclasses, competitions and plenty of space to meet and greet, it's a must-visit show for any adventure game fan, developer & those just curious.

story:
JULY 22ND: PERKS HAVE BEEN UPDATED!

FOLLOW US!

  • Twitter: https://twitter.com/pixeltailgames
  • Facebook: http://facebook.com/pixeltailgames
  • Twitch: http://twitch.tv/pixeltailgames
  • Website: http://www.towerunite.com
  • Forums: http://forums.pixeltailgames.com
  • Newsletter: http://www.pixeltailgames.com/newsletter
  • Press Kit: http://www.pixeltailgames.com/press/sheet.php?p=tower_unite




Full list of funding milestones can be found near the bottom of the campaign.

Tower Unite is a community-based virtual world party game with online games, entertainment, and activities. Powered by Unreal Engine 4.

Every aspect of Tower Unite allows for online multiplayer interaction. It's a living and evolving online game world, driven by the community. Play games online with your friends, or make new friends from around the world.

Tower Unite isn't just a single game. It's a union of games, united by the community. It's all about having fun with friends!


  • Play multiplayer games of various genres online with friends.
  • Customize yourself with clothing and accessories.
  • Use lots of different movement items such as jetpacks, wings, and rollerblades.
  • Furnish and design the layout of your personal space (the Condo) with furniture and interactive toys.
  • Invite other players over to your Condo for parties and mini-games.
  • Watch synchronized YouTube™ videos in a virtual theater or your Condo.
  • Hang out at a nightclub and listen to music synchronized with the environment and every other player!
  • Join official servers or host your own server.
  • Hang out with your friends or find new friends!

Remember when games had a single price for all the content? 
We do. Which is why Tower Unite has ABSOLUTELY...

Pay once and never again! Enjoy all that Tower Unite has to offer for just $15.

  • Steam Workshop support so players can add their own custom items to the game.
  • Receive free DLC for life and developer support.
  • Interact in new ways with gamepad support, and additional peripheral support in future updates.
We also plan to use every Steam feature available to us including: Steam Cloud, Inventory, Friends, VOIP, Achievements, Trading Cards, and Steam Workshop.
We'll be working towards proper VR intregration, starting with Oculus Rift and Vive!


Tower Unite comes equipped with a powerful multimedia system. Watch synchronized YouTube™ videos or listen to music from Soundcloud. We’ll be constantly adding support for more media services for you and your friends to share and enjoy from within the game.


Unlike other virtual world games, Tower Unite is hosted, managed, and powered by the players.

We will be hosting official servers, and you'll be able to host Tower Unite servers yourself!

There are two types of servers:

  • Ranked: Saves progress across all ranked servers and distributes Units (our in-game currency).

  • Free: Saves progress on its own server, doesn't distribute Units, but allows for complete customization of the gameplay.

You’ll also have a slew of moderation tools built in to handle players to enforce your own rules. With your own servers you can even create your own items and accessories, ranked or not!


Tower is made of up three main core sections of gameplay:
  • The Condo - your virtual home.
  • The Plaza - the gathering point that everything connects to.
  • The Game Worlds - games which let you earn units, to buy items with.

In Tower Unite everyone has their own personal space, which we call a Condo. This space is fully customizable, bottom to top. From the floor plan and the furnishings to the landscaping of the garden, you can tweak it however you like. It's a space that defines you, and acts as the gathering point for you and your friends.

Watch YouTube™ videos, listen to music on Soundcloud, or just chat with your friends.

From the Condo you can exit through your front door into a bigger online experience called the Plaza. The Plaza connects players from around the globe using an intuitive matchmaking system. If there is no Plaza to connect to - then you will automatically create one.

The Plaza acts as a gathering point, like a shopping mall. The Plaza has a casino, an arcade, theaters, stores, attractions, and Game World ports. You connect and meet new players at the Plaza.

Shops are available to further customize your look, condo, and more. You will be able to unlock clothing, furniture, toys, pets, and more.


 On top of that you'll be able to customize your avatar in various ways, such as:

  • Changing clothing
  • Altering height, weight, and definition
  • Adjusting facial features, including eye color
  • Altering hair color and style
  • Adjusting skin tone
  • Wearing tons of different accessories like hats, glasses, earrings, necklaces, wrist bands, watches, rings, backpacks, belt items, and particles.


The Arcade features interactive 2D games and numerous indoor activities such as bowling, and skee ball.


The Boardwalk is a relaxing oceanfront with constantly expanding outside activities like a ferris wheel, boardwalk games, pool, and water slides.


The Casino lets you gamble virtual chips with your friends. It has Blackjack, Slots, Roulette, Poker (Texas Hold 'Em, 5 Card Draw), and video machines.


The Theater and Nightclub are places where everyone can share and discover new videos and media with their friends.


The Plaza is an infinitely expanding location- based on community feedback, we plan to constantly provide additions and new activities to this area.

And here’s the cool part: once you’ve gotten a group of people together in the Plaza you can then go to a Game World.


Game Worlds are large multiplayer games that you can enjoy with 6-18 players, depending on the world’s rules.

Each Game World has its own gameplay mechanics and genre. We have 10 Game Worlds planned - and the more funding we get, the more Game Worlds we can deliver for the initial launch.


As you play games in Tower Unite you collect points called Units. Units can be used to unlock furniture items, toys, clothing, and other neat in-game items. You can also gamble Units at the Casino, duel players for Units, and trade Units with other players.

Oh, and you have to earn Units. There will never be a way to purchase Units. Unlike most virtual world games, this isn't a pay-to-win game.

There will also be tons of achievements, in-game trophies, badges, and item-awards (milestones) to achieve. Tower Unite is very achievement heavy, allowing for strong replayability.

We want players to feel like they all have an equal chance at getting the items in the game. We care about our community and we strongly believe in the idea that a game should only incur a one-time cost (the purchase price) and that all of its content should be available at no extra charge.

Tower Unite is a spiritual successor of one of the most popular gamemodes on Garry’s Mod, GMod Tower. GMod Tower, which runs on the Source Engine, is where we invented the core ideas and concepts for Tower Unite. GMod Tower has been available for free to the public for over five years and has constantly evolved.

One of our strongest influence is our community. We have listened, discussed with, and implemented ideas that our players came up with. We wouldn't be here if it weren't for our community’s undying support for us. We’re proud to have 30 thousand active users on GMod Tower!

We’re keeping that same attitude for Tower Unite. That’s why everything that we implement will be made for the community or requested by the community. Just like we did with GMod Tower, we aim to have constant free feature updates for Tower Unite.

PixelTail Games is a small independent group of 9 talented people from all over the globe. Back in 2009, we bonded together over collective passion for GMod Tower, the very project that inspired Tower Unite. And just like that we realized quickly that we loved creating games and that we wanted to expand our efforts beyond the confines of a Source modification.

Over the years, we've passionately worked on free modifications for the Source engine. Specializing in online multiplayer games, such as GMod Tower, we enable players from around the world to connect with friends and have fun.

Projects such as:

  • GMTower, the massively multiplayer experience and Tower Unite’s predecessor.
  • Elevator: Source; a one of a kind coop elevator simulator.
  • Cinema, an online theater experience that allows you to watch movies and videos with your friends.

You can read more about us on our press site: http://www.pixeltailgames.com/press/

For over five years, we've been providing content to our community for free.

We love what we do, especially seeing the incredible amount of feedback from the community. Tower Unite is a large project that requires a decent budget to pull off. Without your help, it will never be possible for us to make this game.

For over a year, we have been iterating on concepts for Tower Unite as a standalone game and we are finally ready to make it happen. We shipped our last mod for the Garry’s Mod platform, GMod Tower: Lobby 2 and now we’re ready to make our own standalone title.

Tower Unite is more than a game-- it’s a social network. Meeting new people across the globe is a phenomenon that we love to contribute to. We believe that a standalone product which cultivates this is definitely worth making.

We believe strongly in our community and that's why we believe in crowd-funding. If you also believe in this project as much as we do, we urge you to help us. Crowd-funding gives us the ability to be personally connected to our community right from the beginning of development. You are the producers of our game.



This is a flex funding campaign, meaning every bit of the proceeds will go towards development of this game. Because Game Worlds are large projects in and of themselves, we have specific funding milestones (detailed in the funding rewards below) that will allow us to add more Game Worlds by early access release.

After the campaign is over, we will open voting on which Game Worlds should be developed first. We will always keep our backers and community up to date on all our plans going forward.

Our timeline for our project may change should we go over funding, as we will use the extra money to develop more Game Worlds.






We understand that this game is a huge undertaking. That's why we've spent the last half year working hard on developing a playable demo and alpha. And we have it. Everything you see in the video is within the game and represents a portion of what our game looks and feels like. It also shows how ambitious we are.

GMod Tower was ambitious in itself and it's been available to the public for 5 years and from that you get an idea of how we handle ourselves. We've been taking care of a large online community consisting of over 280 thousand players from around the globe. On top of that, we've been supported by over 7,000 donors since before this campaign. We’re confident in what we’re doing and we can complete this project.

We estimate that this project will take us around 8 months to get feature complete - and once it’s ready we will launch an Early Access on Steam. It'll also help us get the feedback we need from the community as well as generate more interest and revenue to keep us going as a company.

Another risk that we take very seriously -- the Game Worlds. You might be worried that we have too many planned, but most of the Game Worlds are based on the gamemodes we made for GMod Tower. Most are enhanced versions of mini-games we have already released and know are fun. We urge anyone who is unsure to check out what we did in GMod Tower to get an idea of the Game Worlds we have planned.

We are completely devoted to this project. This is a project we’re passionate about and one that sits deeply in our hearts.

We've learned a lot from the previous projects we've worked on and developed our skill-sets to a point where we’re able to create amazing content independently.

Our biggest risk is not being funded. We absolutely need your support so we can deliver a game that everyone can enjoy.


What would crowd-funding be without goodies to help motivate you to contribute? Here’s a run-down all of the individual rewards we’re offering.

Keep in mind we have zero physical rewards. This is so we can focus on developing the game itself instead of shipping physical rewards.


And here's how all the rewards bundle.




This project is large, and we understand that you might still have a few questions to ask even after taking in all of this information.

Please head over to our community forums for regularly updated FAQ: http://forums.pixeltailgames.com/t/tower-unite-frequently-asked-questions/38

Please feel free to use our forums to post questions as well! We'll be answering questions and concerns as quickly as possible.


Thank you so much for giving us this wonderful opportunity and we look forward to building the future of Tower Unite with you!
- PixelTail Games
story_txt:
JULY 22ND: PERKS HAVE BEEN UPDATED!

FOLLOW US!

Twitter: https://twitter.com/pixeltailgames


Facebook: http://facebook.com/pixeltailgames


Twitch: http://twitch.tv/pixeltailgames


Website: http://www.towerunite.com


Forums: http://forums.pixeltailgames.com


Newsletter: http://www.pixeltailgames.com/newsletter


Press Kit: http://www.pixeltailgames.com/press/sheet.php?p=tower_unite











Full list of funding milestones can be found near the bottom of the campaign.

Tower Unite is a community-based virtual world party game with online games, entertainment, and activities. Powered by Unreal Engine 4.Every aspect of Tower Unite allows for online multiplayer interaction. It's a living and evolving online game world, driven by the community. Play games online with your friends, or make new friends from around the world.Tower Unite isn't just a single game. It's a union of games, united by the community. It's all about having fun with friends!


Tower Unite will be available on PC, Mac, and Linux - distributed via Steam.




Play multiplayer games of various genres online with friends.
Customize yourself with clothing and accessories.
Use lots of different movement items such as jetpacks, wings, and rollerblades.

Furnish and design the layout of your personal space (the Condo) with furniture and interactive toys.


Invite other players over to your Condo for parties and mini-games.
Watch synchronized YouTube™ videos in a virtual theater or your Condo.
Hang out at a nightclub and listen to music synchronized with the environment and every other player!
Join official servers or host your own server.
Hang out with your friends or find new friends!

Remember when games had a single price for all the content? We do. Which is why Tower Unite has ABSOLUTELY...



Pay once and never again! Enjoy all that Tower Unite has to offer for just $15.




Steam Workshop support so players can add their own custom items to the game.

Receive free DLC for life and developer support.

Interact in new ways with gamepad support, and additional peripheral support in future updates.


We also plan to use every Steam feature available to us including: Steam Cloud, Inventory, Friends, VOIP, Achievements, Trading Cards, and Steam Workshop.
We'll be working towards proper VR intregration, starting with Oculus Rift and Vive!


Tower Unite isn’t just a walking around simulator. You can run, jump, crouch, use jetpacks, get drunk, dance, sit, stand, throw-up, lounge in pool tubes, give high fives, and much much more. You can of course also: voice chat, text chat, group up with friends, and party with your friends! The possibilities are endless!



Tower Unite comes equipped with a powerful multimedia system. Watch synchronized YouTube™ videos or listen to music from Soundcloud. We’ll be constantly adding support for more media services for you and your friends to share and enjoy from within the game.




Unlike other virtual world games, Tower Unite is hosted, managed, and powered by the players.
We will be hosting official servers, and you'll be able to host Tower Unite servers yourself!
There are two types of servers:

Ranked: Saves progress across all ranked servers and distributes Units (our in-game currency).
Free: Saves progress on its own server, doesn't distribute Units, but allows for complete customization of the gameplay.
You’ll also have a slew of moderation tools built in to handle players to enforce your own rules. With your own servers you can even create your own items and accessories, ranked or not!






Tower is made of up three main core sections of gameplay:

The Condo - your virtual home.
The Plaza - the gathering point that everything connects to.

The Game Worlds - games which let you earn units, to buy items with.





In Tower Unite everyone has their own personal space, which we call a Condo. This space is fully customizable, bottom to top. From the floor plan and the furnishings to the landscaping of the garden, you can tweak it however you like. It's a space that defines you, and acts as the gathering point for you and your friends.
Watch YouTube™ videos, listen to music on Soundcloud, or just chat with your friends.





From the Condo you can exit through your front door into a bigger online experience called the Plaza. The Plaza connects players from around the globe using an intuitive matchmaking system. If there is no Plaza to connect to - then you will automatically create one.
The Plaza acts as a gathering point, like a shopping mall. The Plaza has a casino, an arcade, theaters, stores, attractions, and Game World ports. You connect and meet new players at the Plaza.


Shops are available to further customize your look, condo, and more. You will be able to unlock clothing, furniture, toys, pets, and more.




 On top of that you'll be able to customize your avatar in various ways, such as:

Changing clothing
Altering height, weight, and definition
Adjusting facial features, including eye color
Altering hair color and style
Adjusting skin tone
Wearing tons of different accessories like hats, glasses, earrings, necklaces, wrist bands, watches, rings, backpacks, belt items, and particles.








The Arcade features interactive 2D games and numerous indoor activities such as bowling, and skee ball.








The Boardwalk is a relaxing oceanfront with constantly expanding outside activities like a ferris wheel, boardwalk games, pool, and water slides.




The Casino lets you gamble virtual chips with your friends. It has Blackjack, Slots, Roulette, Poker (Texas Hold 'Em, 5 Card Draw), and video machines.





The Theater and Nightclub are places where everyone can share and discover new videos and media with their friends.





The Plaza is an infinitely expanding location- based on community feedback, we plan to constantly provide additions and new activities to this area.
And here’s the cool part: once you’ve gotten a group of people together in the Plaza you can then go to a Game World.



Game Worlds are large multiplayer games that you can enjoy with 6-18 players, depending on the world’s rules.
Each Game World has its own gameplay mechanics and genre. We have 10 Game Worlds planned - and the more funding we get, the more Game Worlds we can deliver for the initial launch.


















As you play games in Tower Unite you collect points called Units. Units can be used to unlock furniture items, toys, clothing, and other neat in-game items. You can also gamble Units at the Casino, duel players for Units, and trade Units with other players.
Oh, and you have to earn Units. There will never be a way to purchase Units. Unlike most virtual world games, this isn't a pay-to-win game.
There will also be tons of achievements, in-game trophies, badges, and item-awards (milestones) to achieve. Tower Unite is very achievement heavy, allowing for strong replayability.


We want players to feel like they all have an equal chance at getting the items in the game. We care about our community and we strongly believe in the idea that a game should only incur a one-time cost (the purchase price) and that all of its content should be available at no extra charge.

Tower Unite is a spiritual successor of one of the most popular gamemodes on Garry’s Mod, GMod Tower. GMod Tower, which runs on the Source Engine, is where we invented the core ideas and concepts for Tower Unite. GMod Tower has been available for free to the public for over five years and has constantly evolved.
One of our strongest influence is our community. We have listened, discussed with, and implemented ideas that our players came up with. We wouldn't be here if it weren't for our community’s undying support for us. We’re proud to have 30 thousand active users on GMod Tower!
We’re keeping that same attitude for Tower Unite. That’s why everything that we implement will be made for the community or requested by the community. Just like we did with GMod Tower, we aim to have constant free feature updates for Tower Unite.



PixelTail Games is a small independent group of 9 talented people from all over the globe. Back in 2009, we bonded together over collective passion for GMod Tower, the very project that inspired Tower Unite. And just like that we realized quickly that we loved creating games and that we wanted to expand our efforts beyond the confines of a Source modification.
Over the years, we've passionately worked on free modifications for the Source engine. Specializing in online multiplayer games, such as GMod Tower, we enable players from around the world to connect with friends and have fun.
Projects such as:


GMTower, the massively multiplayer experience and Tower Unite’s predecessor.

Elevator: Source; a one of a kind coop elevator simulator.

Cinema, an online theater experience that allows you to watch movies and videos with your friends.

You can read more about us on our press site: http://www.pixeltailgames.com/press/

For over five years, we've been providing content to our community for free.

Tower Unite is more than a game-- it’s a social network. Meeting new people across the globe is a phenomenon that we love to contribute to. We believe that a standalone product which cultivates this is definitely worth making.
We believe strongly in our community and that's why we believe in crowd-funding. If you also believe in this project as much as we do, we urge you to help us. Crowd-funding gives us the ability to be personally connected to our community right from the beginning of development. You are the producers of our game.

Because Game Worlds are large projects in and of themselves, we have specific funding milestones (detailed in the funding rewards below) that will allow us to add more Game Worlds by early access release.

Everything you see in the video is within the game and represents a portion of what our game looks and feels like. It also shows how ambitious we are.
GMod Tower was ambitious in itself and it's been available to the public for 5 years and from that you get an idea of how we handle ourselves. We've been taking care of a large online community consisting of over 280 thousand players from around the globe. On top of that, we've been supported by over 7,000 donors since before this campaign. We’re confident in what we’re doing and we can complete this project.
We estimate that this project will take us around 8 months to get feature complete - and once it’s ready we will launch an Early Access on Steam. It'll also help us get the feedback we need from the community as well as generate more interest and revenue to keep us going as a company.
Another risk that we take very seriously -- the Game Worlds. You might be worried that we have too many planned, but most of the Game Worlds are based on the gamemodes we made for GMod Tower. Most are enhanced versions of mini-games we have already released and know are fun. We urge anyone who is unsure to check out what we did in GMod Tower to get an idea of the Game Worlds we have planned.

And here's how all the rewards bundle.

story:
Our story

My name is Bazyl Piotrowski and I am a passionate runner and outdoor physical fitness trainer with born2move.co.nz.

On Saturday 14th September, three of my friends, Owen Frentz, Tracey Benjamin, Michael Dall and I will run one of the toughest road marathons in New Zealand, the Legend Marathon (http://thelegend.co.nz/)...not once BUT TWICE (i.e. back-to-back) for a total of 84.4 kilometers (or 52.4 miles). I am doing it to raise money for Clinton Davies.

The Legend - The man

Clinton is a BLIND WRESTLER, a wrestling coach (SEE VIDEO ABOVE), an inspiration and A BLOODY LEGEND who is hoping to fulfill his dream of being the first blind wrestler to attend the World Championships and the Commonwealth Championships in Budapest in September 2013. He will be competing against able bodied athletes who have no disabilities whatsoever.

Clinton has already gained selection to the New Zealand team but, because wrestling is not one of the top three (rugby, cricket and netball) sports in New Zealand, Clinton has to fund his own way to the World Championships and the Commonwealth Chamionships.

Recent TV New Zealand clip
Radio Sport New Zealand interview

What We Need & What You Get

Clinton has to raise NZ$6000 to cover the cost of his travel and accomodation to the World Championships and Commonwealth Championships in Budapest in September 2013. He has already raised NZ$3000 himself and, together with your help, we would like to help him raise the rest.

  • All monies raised will go to Clinton Davies to cover his travel and accomodation costs
  • Donate $10 and you'll get a teaspoon of good karma coming your way
  • Donate $20 and you'll get a tablespoon of good karma coming your way
  • Donate $30 and you'll get a cup of good karma coming your way
  • Donate $40 and you'll get a bucket of good karma coming your way
  • Donate $50 and you'll get a shedload of good karma coming your way

The Impact

If we can raise enough funds to get Clinton to the World Championships and Commonwealth Championships, this will be a dream come true for Clinton.

Clinton's story is a great example that NO OBSTACLE IS EVER TOO BIG. He is an inspiration to me and I hope he will be an inspiration to you too.

Clinton has won numerous awards for his wrestling

  • Commonwealth Champs - Bronze medal - Greco Roman Men’s 74kg, 2009 and 2011
  • Oceania Champs - Gold medal - Greco Roman Men’s 74kg, 2013, Silver medal - Freestyle Men’s 74kg, 2012 and 2013

  • Australia Cup (including Australia, NZ, USA, Canada & Japan) - Gold medal - Greco Roman Men’s 74kg, 2011

  • New Zealand Champs - Gold Medal – Greco Roman Men’s 74kg, 2012, Bronze Medal – Freestyle Men’s 74kg, 2012
  • Blind Sportsman of the year 2008

and was a finalist for Coach of the Year at the Waitakere Sports Awards, 2013.

My achievements are nothing compared to Clinton's but this is my second attempt to raise money for a fantastic cause (I completed the Oxfam 100km Trailwalk in 2007 where my teams and I raised $21,000 for Oxfam). My personal best for the marathon is 3:06:00 and I recently completed a 55km training run in 5:00:00.

The Legend - The Marathon

The Legend Marathon is;

  • 42.2 kilometers (26.2 miles).
  • New Zealand's toughest road marathon course.
  • A local, West Auckland, event that follows most of Arthur Lydiard's famous Waiatarua training route through Glen Eden, Oratia, Waiatarua, Titirangi and Green Bay and ascends the 5km long brutal climb along West Coast Road from Oratia to Scenic Drive. Arthur's Waiatarua route has brought many a famous runner including Peter Snell, Barry Magee, Murray Halberg, Bill Baillie, Jeff Julian, Ray Puckett, John Walker, Lorraine Moller, Dick Quax, Rod Dixon and countless others to tears
  • http://thelegend.co.nz/

The double Legend - The double marathon

The double Legend marathon is;

  • 2 full laps of the Legend Marathon course - 84.4 kilometers (52.4 miles) in total.
  • We will start at 1:00am NZT on Saturday 14th September and complete one unsupported full lap (42.2km/26.2mi) of the Legend Marathon course.
  • We will finish the first full lap of the Legend Marathon course (42.2km/26.2mi) in time for the official start of the Legend Marathon at 6:30am NZT on Saturday 14th September and complete the second full lap (42.2km/26.2mi) of the Legend Marathon course as part of the official event.

Other ways you can help

If you can't contribute financially, please, please, please spread the word around your family, friends and colleagues.

Thank you so much.
